[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Frequests%2Fnew "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
# Submit a request
Your email address
Subject
Description
Please enter the details of your request. A member of our support staff will respond as soon as possible.
School ID(optional)
District ID(optional)
Other ID(optional)
Attachments(optional)
Add file or drop files here 
##### Thanks for reaching out! We’ll get back to you between the hours of 6 a.m. and 6 p.m. MT.

####  Let us help you! 
[ Contact Support ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

# Getting Started

###  [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)

  * [How to Log In to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online)


###  [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24192808156571-Additional-Features)
  * [How Do I Change My Password?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000669128-How-Do-I-Change-My-Password)
  * [Sign Up for the Studies Weekly Newsletter and Free Events](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24537856436123-Sign-Up-for-the-Studies-Weekly-Newsletter-and-Free-Events)

###  [Interested in a Free 60 Day Trial?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24195173349275-Interested-in-a-Free-60-Day-Trial)

title: How to Order Studies Weekly for Homeschool
meta_description: Homeschool families MUST order through the Homeschool Store. This article includes step-by-step instructions on how to place your order...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260804730270-How-to-Order-Studies-Weekly-for-Homeschool#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002825633-Ordering)
  3. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006715213-Ordering)


#  How to Order Studies Weekly for Homeschool 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Homeschool families MUST order through the [Homeschool Store](https://store.studiesweekly.com/#homeschool). This article includes step-by-step instructions on how to place your order for single homeschool families, associations, or charters.
  1. Navigate to [store.studiesweekly.com](https://store.studiesweekly.com/#homeschool). 
  2. Choose your state (or select National) from the drop-down menu in the top right corner.
  3. Select **HOMESCHOOL** on the top menu.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29740196598043)
  4. Select your subject on the [Homeschool](https://store.studiesweekly.com/#homeschool) main page.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29740276762267)


## **On the order page:**
  1. Choose the grade level of your student(s). Only one grade can be selected at a time.
  2. **Format:** Choose **Print & Online** (default) or choose **Online Only**.
  3. **Language:** If the publication is also offered in Spanish, there will be a Language field allowing you to choose English or Spanish.
  4. **Quantity:** Select the number of students.
  5. Click **Add to Cart**. To add another grade or subject start back at step 1.![Homeschool_Order_Page.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770308021275)
  6. Click the shopping cart icon in the top right corner.
  7. Review your order, then click the **Checkout** button.![Homeschool_Checkout_Page.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770325844507)


## **Checkout Steps:**
During Checkout, you will see the option to **Log In** (if you have an account already) or to **Create Account**.
![Login_to_Checkout.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770311754139)
Once you have logged into your account, fill out the fields in the Checkout form. The steps can be found in the tabs below.
**Your Store account will not be directly associated with the Billing and Shipping accounts of your order. It will allow you to view the status of all orders placed under that login through the store.**
Order as a Homeschool Parent  Order for Homeschool Charters
  1. Enter the recipient's **First Name** and **Last Name**.
  2. Enter the **Email Address** you would like to use for shipping notifications
     *        * The email entered will be used as your Studies Weekly Online account login.
  3. Fill out the fields for the **Street Address** , **City** , **State** , and **Zip Code** , and **Phone Number**.
  4. Select the **School Year** the order is for.
  5. Choose when to ship. See [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-Selecting-Shipping-Preferences) to learn more.
     *        * Select **Ship all materials together** if you want all materials to come at the same time when they are all ready.
       * Select **Ship each product when in stock** if you are okay with materials coming separately, if they are ready at different times.
       * Select **I can receive shipment at any time** OR select date ranges for when you are NOT available to receive shipment.
  6. Select **Card** or **Purchase Order** and enter the required information. 
     *        * Homeschool parents will **NOT** use the Purchase Order option.
       * If you are representing a Homeschool Association or Charter and using a PO, please enter the PO number and select your organization from the list. If your organization is not listed among the options, please contact us at or 866-311-8734.
  7. If the billing and shipping information are different, uncheck the box next to **Billing Address** and add the new billing address.
     *        * If your organization is not listed among the options for billing and shipping or if an edit of the information is needed, please contact **support@studiesweekly.com** or **866-311-8734**.
  8. Review the information and select the box stating you have read the **Terms & Conditions**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29739935491099)
  9. Then click **Continue to Payment** or **Place Order**.


Homeschool Charters can choose to order in bulk and have publications sent to the Charter for distribution. This option is ideal when one printed Teacher Edition is necessary with up to 25 Student Editions. 
They can be ordered from the [district ordering site](https://store.studiesweekly.com/#school) and by following these steps:
  1. Navigate to [store.studiesweekly.com](https://store.studiesweekly.com/).
  2. Enter the shipping recipient's **First Name** and **Last Name**
  3. Enter the email address you would like to use for shipping notifications. 
     * The email entered will be used as the Studies Weekly Online account login
  4. Select the **Shipping Address Type**.
  5. Enter your school zip code, then select your school from the drop-down menu -**OR-** select **Homeschool/Custom** and enter your home address.
  6. Select the **School Year** the order is for.
  7. Optionally, you can add the **School Start Date**.
  8. Choose your shipping options. See [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-Selecting-Shipping-Preferences) to learn more.
     * **Ship all materials together** if you want all materials to come at the same time when they are all ready.
     * Select **Ship each product when in stock** if you are okay with materials coming separately, if they are ready at different times.
     * Select **I can receive shipment at any time** OR select date ranges for when you are NOT available to receive shipment.
  9. Enter a Discount code, if you have one.
  10. Select**Card** or**Purchase Order** and enter requested information.
     * If you are using a PO, please enter the PO number and select your organization from the list. If your organization is not listed among the options, please contact us at or 866-311-8734
  11. If the billing and shipping information are different, uncheck the box next to **Billing Address** and enter the address.
  12. Review the information and select the box stating you have read the **Terms & Conditions**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29739935491099)
  13. Then click **Continue to Payment** or **Place Order**.


Important
To avoid duplication of your order, please do not send a copy of the PO to Studies Weekly.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Order Studies Weekly for Homeschool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260804730270-How-to-Order-Studies-Weekly-for-Homeschool)
  * [How to Order from the Studies Weekly Online Store](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019253213-How-to-Order-from-the-Studies-Weekly-Online-Store)
  * [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-How-to-Select-Shipping-Preferences)


##  Can't find what you're looking for? 
####  Let us help you! 
[ Contact Support ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)
© Studies Weekly

###### Support hours: 6 a.m. - 6 p.m. MT.

title: How to Get Started

#  How to Get Started 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
### **Welcome to Studies Weekly!**
Once publications have been ordered, you may be asking yourself, _"What is my next step?_ _How do I ensure successful use of the curriculum?"_ This article is to help you with where to start first.
Click any of the links below to help you get started using Studies Weekly:
  * [Get Started With Your Print Editions](https://www.studiesweekly.com/getting-started-with-studies-weekly/)
  * [How District and School Administrators Can Register](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012204533-How-District-and-School-Administrators-Can-Register)
  * [How to Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-an-Online-Account)
  * [Log into Your Studies Weekly Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [Order Additional Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006715213-Ordering)
  * [How to Navigate the Classes Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classes-Page)
  * [Add Publications to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom)


You can access the [Online Onboarding Guide here](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/personal_development/category/Online%20Onboarding%20Guide.pdf). In addition, we have a [Quick Guide](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/personal_development/category/Quick%20Start%20Guide.pdf) for those wanting an immediate start.
Still have questions? Visit the Live chat**Support** button found in the bottom of your screen or call Customer Support at (866) 311-8734.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24022735941403)
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started)
  * [How District and School Administrators Can Register](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012204533-How-District-and-School-Administrators-Can-Register)
  * [How To Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account)
  * [How to Log In to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online)

title: How to Find and Print Training and Resources

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6969588998683-How-to-Find-and-Print-Training-and-Resources "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18411960987803-Training-and-Resources)


#  How to Find and Print Training and Resources 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, teachers have access to a variety of **Training and Resources**. Those include interviews, project demos, virtual field trips, K-2 videos, and instructional resources that include graphic organizers, instructional strategy templates and more. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26977160521755)
After choosing a category, materials will be organized by sub categories. You can quickly find what you're looking for by using the search bar or filtering by PD Category. You can also use the **Media Type** dropdown to find specific media types (video, doc, or PDF). ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204182789659)
**Resources**
The **Resources** section is divided into sub categories including Student Artifacts, Primary Source Analysis Tools, Graphic Organizers, and Instructional Strategy Templates.
Some PDFs can be printed in English or Spanish. Click the ENG or ES buttons in the PDF box to print the version of your choice.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204170432283)
**Training**
The **Training** section offers on-demand training and resources to support initial and ongoing implementation including national webinar recordings and training videos. A key resource in this section is the [Online Onboarding Guide](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/personal_development/category/Online%20Onboarding%20Guide.pdf) PDF which gives educators a guided tour of the print and online materials, and access to relevant Help Center articles.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204182799387)
**Leveled Readers**
The **Leveled Readers** section provides on or above-grade-level books that are perfect for guided reading sessions. They are organized by K-2 grade level.
Some PDFs can be printed in English or Spanish. Click the ENG or ES buttons in the PDF box to print the version of your choice.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204182801947)
**Interviews**
The **Interviews** section includes primary source interviews with WWII and Vietnam veterans. Other incredible people share first-hand accounts of historical events in our videos. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204170437275)
**Project Time**
**Project Time** provides engaging videos that demonstrate simple science projects. They cover a wide range of topics including creating a solar oven to bending light; and are less than 5 minutes long. Prepare to be entertained!![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204182805147)
**Field Trips**
The **Field Trip** section offers virtual field trips in video format. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204170445339)
**K-2 Videos**
**K-2 Videos** include age-level appropriate content for grades K-2. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204182811931)
Additionally, in the bottom right corner of the Teacher Dashboard is our **Resource Center**. This gives teachers direct access to important Announcements, Help Center Articles, Customer Support, Live Chat, Company News, and our Studies Weekly Online Updates page.
![2023-07-10_16-16-24](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/17028301131035)
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Find and Print Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6969588998683-How-to-Find-and-Print-Training-and-Resources)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Instructional Strategy Templates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17282878681371-Studies-Weekly-Online-Instructional-Strategy-Templates)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Primary Source Analysis Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17282812984475-Studies-Weekly-Online-Primary-Source-Analysis-Tools)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Graphic Organizers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17258062993819-Studies-Weekly-Online-Graphic-Organizers)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Student Artifacts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17283150237467-Studies-Weekly-Online-Student-Artifacts)

  * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F34609972204699-March-2025-Product-Updates "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025)


#  March 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**New Standards Report**
The new Standards Report displays students' average score for the standards covered in a publication. Teachers will be able to see average scores for the Classroom and Individual students. To learn more visit the article [How to Navigate the Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33952794758299-How-to-Navigate-the-Standards-Report) in the Help Center. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34610002855067)
**Vocabulary Images with Vocabulary Words for the Week**
When users highlight a vocabulary term that is associated with an image, the image will appear next to the definition in the **Vocabulary** tab of the highlight box. To learn more visit the article [How To Use the Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool) in the Help Center. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34829925995163)
**Hot Text Question Type**
The new Customized Content question type, Hot Text, requires students to click a specific part or parts of a text to answer a question. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type). ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35113594548763)
**Export Report Data to a CSV**
With the exception of the Snapshot Report, Studies Weekly Online Reports can now be exported to a CSV file to a users device. Visit the [Reports Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) of the Help Center to find the report you are looking for. ![2025-03-20_15-50-10.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35164073117211)
**Date Range added to Reports**
With the exception of the Snapshot Report, Studies Weekly Online Reports can now be sorted by a specific date range. Visit the [Reports Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) of the Help Center to find the report you are looking for. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204377829787)
**View Button Added to Publication Cards**
The optional **View** button allows users to quickly open the **Table of Contents** , **Grade** , **Reports** , or **Teacher Notes** of a publication. Learn more about [accessing publications here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page). ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35257717208603)
**New Look for Teacher Resources within a Publication**
Teacher Resources within publications are now more accessible. A stationary panel, visible while scrolling, provides direct links to resources. The **Article title** , **Teacher Resources** , and **Previous** /**Next** buttons now remain stationary at the top of the page during scrolling, improving navigation efficiency. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35306039266459)

title: Clever - Pros and Cons
meta_description: Pros Cons    Single Sign-On Application Once Studies Weekly has synced your Clever roster data, your teachers, students, and admins...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13249037001371-Clever-Pros-and-Cons#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13249037001371-Clever-Pros-and-Cons "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Clever](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690797862939-Clever)


#  Clever - Pros and Cons 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Pros Cons 

Single Sign-On Application
    Once Studies Weekly has synced your Clever roster data, your teachers, students, and admins should immediately be able to log into Studies Weekly Online using the **Studies Weekly Online 3.0** SSO application. 

Filter Shared Data
    Before sharing your roster with the Studies Weekly application, Clever provides you with a way to filter the data you share so that accounts and classrooms are only created for teachers, students, and admins that are using Studies Weekly Online.     
  * Studies Weekly also recommends adjusting the sharing rules specific to the subject (Social Studies, Science, Early Learning, or Health and Wellness) depending on what your district has ordered. This will reduce confusion and prevent unnecessary classrooms from being created within each user account.



Substitute Teachers
    Progress in the Studies Weekly Online articles is stored in the classroom. While it is possible to add substitutes manually to the Clever roster and append them to the existing classrooms, we have seen many issues with this method. Incorporating a substitute into the Clever data can lead to lost classroom progress and student confusion by having access to multiple classrooms in Studies Weekly Online. 

Troubleshooting the Roster
    As with our other third-party rostering options, Clever often requires the assistance of both the Clever support team and the Studies Weekly rostering team when troubleshooting issues. In some cases, you may be required to also work with the support team for your SIS software since not all SIS databases are 100% compatible with Clever.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering - Clever FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13091988253979-Rostering-Clever-FAQs)
  * [Clever - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13249037001371-Clever-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [Clever - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13318348540827-Clever-Troubleshooting)

title: ClassLink - Pros and Cons
meta_description: Pros Cons    Simple Setup Process If your district already integrates your Student Information System (SIS) data into ClassLink, setting...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13280645120027-ClassLink-Pros-and-Cons#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13280645120027-ClassLink-Pros-and-Cons "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [ClassLink](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690817293339-ClassLink)


#  ClassLink - Pros and Cons 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Pros Cons 

Simple Setup Process
    If your district already integrates your Student Information System (SIS) data into ClassLink, setting up the integration between your Roster and Studies Weekly Online is a quick and simple process. 

Automated Roster Updates
    After we set up the integration between your ClassLink Roster and Studies Weekly Online, your roster data will be scheduled to sync on a nightly basis. If you ever need to add or remove a teacher, change a class, or update the credentials on an account, these changes automatically process during the nightly sync. 

Single Sign-On Application
    Once we have synced your ClassLink roster data, your teacher, student, and admin accounts will be available to use immediately.Rostered users can connect to Studies Weekly Online directly from ClassLink, or by selecting **LOGIN WITH CLASSLINK** on the [login page](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login). 

Filter Shared Data
    Before sharing your roster with the Studies Weekly application, ClassLink provides you with a way to filter the shared data so that accounts and classrooms are only created for teachers, students, and admins who are using Studies Weekly Online.     
  * Studies Weekly also recommends adjusting the sharing rules specific to the subject (Social Studies, Science, Early Learning, or Health and Wellness) depending on what your district has ordered. This will reduce confusion and prevent unnecessary classrooms from being created within each user account.



Substitute Teachers
    As students read, highlight, interact with, and answer questions about each article online, their progress is stored in the online classroom. When you have a substitute teacher, you will not be able to add them as a co-teacher to your classroom. Studies Weekly has seen issues when substitutes are added through ClassLink. It often causes students to be assigned to multiple classrooms (yours and the sub’s), and sometimes results in lost article progress. 

Troubleshooting the Roster
    As with our other third-party rostering options, ClassLink can sometimes require the assistance of both the ClassLink support team and the Studies Weekly rostering team when troubleshooting account issues.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering - ClassLink FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs)
  * [ClassLink - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13280645120027-ClassLink-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting)

title: How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms
meta_description: Teachers can edit, deactivate, and reactivate classrooms. Use the tabs below to learn how.    Edit Classroom  Teachers can edit classroom...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can edit, deactivate, and reactivate classrooms. Use the tabs below to learn how. 
**Edit Classroom**
Teachers can edit classroom settings, like the name, grade, subjects, and more. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click **Class Settings**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36419520382747)
  2. Edit the information you wish to change and click **Save**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37038784728987)The **Change Classroom Image** options include grade levels PK, TK, K, and numbers 1-12. Select a number for additional color options ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32597185457435)


**Deactivate a Classroom**
All Classes will be automatically deactivated the day after the End of School Date. To view or edit this date, open the Class Settings as mentioned in the **Edit Classroom** instructions. If you wish to deactivate a classroom before the End of School date you may do so at any time. Teachers can only deactivate the classes they create.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Select the **three dots![three_dots_icon.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12901510256155)** in the classroom card you want to deactivate. (This menu is only available if you created the classroom.)
  2. Choose **Deactivate**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35823015038747)
  3. In the pop-up window, click **Deactivate** again. This action can only be completed with classrooms the user has created. 


**Recover Deactivated Classroom**
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and on the **Classrooms** tab:
    1. Select the **Inactive** tab in the upper right corner.
    2. Click the **three dots** ![three_dots_icon.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12901510256155) for the classroom you want to reactivate. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35823015041179)
    3. Select **Reactivate**. 
    4. In the pop-up window, click **Reactivate** again. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35822975802011)


To go back to your active classrooms,in the upper left corner, select **Active**.
Note
If you do not see your classroom, select **Refresh Classrooms**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35822975809307)
Reactivated Classrooms do not lose their progress.

cleaned_markdown: Articles : How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms . What can we help you with? 1. (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us) 2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher) 3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms) How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms FollowNot yet followed by anyone Teachers can edit, deactivate, and reactivate classrooms. Use the tabs below to learn how. **Edit Classroom** Teachers can edit classroom settings, like the name, grade, subjects, and more. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** : 1. Click **Class Settings**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36419520382747) 2. Edit the information you wish to change and click **Save**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37038784728987)The **Change Classroom Image** options include grade levels PK, TK, K, and numbers 1-12. Select a number for additional color options ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32597185457435) **Deactivate a Classroom** All Classes will be automatically deactivated the day after the End of School Date. To view or edit this date, open the Class Settings as mentioned in the **Edit Classroom** instructions. If you wish to deactivate a classroom before the End of School date you may do so at any time. Teachers can only deactivate the classes they create. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** : 1. Select the **three dots![three_dots_icon.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12901510256155)** in the classroom card you want to deactivate. (This menu is only available if you created the classroom.) 2. Choose **Deactivate**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35823015038747) 3. In the pop-up window, click **Deactivate** again. This action can only be completed with classrooms the user has created. **Recover Deactivated Classroom** From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and on the **Classrooms** tab: 1. Select the **Inactive** tab in the upper right corner. 2. Click the **three dots** ![three_dots_icon.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12901510256155) for the classroom you want to reactivate. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35823015041179) 3. Select **Reactivate**. 4. In the pop-up window, click **Reactivate** again. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35822975802011) To go back to your active classrooms,in the upper left corner, select **Active**. Note If you do not see your classroom, select **Refresh Classrooms**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35822975809307) Reactivated Classrooms do not lose their progress. #  How to Complete a Crossword 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students might encounter a weekly Crossword if it has been enabled by their teacher. To complete a Crossword follow the steps below. 
![crossword gif.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27097737308059)
  1. Read the clues below the Crossword and choose the best answer from the **Word Bank** to solve the puzzle. (Teachers may disable the Word Bank to make it more challenging.)
  2. Click a box in the Crossword to type your response. If you make a mistake you can use the**Backspace** key to remove a letter. Or click on the letter you want to change.
  3. When you have finished, select the **Submit** button in the bottom right corner. 
Or, you can click **Save** and finish it later.

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [General FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510676842651-General-FAQs)


#  Legacy Science FAQ 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
With the Science publication, the student edition is bundled with three separate science units. Physical Science is the first section, then Earth Science, then Life Science. The teacher resource book also has three sections but in a slightly different order. Earth Science is first, then Life Science, then Physical Science. We have labels for each unit at the beginning of the week, on the worksheets, and on the assessment pages.We understand how the order of the different sections can be inconvenient, and we are looking into updating our teacher resource book next year to be in the same order as the student edition.Most people are familiar with our Social Studies publications, which have the student and teacher materials bundled together by quarters. However, our Science publications are broken down into 3 units; Earth Science, Life Science, and Physical Science. When you are viewing this publication online, you will be able to see Week 1-9 of Physical Science, then it starts over with Week 1 for Life Science, and again when it gets to Earth Science.The physical teacher materials are also divided by the 3 units. You may receive 3 booklets, one for each unit, or 1 booklet with three different sections. You will want to make sure you are using the appropriate unit section when you are teaching from your booklet. The online teacher materials will reflect the physical materials you received and show the 3 individual booklets by unit or all together in one booklet.

#  How to Clear Your Cache and Cookies 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Browsers save some information from websites in their cache and cookies. Clearing them can fix specific problems, like loading and formatting issues on the website. 
Google Chrome, Safari, Edge, and Firefox are some commonly used browsers. Other popular devices used by students are iPads and tablets. These devices have browsers preinstalled by the manufacturer already. But users can install browsers like Google Chrome and Firefox on iPads and tablets too. 
Click each link to see directions for clearing cache and cookies. 
After the cookies and cache have been cleared, close the browser by clicking the X in the upper right corner. Then you may reopen your browser.

meta_description: This article covers some of our most common questions we receive from ClassLink users. Additional questions can be directed to...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [ClassLink](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690817293339-ClassLink)


#  ClassLink - Troubleshooting 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article covers some of our most common questions we receive from ClassLink users. Additional questions can be directed to .
**My student is rostered, why can't they log in through ClassLink?**
1. Check if the student was added to the roster in ClassLink and shared to Studies Weekly, not just added to the Student Information System (SIS) data.
2. Check when they were added to the roster. Were they added after last night's sync? (Remember, we sync your roster data on a nightly basis).
3. Contact your district rostering administrator. They will need to log in through their rostering admin account, to check if the most recent sync was successful. If the sync failed, they can reach out to .
**Why can't our teachers invite co-teachers into their classroom?**
Teachers, students, and classrooms created through automated rostering can **only** be updated through the ClassLink rostering system. If a rostered teacher tries to invite a teacher to their rostered classroom, the new teacher won’t be able to join. They need to be **added** as a co-teacher of the classroom **on the ClassLink roster**.
**Why do my students see classes that aren’t from Studies Weekly in their account?**
If your students see other classes besides your Studies Weekly classroom, it is because your district rostering admin shared this information in their Student Information System (SIS) rostering data given to Studies Weekly.To avoid this, district rostering admins use ClassLink’s filtering options to narrow down what they are sharing. They can filter the shared data to remove classes, teachers, and students that will not be using Studies Weekly. That way only Studies Weekly classroom information will show on student accounts. If the roster data is not filtered, students may be added to multiple classes that are not utilizing Studies Weekly publications, such as Math, Gym, etc.
**We have 3 different Studies Weekly Applications in ClassLink. Which one should I use to log in?**
The Studies Weekly 3.0 Oauth 2 app with the blue logo is the current application your district should use for single sign-on.
Troubleshooting Help
If these specific questions and examples did not address your issue, please reach out to .

  * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Article and Explore More comprehension questions are automatically graded by Studies Weekly Online and students receive immediate feedback while answering them. Students have unlimited chances to select the correct response, but they are incentivized with coins to correctly answer each question in as few attempts as possible.
If a student answers an Article comprehension question or Explore More Media question incorrectly, they will not be able to select a different response or move on to the next question for a short amount of time. The delay gives the student an opportunity to go back to the article to find the correct answer or read the question again before they make another attempt.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37039477094299)
Students are required to answer all questions before moving on to the the next task.
Note
Teachers can only view this feature if they are logged in as a student. For information on how to log in as a student see the [How to Navigate the People Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651) article.
#### Disable Time Delay
By default, Delay After Wrong Answer is enabled for all students. This feature can be disabled or enabled for individual students or the entire class. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click **People**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37039477095323)
  1.     1. Navigate to the **Time Delay** column.
    2. Toggle **OFF/ON** for the entire class or for a single student.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37039505178011)


**Using Bulk Actions**
  1. Under Students, click the checkbox to the left of the**Find** Students search box. This will select all of the students in your classroom and add a new button for bulk actions.
  2. Use the toggle to turn it on of off.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37039505179675)
  3. Click **Save Changes**.

title: How to Earn Coins
meta_description: Students can earn coins by answering questions on Articles, Activities, Weekly Assessments, Crosswords, Misspilled, Customized Content,...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [How to Play Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690681345947-How-to-Play-Games)


#  How to Earn Coins 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students can earn coins by answering questions on Articles, Activities, Weekly Assessments, Crosswords, Misspilled, Customized Content, and Explore More media. Students can use these coins in the Study Buddies and Explorers games. 
Recommendation
See the [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-Explorers-and-Gems) article to learn more about using coins and earning gems.
Student View Teacher View
Students can view how many coins they have below their username on the **Classrooms** page. For example, this student has 3884 coins:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31268565551003)
Teachers can view how many coins a student has by going to their Classroom, then selecting the **People** tab. Click the **three dots** next to the student’s name, then click **Add Coins** or **Login As** to see how many total coins they have.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31268557013787)
#### **Coins for Articles**
Articles with no comprehension questions will have a timer at the bottom of the page. When the time elapses, a **Collect Coins** button appears. Students can click that button to show they read the article and earn 5 coins.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18183600886427)
#### **Coins for Article Comprehension and Explore More Media Questions**
Article comprehension and Explore More media questions are automatically graded when a student selects an answer. They are worth 10, 5, 3, or 1 coin(s) depending on how many tries it takes to get the correct answer. 
Note
  * 1st attempt = 10 coins
  * 2nd attempt = 5 coins 
  * 3rd attempt = 3 coins
  * Last attempt = 1 coins


_There is no submit button, so students are automatically awarded these coins based on the number of attempts._
#### **Coins for Activities**
Some Activities will also have comprehension questions that are automatically graded. Activities that need to be done outside of Studies Weekly Online (e.g., on a separate piece of paper) will have an image at the bottom of the page and a Submit button. Students automatically earn 5 coins when they click **Submit**.
![Activity_image_new.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/11297879321499)
Once a student clicks the button to submit the activity, it shows up in the Grade section (see the [How to ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section)[Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article). Questions that are teacher-graded show up as **Needs to be Graded**. For those, the teacher can mark the activity as Correct, Partially Correct, or Incorrect.
Note
  * Correct (100%) = 5 additional coins per question
  * Partially Correct = 3 additional coins per question
  * Incorrect = 1 additional coin per question


_This is in addition to the 5 coins a student receives for submitting the activity._
#### **Coins for Weekly Assessments and Customized Content**
Students earn 5 coins for simply submitting their answers to Weekly Assessments and Customized Content questions. 
Once a student clicks the button to submit the Weekly Assessment or Customized Content, it shows up in the Grade section for the teacher. Questions that are teacher-graded show up as **Needs to be Graded**. For those, the teacher can mark the Weekly Assessment or Customized Content as Correct, Partially Correct, or Incorrect.
Note
  * Correct (100%) = 5 additional coins per question
  * Partially Correct = 3 additional coins per question
  * Incorrect = 1 additional coin per question


_This is in addition to the 5 coins a student receives for completing or submitting the Weekly Assessment or Customized Content._
#### **Coins for Crossword Vocabulary Reviews**
Once a student completes a Crossword and hits Submit, it is automatically graded. They receive 5 coins for submitting the Crossword, then additional coins based on their score.
Note
  * Correct (100%) = 5 additional coins per question
  * Partially Correct = 3 additional coins per question
  * Incorrect = 1 additional coin per question


_This is in addition to the 5 coins a student receives for submitting the Crossword._
#### **Coins for Misspilled Vocabulary Reviews**
Students also earn coins by completing the Misspilled. The amount of coins earned is equal to the tiered amount of time the vocabulary review is completed in. 
Note
  * Less than 2 minutes = 40 coins
  * Less than 3 minutes = 20 coins
  * Less than 4 minutes = 10 coins


For example, a student who completes it in 1 minute would earn 70 coins total (40 + 20 + 10). A student that completes it in 2.5 minutes would earn 30 coins total (20 + 10).
Teachers can manually add coins to a student’s account (see the [How to Add Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8294570263067-How-to-Add-Coins) article). Students will see a notification above their username. Clicking the bell will show students the Coins Alert and a note from their teacher.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31268614955547)
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins)
  * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled)
  * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword)
  * [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers)
  * [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies)

Students will see a notification above their username. Clicking the bell will show students the Coins Alert and a note from their teacher. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31268614955547) Articles in this section * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins) * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled) * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword) * [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers) * [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies) Recently viewed articles * [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay) * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting) * [How to Clear Your Cache and Cookies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416415911963-How-to-Clear-Your-Cache-and-Cookies) * [Legacy Science FAQ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/11083859674651-Legacy-Science-FAQ) * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword)

title: End-of-Year Rostering FAQs
meta_description: Many districts and schools are rostered through the Studies Weekly platform. At the end of each school year, you will need to close out...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Getting Started with Rostering ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18713449851291-Getting-Started-with-Rostering)


#  End-of-Year Rostering FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Many districts and schools are rostered through the Studies Weekly platform. At the end of each school year, you will need to close out your rostered accounts. See further info below.
**What do we need to do to close out the year?**
We recommend that teachers and admin gather any data and reports needed for their documentation before June 30. This is when all current school year order access to online publications will be turned off.
Teachers and admin can view the Studies Weekly [ Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) section and the article [ How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) within the knowledge base for resources on how to gather this information.
#### Note
Schools with summer school publications will have access to those publications from May 15 to August 1. You can visit the [Studies Weekly Data & Legal Policy ](https://www.studiesweekly.com/legal/) for more online access information.
**Does anything need to be done to the accounts from the district/school side?**
No action needs to be taken on the district’s/school’s end to close out rostered accounts.
**When do we need to get ready for the beginning of the year?**
We recommend you confirm that your roster information is up to date and that user accounts are appearing as they should by mid-summer. If you have rostered with us in the previous school year, and you are not making changes to your rostering method, your rostering integration will remain active an you will not need to contact us. 
If you will be changing roster types for the next school year, you need to fill out the rostering form on the [ Studies Weekly Rostering Page](https://www.studiesweekly.com/rostering/). Any rostering admins who are making minor changes, such as adding new schools to the roster, or anyone with specific questions can email .
**What will happen to accounts if we change rostering types? Will teacher and student data remain?**
Studies Weekly Online will determine account continuity based on the email field of your rostered user records. If the user has the same email in both rostering methods, then the new rostering method will seamlessly merge into the existing account for the previous rostering method. 
Classrooms managed by the old rostering method will always be archived. Any progress in these archived classrooms will be available in a read-only state. 
**Our district will be adjusting some data in our rosters over the summer. Will this affect accounts?**
Normally changes to data **only** affects accounts if that changed data is: the SIS ID, Clever/Classlink ID, username, and/or email (if the email is also the username). If there are other specific data changes that you still have questions about, please reach out to [rostering@studiesweekly.com](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/rostering@studiesweekly.com).
**How soon will teachers gain access to Studies Weekly materials through the roster?**
Online access for the next school year’s orders will begin June 15. As long as an order is placed and the roster is set up, the teachers will be able to access their materials.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs)
  * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)
  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)

title: How To Edit Student Accounts
meta_description: Teachers can edit manually created student accounts individually or in bulk. This includes turning on/off special Studies Weekly Online...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How To Edit Student Accounts 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can edit _**manually**_ created student accounts individually or in bulk. This includes turning on/off special Studies Weekly Online features. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click **People**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38822084831771)
Edit Individual Students Bulk Edit Students
  1. Next to the student name, on the right-hand side, click on the **three dots kebab menu**![Three_dots.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9552621195675).
  2. Select **Edit**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183967792027)
  3. Make the desired changes and click **Save**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183962271387)


By default, Accessibility is disabled. Crossword Word Bank, Vocabulary Definitions, Time Delay, and Audio Reader are enabled. 
#### **Add Family Email**
After selecting the **+Family Email** button, enter the email address the family member has provided, then click **Send Invite** to send the family invitation email.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183962271899)
Family members will receive an email to confirm the invitation. The invitation will show as **Pending** until the family member accepts the invitation in the email. When invitations are accepted, they will show as **Accepted**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183967794587)
Use the arrow to view the details of the invitations.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183967795867)
Share the [Navigating the Family Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard) article with the family member for instructions on using the account. 
  1. Under Students, select the **checkbox** to the left of the Find students search box. This will select all of the students in your classroom.
  2. Click the **Bulk Actions** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183967797147)


Teachers can select or deselect students individually by clicking the checkbox to the left of their name.
In the **Edit Students** pop-up modal, teachers can: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36183962279323)
  * Features can be turned off or on for the selected students using the **OFF/ON** toggles.
  * **Drop Selected** students.
  * **Save Changes** or **Cancel**. 


If student accounts were created using an automated rostering method, such as ClassLink or Clever, a password change must be requested by the teacher to their rostering admin within the district. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the People Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page)
  * [How to Add Students to Your Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom)
  * [How To Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts)
  * [How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5996010056987-How-to-Generate-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Share a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Classroom)
  * [How to Add Coins to a Student Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8294570263067-How-to-Add-Coins-to-a-Student-Account)
  * [How to Drop Students](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12904997839643-How-to-Drop-Students)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins)
  * [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay)
  * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting)

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can print pages with student usernames and passwords that include a QR Code, to easily distribute to their students.
From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click **People**.
  2. In the Students bar, click on the **three dots** ![Three_dots.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9734894837019) then select **Print Students' Information**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30679315059611)
A new browser tab will open. The information can be printed in either list view or QR Code view.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26702152021147)
QR Codes can be reset. If this option is chosen, the existing login cards will need reprinted.
### Articles in this section

What can we help you with?

  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Studies Weekly CSV](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690791956891-Studies-Weekly-CSV)


#  Studies Weekly CSV - Troubleshooting 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article covers some of the most common questions we receive from Studies Weekly CSV users. Additional questions can be directed to .
**What is the School ID and where can we find that?**
The school_id column in the schools.csv template file is just a unique identifier we require so that the school can be identified in the teacher file and assigned to the right teacher accounts. This number can be made up, as long as each school on your list has a unique ID.
**Why can't our teachers invite co-teachers into their classroom?**
Teachers, students, and classrooms created through CSV rostering can only be updated through the roster. If a rostered teacher tries to invite a teacher to their rostered classroom, the new teacher won’t be able to join. They need to be added as a co-teacher of the classroom in the teacher_class.csv template file.
**How do I create parent accounts and principal accounts with CSV rostering?**
Currently, only teacher and student accounts can be created through the CSV file upload. We are working to add additional roles, but for now, this must be done manually. If your district needs accounts created for school admins, please reach out to .
**Do we have to upload all 5 files each time we need to add a user or classroom?**
If you are uploading the files directly through the district admin account provided by Studies Weekly, then yes. Any time you need to add or remove a teacher, student, or classroom, you will need to re-upload all 5 CSV template files (schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, classes.csv, student_class.csv). Even if the change is just for one student, all of these CSV files are needed because they designate how your roster connects to Studies Weekly Online.If you use a file transfer protocol (FTP) client, then we can help you automate the file upload process to the FTP server directly. If not, our explains how you can zip the files and upload the zipped file to save time.
Troubleshooting Help
If these specific questions and examples did not address your issue, please reach out to .

#  Rostering Using Studies Weekly CSV FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Click through the tabs below to see answers to commonly asked questions in regard to rostering with Studies Weekly CSV.
**Are there any SSO options if we roster with Studies Weekly CSV?**
If the teacher and student accounts in your roster are linked to Google-sourced emails, then they can use the Single Sign-On (SSO) link at <https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google>.
Please Note
Please enable pop-ups on your internet browser to use the Google SSO URL. During the login process, a window will pop-up requesting you to select your account so that you can authenticate the login using your Google account.
Teachers and students can also go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/online.studiesweekly.com) and select the "Log in with Google" button.
**Can district and school admin accounts be created through the CSV roster?**
Yes, you can add school administrator and district administrator accounts to your CSV roster using the optional "school_admins.csv" and "district_admins.csv" files. You can also request for already existing users to have an administrator role added to their account manually by reaching out to 
**Can I use a FTP client to upload my CSV files?**
Your first upload of the CSV files will be through the administrator account we provide you during the rostering setup. After your first upload, we can provide you with the credentials to the file transfer protocol (FTP) server where your files are located so that you can use an FTP client and automate the rostering process going forward.
