  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  How to Create Customized Content 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can create Customized Content from scratch within the Customized Content page. Teachers can also create Customized Content by creating their own questions or adding existing Studies Weekly Online content into new Customized Content.
Information about sharing Customized Content with other users can be found in the [Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher) article.
Create Customized Content Edit Existing Customized Content
There are multiple places Customized Content can be created. Open each section below to learn about the options.
***** For specific instructions on adding an image to your Customized Content or the difference between question types, visit the [Understanding Questions Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types) article.
**Customized Content Page**
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click the **Customized Content** button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821872119835)
On the Customized Content page, click the blue**Add** button in the upper right corner and choose **Create New Customized Content**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36410382024859)
  1. Fill out the fields for Step 1. Including a **Title** , student **Instructions** , **Due Date,** and if you wish to set a future **Start Date** , turn off the **Immediately Available** toggle**.**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960797607195)
       *          * The default **Due Date** is one week from the **Start Date**. 
         * The optional **Start Time** and **Due Time** will default to 12:00 AM and 11:59 PM when the **Immediately Available toggle** is disabled.
         * Click**Next** in the bottom left corner to move on to Step 2 adding content.
Note
If you want to schedule your Customized Content to be visible for students at a _future date_ , turn off the **Immediately Available** toggle feature and select your future date. Otherwise, it will automatically become visible as soon as it is created. By default, the toggle is already enabled.
  2. Select the **+Add** button to insert your own**Question** , **Item** , choose from **Add Previously Created** Customized Content questions, Studies Weekly created **Digital Printables** , or the **Question Bank**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960797610907)
Once a selection is made, fill in all the fields and select **Save**. Questions can be edited later as long as no students have begun the Customized Content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790743579)
     *        * For specific instructions on adding an image, visit the **Upload Images** tab in the [Understanding Questions Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types) article.
       * To add additional questions or items, click **+Add** then repeat step 2.
       * **Edit View** allows teachers to make edits to the created content.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790745627)
       * The **Preview** feature shows how questions will appear to students. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790747803)
       * To assign the Customized Content to your students, select **Next** in the bottom right corner.
  3. Next, select the students to receive your Customized Content. By default, all students in the Classroom where you created the Content will be selected. If the box is selected next to a student’s name, it will appear in the student's To Do section. **Uncheck** a student's box to remove the Content from their view. Teachers can choose to add additional Classrooms and students using the provided check boxes. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34237337344667)
Click **Create** to finish your Customized Content.
     *        * Once created, edits to the questions can only be made if no students have begun. If you adjust any of the questions or point values then it will create a copy.
       * Edits to the Title, Instructions, Start and End Date, and Randomize Questions can be adjusted any time.


**Existing Studies Weekly Online Content**
Any edits to existing Studies Weekly Online content, including the title of the article, article questions, Weekly Assessments, Crosswords, and Misspilled games, will create a new copy for you on the Customized Content page. For students it will appear in their To Do Section.
Note
The text within articles is not editable but the entire article can be removed by clicking the trash can within the gray bar of the article.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, navigate to the content you wish to edit.
  1. Click the **Teacher Actions** button, then **+Customized Content** button.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790749083)
  2. Select **Confirm** on the message after you read it.. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960797621659)
  3. A modal will pop-up on screen where you can make the desired edits including: 
     *        * **Title**
       * **Instructions**
       * **Immediately** **Available** or select **Start Date**
       * Assign a **Due Date** and **Time**
       * Reorganize question order using the**Move** button
       * **Remove** existing content by selecting the trash can 
       * **Edit** current questions using the pencil
       * **Randomize Questions**
       * **Add** additional content
       * **Assign** to Classrooms/Students ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790751899)
  4. Select **Create** when you're finished. Students will be able to see the new content in their To Do section. 


#### Additional possible edits after selecting the Edit Pencil include: 
  * Click in the text box to edit the question text.
  * Change the text of the answer options.
  * Select which answer is correct by clicking the circle to the left
  * You can add another answer option by clicking the **Add Option** button
  * Edit how many points the question is worth. 
  * Each question can be given a different color.
  * If a question is written in Spanish, the **Language** dropdown will automatically change to Spanish and be read to students with a Spanish accent. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790754971)


**Search Page**
Teachers can create Customized Content directly from the Search Page. If you are not familiar with the Search feature, visit the [How to Search for Articles and Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media) article.
From the Search page, type a subject or keyword into the search bar and click**Enter**(or click the **Search** button).
Using the **Media** and **Publication** tabs, locate the desired content.
### ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37601510520859)
When you select an article assigned to that classroom, a modal appears allowing you to select **Teacher Actions**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37713137227547)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37601520779163)
Selecting the blue hyperlink (below the title) will open the Teacher Resources for Article/Activity in the publication's Table of contents. Look for the **Customized Content** button under the **Teacher Actions** dropdown. Then follow the steps in the accordion above titled **Existing Studies Weekly Online Content**. Once created, students will see the new content in their **To Do** section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37601510528283)
Note
If the selected Article/Activity or Media belongs to a publication not assigned to the Classroom, teachers will be redirected to add the publication before proceeding.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960797639451)Once the publication is added, teachers will be directly taken to the Article/Activity where it can be added as Customized Content.**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790774811)**
###  **Add** **Media**
Select the media file (image, video, or audio) you would like to use. It will open in a modal where you can create Customized Content.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34238639085467)
Then follow the steps on screen to finish creating the content. Students will see the new content in their To Do section. 
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34793880729627)**
For more information on using the Search Page, open the [How to Search for Articles and Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media) article.
**Teacher Resources**
The Teacher Resources are a great place to find available printables and create Customized Content. Click the thumbnail image on any of the PDFs in the **Printables** section. This will open a modal to view the PDF and the **Teacher Actions** dropdown. From there select **+Customized Content** then follow the remaining on screen steps to create it. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790790043)
As long as no students have started the Customized Content within any classroom, the teacher can make edits to questions, answers, and the point value. 
When the Customized Content does have responses submitted by any student:
  * Teachers can make changes to the **Title** ,**Instructions** , and **Start/End Date** at any time. 
  * If a teacher attempts to make edits to **Questions** ,**Answers** , or **Point Value** after any student has begun the Customized Content, they must select **Create New Copy** and should **Delete** the existing content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33960790793115)


To Edit already created Customized Content, click the**three dots****![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35382127165595)**in the right corner of the box and select**Edit**. Make the necessary edits and select **Save**.
  * The **Delete** feature will permanently delete Customized Content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36410375075995)


Important
Teachers are limited to two concurrent Customized Content creations within one minute. This is an intentional security feature. If there is an attempt to create more than two Customized Content assignments at a time, the user will get an error: 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36254628700443)
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page)
  * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content)
  * [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content)
  * [Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher)
  * [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content)
  * [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Spot Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15527064098075-Hot-Spot-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Text Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [Rostering Using Studies Weekly CSV FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting)
  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F29399943306011-Materials-Calculator-for-Publications "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006690854-Teaching-Tools)


#  Materials Calculator for Publications 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Materials Calculator helps teachers determine the amount of materials needed for each Activity or Article. It's located in the Teacher Resources of publications. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, navigate to the [Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17772923416603-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-Teacher-Resources) section of the publication. View the correlating steps below this image.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30963291842843)
  1. Open the Activity/Article you wish to calculate materials for.
  2. Select Materials Calculator. ***** The calculator will only be present if materials are required to complete a task.
  3. To correctly calculate the amount of materials, teachers will enter the number of students in their classroom. The total quantity (Total Qty) needed will automatically populate next to each item in the Materials list.
  4. Print the quantity list for your records.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29402351654043)
  5. The hyperlinks on the Materials list will need to be printed separately. When selected, those PDFs will open in a new browser tab. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29402517329435)


### Articles in this section
  * [How to Print Studies Weekly Online Materials](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18385714221723-How-to-Print-Studies-Weekly-Online-Materials)
  * [Materials Calculator for Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/29399943306011-Materials-Calculator-for-Publications)
  * [How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406842650267-How-to-Create-Words-to-Know-Vocabulary-Notebooks)
  * [How to Search for Articles and Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media)

  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)

title: OneRoster CSV - Pros and Cons
meta_description: Pros Cons    Automated Rostering through FTP Due to the widespread use of the OneRoster CSV format, it is compatible with most Student...

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13317262262683-OneRoster-CSV-Pros-and-Cons#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13317262262683-OneRoster-CSV-Pros-and-Cons "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [OneRoster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690781233307-OneRoster)


#  OneRoster CSV - Pros and Cons 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Pros Cons 

Automated Rostering through FTP
    Due to the widespread use of the OneRoster CSV format, it is compatible with most Student Information Systems (SIS) and roster servers. It is easy to use as well, because you can automatically import roster data into OneRoster CSV files and then upload them to the Studies Weekly Online file transfer protocol (FTP) server. Once uploaded, Studies Weekly Online syncs all files on a nightly basis. If you add or remove a student, teacher, or classroom through OneRoster, then that updated information will be in Studies Weekly Online by the next day. 

Multiple Formats Supported
    Studies Weekly Online supports the 1.0 and the 1.1 format versions for OneRoster CSV files. 

Single Sign-On through Google
    If the teacher and student accounts are rostered using Google-sourced emails for the usernames of the accounts, you can quickly and easily access Studies Weekly Online without the need to memorize a username or password.After verifying their Google Account, students and teachers can use one of the following options to automatically log in each time:1. Go through our [Single Sign-on interface](https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google)2. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login) and select the **LOGIN WITH GOOGLE** button. 

Google Classroom
    After setting up the teacher and student accounts with Google-sourced email addresses, the teachers can also utilize the Google Classroom integration in Studies Weekly Online. 

Unable to Filter Data
    There are some roster servers and SIS servers that don't provide the ability to filter the data that is being shared to the CSV files that are uploaded to the Studies Weekly FTP server. Because of this, there may be teachers, students, and classrooms that are created in Studies Weekly Online for users that are not using the Studies Weekly publication. 

Limited Visibility
    When you share your roster with Studies Weekly Online through a third party service such as ClassLink or Clever, that roster becomes accessible for Studies Weekly support to view in cases where we are assisting with troubleshooting your roster. With OneRoster CSV connections, we can reference the files you have uploaded to our FTP server, but this information may not reflect all of the data in your roster server, so it may be more difficult for our Customer Service team to assist with tech troubleshooting.
### Articles in this section
  * [OneRoster API - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13281484944539-OneRoster-API-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [OneRoster CSV - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13317262262683-OneRoster-CSV-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [OneRoster API - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13383443801371-OneRoster-API-Troubleshooting)
  * [OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting)

title: How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations
meta_description: If districts choose to use Studies Weekly to roster their accounts, they can create and manage user accounts for teachers and students...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Getting Started with Rostering ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18713449851291-Getting-Started-with-Rostering)


#  How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
If districts choose to use Studies Weekly to roster their accounts, they can create and manage user accounts for teachers and students district-wide through a variety of automated processes. Studies Weekly is also able to integrate roster data through third-party applications, such as ClassLink or Clever to allow Single Sign On with these applications. 
Each user included in the data that is sent through the roster connection will be given a Studies Weekly Online account and will be assigned either a district admin, school admin, teacher, or student role. The users will also be assigned to the classroom(s) specified in the roster data.
Studies Weekly recommends adjusting the sharing rules specific to the subject (Social Studies, Science, Early Learning, or Health and Wellness) depending on what your district has ordered. This will reduce confusion and prevent unnecessary classrooms from being created within each user account. If your SIS is not able to filter down the data you send us, the OneRoster CSV option below may be a better solution for you.
#### Attention
To get started with any of these rostering methods, please head over to <https://www.studiesweekly.com/rostering/#GettingStarted> and fill out the rostering form. An email will be sent to the provided contact informing the the next steps.
**Third Party Integrations API CSV File Upload Integration **
**ClassLink**
ClassLink is one of our third-party applications that has very little maintenance and setup. Once the connection is established, Studies Weekly Online accounts will be created based on the data shared from ClassLink. Studies Weekly can import your school's roster directly from ClassLink to synchronize your schools' user accounts each night. Your district will be able to choose what data is shared with Studies Weekly through ClassLink. The users and classrooms that were shared will be created in Studies Weekly Online. They will be able to log in to their ClassLink account and find the Studies Weekly application to launch into their Studies Weekly Online account.
**Clever**
Clever is another third-party application that integrates with Studies Weekly. A connection with Clever requires your district to request to connect with Studies Weekly by locating the Studies Weekly application in Clever’s application library and requesting to connect. Once the connection is approved by someone on Studies Weekly’s team, your district can begin sharing data with us. You’ll want to ensure your district has purchased Studies Weekly publications so your users can gain access through their Clever portal. 
After your connection is approved and the launch date is established, Studies Weekly will create user accounts. Users will be able to log in to their Clever account and find the Studies Weekly application to launch their Studies Weekly Online account. 
Note
Once your users are rostered, publications will be auto-assigned based on data provided in the roster. For example, if you provide the class grade level in the data, publications will be assigned to that classroom automatically for that grade level. If grade data is not provided, no publications will be auto-assigned and teachers will need to manually add publications to their classrooms. Teachers can add or remove publications by following [these instructions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom).
Studies Weekly can receive your district's roster data and information through an API connection that is compatible with OneRoster. If your student information system (SIS) is OneRoster compatible, Studies Weekly will provide a way for your district to send us your credentials to connect with us directly. 
ClassLink is OneRoster certified, which means we integrate well with ClassLink through API. ClassLink provides a launchpad for your users to access Studies Weekly while only having to login to one place to access your Studies Weekly publication(s). 
### OneRoster API Integration
Studies Weekly can receive your district's roster data and information through an API connection, which means you’ll be sending data from your SIS directly to Studies Weekly. We currently have support for an API connection that follows OneRoster specifications. To set up an API connection, send an email to  to let them know what Student Information System (SIS) you have and that you’d like to connect through OneRoster API. Studies Weekly will provide a way for your district to send us your credentials to complete the API connection. 
Important
Please note that we recommend adjusting the sharing rules specific to the subject (Social Studies, Science, Early Learning, or Health and Wellness) depending on what your district has ordered. This will reduce confusion and prevent unnecessary classrooms from being created within each user account.
If your SIS is not able to filter down the data you send us, the OneRoster CSV option below may be a better solution for you.
Studies Weekly is compatible with two CSV file formats to give your district the ability to choose what will best meet your needs. Studies Weekly is able to accept OneRoster formatted files or Studies Weekly formatted files. You can choose the frequency in which files are uploaded. Regardless of when files are uploaded, files are processed each night to provide you the latest information as soon as the next morning.
### OneRoster Formatted Files
Studies Weekly is able to accept OneRoster CSV files through Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP). You can choose what data you send us by exporting the required files from your SIS with the required fields selected. Studies Weekly will provide you with SFTP credentials so you can access our server to upload files as needed. Once files are uploaded and the nightly sync occurs, your users will have accounts created. 
**See the list of Mandatory CSVs and important notes on the ClassLink website.**
### Studies Weekly Formatted Files
If your district is not able to export OneRoster formatted files or if you’d prefer to personally manage the user data, Studies Weekly has its own format in which you can provide CSV files. 
You will be assigned a district admin account where you can upload your files for validating and file processing. Files will first be validated, which just means they’ll be scanned for any breaks in your data. The files will then be processed later that night during the nightly sync. If you reach out to  during the setup, we can manually push the sync to ensure everything is working so you don’t have to wait to know if the data is processing accurately. 
After the initial setup and once you have a successful sync, Studies Weekly can provide you with SFTP credentials to access our server and upload files as often as you’d like. 
**Studies Weekly Required CSVs**
[schools.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/schools.csv)
This file is used to provide us with each school in your district that will be using Studies Weekly. Each school using Studies Weekly must be listed in this file in order for accounts to be created and for your users to see the publications your district has purchased.
[teachers.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teachers.csv)
This file is used to create user accounts for anyone you’d like to have the teacher role on their account. We will use the teacher's email address as their username and they will be able to use the reset password link to set up their account for the first time. If you’d prefer, we have the ability to send each new user an email with their login information. 
[students.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Spreadsheets/students.csv)
This file is used to create user accounts for anyone that needs the student role on their account. How you set their username and password will be dependent on which method you would like your students to login with. 
For Google SSO, this file will contain four columns: student name, student email, student ID and username. The Google hosted email address must be assigned in the username column.
For custom usernames and passwords, this file will contain five columns: student name, student email, student ID, username, password*.
*_Each password_** _must_** _be at least 5 characters and include a number. If no password is provided, please include the header in the file, and we will auto generate one for you._
This file is used to create all of the classrooms at any and all schools within your district. This is also where you will assign the main teacher to their classroom. Additional teachers can be assigned to a class in the teacher_class.csv file. In order for your teachers to have a classroom online, a classroom needs to be declared in this file.
[student_class.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/student_class.csv)
This file is used to assign students to classrooms. If you find that one of your teachers is missing a student, you can check this file to ensure they are assigned to their teacher accordingly. 
[teacher_class.csv (optional)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teacher_class.csv)
This file is used to assign a co-teacher or a second teacher to a classroom. The teachers added to this file will have the same abilities as the main teacher. The only ability the main teacher will have that the secondary teacher will not is deleting a classroom. The main teacher will be assigned in the classes.csv file.
After all the files have been created, it is recommended that you maintain a ‘final file’ of each on your desktop. As changes happen throughout the year, you will add to or remove from the files.
Whatever data is in your files will be reflected online. If you remove any users from the files and upload a different file, users will be removed and added accordingly. 
Once your users are rostered, teachers will need to manually add publications to their classrooms. Teachers can add additional publications to their classroom if needed.
Note
All column headers and filenames MUST be identical to those listed in the OneRoster specifications. All columns listed in the specifications are also required. If a column indicates it is not required, the column itself is required, but the data for each row can be blank.
All CSV files MUST be UTF-8 encoded or the process will not be successful.
Support
For information about the SFTP server, to request SFTP credentials, to request district admin credentials, or if anything is not working as expected, please contact our rostering support team at .
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs)
  * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)
  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [OneRoster CSV - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13317262262683-OneRoster-CSV-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [Materials Calculator for Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/29399943306011-Materials-Calculator-for-Publications)
  * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content)
  * [Rostering Using Studies Weekly CSV FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting)

To set up an API connection, send an email to to let them know what Student Information System (SIS) you have and that you’d like to connect through OneRoster API. Studies Weekly will provide a way for your district to send us your credentials to complete the API connection. Important Please note that we recommend adjusting the sharing rules specific to the subject (Social Studies, Science, Early Learning, or Health and Wellness) depending on what your district has ordered. This will reduce confusion and prevent unnecessary classrooms from being created within each user account. If your SIS is not able to filter down the data you send us, the OneRoster CSV option below may be a better solution for you. Studies Weekly is compatible with two CSV file formats to give your district the ability to choose what will best meet your needs. Studies Weekly is able to accept OneRoster formatted files or Studies Weekly formatted files. You can choose the frequency in which files are uploaded. Regardless of when files are uploaded, files are processed each night to provide you the latest information as soon as the next morning. OneRoster Formatted Files Studies Weekly is able to accept OneRoster CSV files through Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP). You can choose what data you send us by exporting the required files from your SIS with the required fields selected. Studies Weekly will provide you with SFTP credentials so you can access our server to upload files as needed. Once files are uploaded and the nightly sync occurs, your users will have accounts created. **See the list of Mandatory CSVs and important notes on the ClassLink website.** Studies Weekly Formatted Files If your district is not able to export OneRoster formatted files or if you’d prefer to personally manage the user data, Studies Weekly has its own format in which you can provide CSV files. You will be assigned a district admin account where you can upload your files for validating and file processing. Files will first be validated, which just means they’ll be scanned for any breaks in your data. The files will then be processed later that night during the nightly sync. If you reach out to during the setup, we can manually push the sync to ensure everything is working so you don’t have to wait to know if the data is processing accurately. After the initial setup and once you have a successful sync, Studies Weekly can provide you with SFTP credentials to access our server and upload files as often as you’d like. **Studies Weekly Required CSVs** [schools.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/schools.csv) This file is used to provide us with each school in your district that will be using Studies Weekly. Each school using Studies Weekly must be listed in this file in order for accounts to be created and for your users to see the publications your district has purchased. [teachers.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teachers.csv) This file is used to create user accounts for anyone you’d like to have the teacher role on their account. We will use the teacher's email address as their username and they will be able to use the reset password link to set up their account for the first time. If you’d prefer, we have the ability to send each new user an email with their login information. [students.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Spreadsheets/students.csv) This file is used to create user accounts for anyone that needs the student role on their account. How you set their username and password will be dependent on which method you would like your students to login with. For Google SSO, this file will contain four columns: student name, student email, student ID and username. The Google hosted email address must be assigned in the username column. For custom usernames and passwords, this file will contain five columns: student name, student email, student ID, username, password*. *_Each password_** _must_** _be at least 5 characters and include a number. If no password is provided, please include the header in the file, and we will auto generate one for you._ This file is used to create all of the classrooms at any and all schools within your district. This is also where you will assign the main teacher to their classroom. Additional teachers can be assigned to a class in the teacher_class.csv file. In order for your teachers to have a classroom online, a classroom needs to be declared in this file. [student_class.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/student_class.csv) This file is used to assign students to classrooms. If you find that one of your teachers is missing a student, you can check this file to ensure they are assigned to their teacher accordingly. [teacher_class.csv (optional)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teacher_class.csv) This file is used to assign a co-teacher or a second teacher to a classroom. The teachers added to this file will have the same abilities as the main teacher. The only ability the main teacher will have that the secondary teacher will not is deleting a classroom. The main teacher will be assigned in the classes.csv file. After all the files have been created, it is recommended that you maintain a ‘final file’ of each on your desktop. As changes happen throughout the year, you will add to or remove from the files. Whatever data is in your files will be reflected online. If you remove any users from the files and upload a different file, users will be removed and added accordingly. Once your users are rostered, teachers will need to manually add publications to their classrooms. Teachers can add additional publications to their classroom if needed. Note All column headers and filenames MUST be identical to those listed in the OneRoster specifications. All columns listed in the specifications are also required. If a column indicates it is not required, the column itself is required, but the data for each row can be blank. All CSV files MUST be UTF-8 encoded or the process will not be successful. Support For information about the SFTP server, to request SFTP credentials, to request district admin credentials, or if anything is not working as expected, please contact our rostering support team at . Articles in this section * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs) * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online) * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs) Recently viewed articles * [OneRoster CSV - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13317262262683-OneRoster-CSV-Pros-and-Cons) * [Materials Calculator for Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/29399943306011-Materials-Calculator-for-Publications) * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting)

  3. [Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18411960987803-Training-and-Resources)


#  Studies Weekly Online Primary Source Analysis Tools 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
A primary source is a piece of first-hand evidence about an event, object, or person. Knowing how to analyze a historical primary source helps students learn new information about a topic and make connections to information they may already know. Studies Weekly Online has created a collection of Primary Source Analysis Tools to help students **Observe, Reflect** , and **Question** primary sources.
The Studies Weekly Online Primary Source Analysis Tools are universally applicable teaching and learning resources for all grades and subjects. Included in Studies Weekly Online Primary Source Analysis Tools are:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26978977353371)
To access the PDF templates, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Click the **Training and Resources** tab. 
  2. Click **Resources**.![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXe4ko6kcevt-1C0m04hMH4YDjmoE7IHv5athn0qPciOW7DywnUMVnh7IfMm6X3yZs5dHuidVJaUSVNWg5Uvi1Ara_DzAzfnjRr3o5DSZhwOlGq_tGcBdEdvDiHdcUaxnXGw13Bevj3idLZr3CRfdLiJpleU?key=uAfF20dICdwJ9apjZXz-0A)
  3. Find the **Primary Source Analysis Tools** section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31815487220251)
  4. Click a PDF to open it in a new tab. Each PDF is available in English and/or Spanish, has instructions, and has a section for student name and date. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26978977359643)


To learn about additional resources, visit the [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).

title: April 2025 Product Updates

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35538319781403-April-2025-Product-Updates#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F35538319781403-April-2025-Product-Updates "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025)


#  April 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Digital Drawing Tool/Digital Printables Zoom on Tablet**
Students using iPads can zoom in to make using the Drawing Tool even easier. Visit article [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool) to learn more. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35626718415515)
**Classroom Page Updated for Teachers and Students**
With the latest update teachers now:
  * Can **Refresh** the Classroom list.
  * Have access to **Active** and **Inactive** Classrooms with one simple click.
  * Have quick access to the **View All** button for publications in a classroom.
  * View the number of publications available in each classroom.
  * Visit the [How to Navigate the Classrooms Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classrooms-Page) for more details.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35857183535259)


With the latest update students now:
  * Have access to**Active** and **Inactive** Classrooms with one simple click.
  * View the number of publications available in each classroom.
  * New quick access to the **View All** button for publications in a classroom.
  * Visit the [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard) for more details.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35857183541147)


**Banner for Publication Expiration**
The Publication Expiration reminder will appear 30 days before it is set to expire. Teachers can then choose to purchase the publication(s) or contact their administrator for purchase of the publication(s). 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35851476969115)
**Banner for Classroom Expiration**
This reminder will appear 30 days prior to expiration. After 30 days the classroom will move to the **Inactive** tab. For _manually created_ Classrooms, select **Update** to extend the date range. Classrooms created through the Rostering method can be updated within the rostering system (i.e Clever or Classlink).
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35851476964251)
**New Options for Bulk Editing Students**
Teachers can use the Bulk Actions button to Drop Selected students or turn on and off additional features. To learn about editing student accounts, visit the How to Edit Student Accounts article.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36184537988123)
**Student View Access as a Teacher**
Teachers or admins can quickly view what the student experience is like using the new **Student View** button located in the top navigation bar. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36406614705435)
When users are finished with Student View, select **Sign Out** at the top right corner of the page. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36406614707739)
**Coming Soon**
### Articles in this section
  * [July 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38718453399323-July-2025-Product-Updates)
  * [June 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/37597764232731-June-2025-Product-Updates)
  * [May 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36683589166363-May-2025-Product-Updates)

  * [February 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33796088207643-February-2025-Product-Updates)
  * [January 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/32594994872603-January-2025-Product-Updates)

What can we help you with?

  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24745242502683-Additional-Features)


#  How to Use the Drawing Tool 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Some Studies Weekly Online questions allow students to use the Drawing Tool. Students will be able to do the following:
  * Free draw with a pen, brush, or highlighter (with color options)
  * Add basic shapes (with color and size options)
  * Fill the canvas with a paint bucket
  * Add text (with font, color, and rotation options)
  * Earn coins


Teachers can assign various types of artifacts to students including a blank canvas, a Digital Printable PDF, a picture their teacher has uploaded, or a picture from a Studies Weekly publication. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24997896724635) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24997871325595)
To interact with the assigned artifact, a student will use the tools on screen. 
To flatten a shape or finish typing letters, students need to click on the blank canvas. Once images have been flattened, they cannot be edited on the canvas, but they can be removed with the Undo button.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35628747380123) ![2025-04-03.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35628747385883)

#  Studies Weekly Online Graphic Organizers 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Graphic Organizers are important tools that teachers can use to guide students’ deep thinking. They provide a visual aid to organize information and show how different ideas or concepts are related to each other. 
The Studies Weekly Online Graphic Organizers are universally applicable teaching and learning resources for all grades and subjects. The following Online Graphic Organizers are Included in Studies Weekly Online:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979107464859)
To access the PDF templates, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account: 
  1. Click the **Training and Resources** tab. 
  2. Click **Resources**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979107473307)
  3. Scroll down until you see the **Graphic Organizers** section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979115184411)
  4. Click a PDF to open it in a new tab. Each PDF is available in English and/or Spanish, has instructions, and has a section for student name and date. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979107485723)


Additionally, check out this video for implementing a **See, Think, and Wonder Strategy:**[![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38373076316443)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Videos/See+Think+Wonder+\(Instructional+Strategies+Series\).mp4)
Tip
Did you know Studies Weekly also has a [Blog](https://www.studiesweekly.com/blog/), [Newsletter](https://www.studiesweekly.com/newsletter/), and a page? Check them out for How To’s, education trends, teaching tips, and more.

title: School Admin Standards Report
meta_description: The Standards Report will only appear if it is available for one of your publications.  School admins can view average scores from...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36083842437147-School-Admin-Standards-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F36083842437147-School-Admin-Standards-Report "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991516063003-School-Administrators)


#  School Admin Standards Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Standards Report will only appear if it is available for one of your publications.
School admins can view average scores from classrooms and individual students of the standards covered in Studies Weekly Online Unit and Weekly Assessment questions using the Standards Report.
From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select the **Standards Report** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694444315)
**A** : Dropdown to select a publication. 
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows filtering student results by date. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D** : Search for a specific classroom by typing the name in the **Find** bubble. Classrooms are organized alphabetically. Use the caret ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36083812072091) at the top of the list to change the order from Z-A. 
**E** : Select individual standard links to open a pop-up modal displaying the standard and questions available for the publication. Standards are organized alphabetically and numerically.
**F** : View the average school score for each standard on a student's first assessment attempt. School scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the selected school for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the school. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = school score)
**G** : Select an individual classroom to view the average scores for each student. standard, questions, student answer selections, and Total Score (points earned / points possible). _More information is provided below in the section below titled**Individual Student Scores**._
**H**. View the average scores of classrooms for the standards. Classroom scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in that class. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students in the class = classroom score)
Important
  * This report contain scores from the students' first attempt. If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report.
  * This report is cached. An updated report will be available every morning.
  * When no data is available there is a hyphen (**-**) in the standard box.
  * The Standards Report will only appear if it's available for one of your Publications.


#### **Additional options after selecting a classroom**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694446747)
**I**. Select the three dots![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36083877830171)to the right of a student's name to either Edit the account or Log In As the student.
**J**. Select an individual student score to view the standard, questions associated, student answer selections, and Total Score of the standard (points earned / points possible). _More information is provided below._
#### **Individual Student Scores**
Each standard's score is calculated by averaging the scores of all answered questions linked to it. This report displays scores from your students’ first submission of each assessment question. (See letter **J** above.) If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694450203)
**K** : Student name, average percentage score, and Total Score for the standard. Shown as total points earned/ total points possible.
**L** : Standard number and skill.
**M** : Link to open the Assessment in the publication.
**N** : Submission Time and Date.
**O** : Student’s response to the question. Response will be red if incorrect, green if correct.
**P** : Question Score (points earned / points possible).
**Q** : Option to **Print**.
#### **Printing**
Selecting **Print** within an individual student’s standards pop-up modal (see letters **E** and **Q** above) allows you to view and print the student’s responses to the questions. As well as see the date and time each question was submitted.
Selecting **Print** within the Standards pop-up modal (see letter **C** above) allows you to view and print the (unanswered) questions associated with the selected standard. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How To Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role)
  * [School Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36083842437147-School-Admin-Standards-Report)

School admins can view average scores from classrooms and individual students of the standards covered in Studies Weekly Online Unit and Weekly Assessment questions using the Standards Report. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select the **Standards Report** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694444315) **A** : Dropdown to select a publication. **B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows filtering student results by date. The default view is All. **C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. **D** : Search for a specific classroom by typing the name in the **Find** bubble. Classrooms are organized alphabetically. Use the caret ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36083812072091) at the top of the list to change the order from Z-A. **E** : Select individual standard links to open a pop-up modal displaying the standard and questions available for the publication. Standards are organized alphabetically and numerically. **F** : View the average school score for each standard on a student's first assessment attempt. School scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the selected school for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the school. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = school score) **G** : Select an individual classroom to view the average scores for each student. standard, questions, student answer selections, and Total Score (points earned / points possible). _More information is provided below in the section below titled**Individual Student Scores**._ **H**. View the average scores of classrooms for the standards. Classroom scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in that class. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students in the class = classroom score) Important * This report contain scores from the students' first attempt. If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report. * This report is cached. An updated report will be available every morning. * When no data is available there is a hyphen (**-**) in the standard box. * The Standards Report will only appear if it's available for one of your Publications. **Additional options after selecting a classroom** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694446747) **I**. Select the three dots![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36083877830171)to the right of a student's name to either Edit the account or Log In As the student. **J**. Select an individual student score to view the standard, questions associated, student answer selections, and Total Score of the standard (points earned / points possible). _More information is provided below._ **Individual Student Scores** Each standard's score is calculated by averaging the scores of all answered questions linked to it. This report displays scores from your students’ first submission of each assessment question. (See letter **J** above.) If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36518694450203) **K** : Student name, average percentage score, and Total Score for the standard. Shown as total points earned/ total points possible. **L** : Standard number and skill. **M** : Link to open the Assessment in the publication. **N** : Submission Time and Date. **O** : Student’s response to the question. Response will be red if incorrect, green if correct. **P** : Question Score (points earned / points possible). **Q** : Option to **Print**. **Printing** Selecting **Print** within an individual student’s standards pop-up modal (see letters **E** and **Q** above) allows you to view and print the student’s responses to the questions. As well as see the date and time each question was submitted. Selecting **Print** within the Standards pop-up modal (see letter **C** above) allows you to view and print the (unanswered) questions associated with the selected standard. Articles in this section * [How To Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role) * [School Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36083842437147-School-Admin-Standards-Report) Recently viewed articles * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17258062993819-Studies-Weekly-Online-Graphic-Organizers) * [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool) * [April 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35538319781403-April-2025-Product-Updates) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17282812984475-Studies-Weekly-Online-Primary-Source-Analysis-Tools) * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)

#  June 2024 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Primary Navigation Bar now at the Top of the Screen**
All users will now see the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen with functionality remaining the same. It was previously on the left side. Visit the [Navigate Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online) Article to learn more.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26945266598811)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26945266603035)
**Leaderboard in Reports**
The Leaderboard will show how many coins students earn for a chosen date range in a classroom. The Leaderboard has replaced the coins column that was formerly in the Publication report. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26533129630107)
To learn more visit the [Leaderboard article](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/26174274831643-Leaderboard) in the Help Center.
**New Thumbnails in Teacher Resources**
Previously weblinks in Teacher Resources appeared as an actual link. Now they will appear as a thumbnail image to either click the thumbnail to open the link or click the link symbol to copy the link. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26532639460635)
**Mobile and iPad View Improvements**
Students and teachers will have an improved experience when using small devices.
Teacher iPad Mini View:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26532875925019)
Student iPad Mini View: 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26532902150427)
**Drawing Tool in Customized Content**
Teachers and district admins can now assign Customized Content that will allow students to use the Drawing Tool on a blank canvas, over a Digital printable or an image. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26595038601755)
To learn more visit the [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool) and [Understanding Question Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types) articles in the Help Center. 
**New Breadcrumbs for Quick Navigation**
All users can now quickly navigate using the breadcrumbs at the top of the page. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26944545998235)

  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025)


#  July 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Lesson Walkthroughs in Reader Mode**
Lesson Walkthroughs now show in Reader Mode similar to Google Slides in that it fills the page without having to scroll down and displays the **Previous** and**Next** buttons.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718428604443)
**Adding Articles to Customized Content**
Adding Articles to Customized Content just got easier because we added optional **Grade Level** and **Subject** filters.
**Customized Content > Item > Article** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718428606875)
Selecting a Grade Level or Subject will show the correlating publications:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718453389083)
We also reduced the number of clicks from having separate dropdown boxes to choose a Unit then a Week, to seeing the Units and Weeks combined into one dropdown.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718453390875)
**New Sub Menu Under Teacher Actions**
Now when teachers hover over Printables in Teacher Actions, they will see a sub menu of the available printables. Once selected the printables will open in a new browser tab.
![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXe8Vh7dT7RP1gGMG3geu-8cTT2BWWTw59DR5ZKE_qA2mcBprJljFGro1q1yY6tGeA0nbwFkJjkd5Fto78Y3kKDqZRbpBDjvCtinOSw4Nld2kkFsUilW61Gn6jR9JdtIkE398CvGwQ?key=v-6iuT8kgqDmo5-BLXxhLA)
**Google Translate**
Teachers and admins can enable Google Translate for students who require language support, as well as for their own use. Full instructions can be found in the [Utilizing Google Translate in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38782745566235-Utilizing-Google-Translate-in-Studies-Weekly-Online) article. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38791188692635)
**New Student Table of Contents Experience**
The new student Table of Contents experience was redesigned to match the teacher experience. Units are easier to identify with their highlighted pastel background. Units and Weeks can be opened or closed with the new expand/collapse buttons ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794728751515)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794720228763)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794728754459)
To learn about navigating a student account visit the [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience) section of the Help Center.

[2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025) July 2025 Product Updates FollowNot yet followed by anyone **Lesson Walkthroughs in Reader Mode** Lesson Walkthroughs now show in Reader Mode similar to Google Slides in that it fills the page without having to scroll down and displays the **Previous** and**Next** buttons.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718428604443) **Adding Articles to Customized Content** Adding Articles to Customized Content just got easier because we added optional **Grade Level** and **Subject** filters. **Customized Content > Item > Article** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718428606875) Selecting a Grade Level or Subject will show the correlating publications: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718453389083) We also reduced the number of clicks from having separate dropdown boxes to choose a Unit then a Week, to seeing the Units and Weeks combined into one dropdown.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38718453390875) **New Sub Menu Under Teacher Actions** Now when teachers hover over Printables in Teacher Actions, they will see a sub menu of the available printables. Once selected the printables will open in a new browser tab. ![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXe8Vh7dT7RP1gGMG3geu-8cTT2BWWTw59DR5ZKE_qA2mcBprJljFGro1q1yY6tGeA0nbwFkJjkd5Fto78Y3kKDqZRbpBDjvCtinOSw4Nld2kkFsUilW61Gn6jR9JdtIkE398CvGwQ?key=v-6iuT8kgqDmo5-BLXxhLA) **Google Translate** Teachers and admins can enable Google Translate for students who require language support, as well as for their own use. Full instructions can be found in the (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38782745566235-Utilizing-Google-Translate-in-Studies-Weekly-Online) article. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38791188692635) **New Student Table of Contents Experience** The new student Table of Contents experience was redesigned to match the teacher experience. Units are easier to identify with their highlighted pastel background. Units and Weeks can be opened or closed with the new expand/collapse buttons ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794728751515)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794720228763) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794728754459) To learn about navigating a student account visit the [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience) section of the Help Center. title: How to Add Previously Created Customized Content
meta_description: Teachers can add Customized Content they (or a co-teacher) previously created in other classrooms, to their students To Do tab.   From...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  How to Add Previously Created Customized Content 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can add Customized Content they (or a co-teacher) previously created in other classrooms, to their students To Do tab.
From the Customized Content Page From Already Created Customized Content
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** : 
  1. Click the **Customized Content** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821889527963)
  2. Click **Create Customized****Content**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36419891746075)
  3. Before selecting the content, you will need to **Title** the Customized Content, add **Instructions** , and a **Due Date**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531954924059)
  4. Select the **+Add** button to grab the option **Add Previously Created Customized Content**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37591034566683)
  5. Use the dropdown arrows to select the classroom the Previously Created Customized Content is located in and which content you wish to add. (As soon as a selection is made this pop-up modal disappears and opens to the next step.) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531991323419)
  6. Click **Next** to confirm the addition, and assign the Customized Content to the new classroom.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531991325211)
  7. The final step is to choose where you would like to assign the content, including which classrooms and students. If the box is selected next to a student’s name, it will appear in the student's To Do section. Uncheck a student's box to remove the Content from their view. Teachers can choose to add additional Classrooms and students using the provided check boxes. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531991327131)
  8. Select **Create** to finalize as assign the content. A notification will appear on screen confirming the creation. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34259236802459)


To learn more, visit the [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** : 
  1. Click the **Customized Content** button. 
  2. Open the existing Customized Content you wish you add the Previously Created Content to. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531991331099)
  3. Select **Edit** to make changes. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37531991333019)
  4. Scroll down and select the **+Add** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34260633062299)
  5. From the list of options, select **Add Previously Created Customized Content**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34260633065883)
  6. Use the dropdown arrows to select the classroom the Previously Created Customized Content is located in and which content you wish to add. (As soon as a selection is made this pop-up modal disappears and opens to the next step.) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34260633067931)
  7. You can then choose to **Edit** the added questions, change who the content will be assigned to, or choose **Save** to finish. Choosing**Save** will make the content appear in the student's To do section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34260633069851)


To learn more, visit the [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page)
  * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content)
  * [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content)
  * [Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher)
  * [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content)
  * [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Spot Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15527064098075-Hot-Spot-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Text Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type)

title: Digital Printable Question Type

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  Digital Printable Question Type 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Digital Printables allow students to interact with a printable created by Studies Weekly. Students can interact with the Digital Printable in the following ways:
  * Free draw (with color and line size options)
  * Add basic shapes (with color and thickness options)
  * Write/type (with font, color, and format options)
  * Highlight (with color options)
  * Earn coins


Teachers will need to grade this question type. To share a Digital Printable created by Studies Weekly with students, follow the initial steps in the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article, then from the **Add** button, select **Digital Printables**. 
Choose the Publication, Unit, and Week:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851851039515)
Click a thumbnail to see a preview.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851851051675)
If necessary, the Digital Printable can be rotated so students view it right-side-up. Select the **Add** button in the bottom right corner of the modal. 
When you are ready to share the Digital Printable with students, click **Create**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851914114459)
Visit the article [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool) to learn how students will complete Digital Printables.
