title: How to Navigate the Snapshot Report
meta_description: The Snapshot Report will show your student's statistics on questions and highlights within articles. From your Studies Weekly Online...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Navigate the Snapshot Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Snapshot Report will show your student's statistics on questions and highlights within articles.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card:**
  1. Click **Reports**.
  2. Click **Snapshot Report**.
  3. Use the dropdown boxes to **Select****Publication** , **Select** **Week** , and **Select Content**.
  4. Select either **Statistics** or **Highlights**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515027498011)
Note
Statistics and Highlights can also be found after clicking into a week in the Table of Contents. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31299784677275)
Statistics Highlights
The Statistics tab allows teachers to check student understanding and progress on article questions, activities, customized content, weekly assessments, Crossword and Misspilled.
The default view shows teachers their student list. It can be sorted by**Name** to see who has **Not Taken** (not completed) their comprehension questions and see **Coins** **Earned/Coin Possible** for the selected Content (chosen in the dropdown box).![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515000392731)
Click each article comprehension question to see a bar graph of responses and how many attempts students’ took to get the correct answer. Student attempts are numbered sequentially as shown directly below the chart. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515000395035)
#### ***Two additional overviews are available within Statistics.**
After selecting an Assessment, customized Content, Crossword, or Misspilled from the **Content** dropdown. The **Class Overview** and the **Student Score Overview** become available.
#### ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515000397339)
**Class Overview**
The Class Overview shows the percentile scores for the class in a bar chart. Hovering over each bar gives teachers the student count for that percentile range. Individual scores can also be found directly below the bar chart.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515000401179)
**Student Score Overview**
The Student Score Overview shows the score for each student in a bar chart. Hovering over each bar will give the number correct for that student. Individual student scores can also be found directly below the bar chart.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27521565796507)
Teachers may view what the students have highlighted and annotated in each article. 
Within **Highlights** , you’ll see individual student highlights and total highlights for the class.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30515000403611)
Each student in the classroom appears on the list. The colored circles located to the right of each student’s name show the number of highlights the student has made in that color for that article. Circles that are shaped like a conversation bubble indicate that the student has left notes for that highlighted section.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16711715648283)
Click a colored circle for a student to show their highlights and notes.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16711722980635)
Click a student name to show the list of all highlights in all colors made by that student.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16711715654043)
Hover over color in the Total Class Highlights chart to see the number of total highlights for that color.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16711722987675)
Click on the color in the Total Class Highlights chart to see a list of all students who highlighted text using that color and what they highlighted.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16711722990619)
To return to the Highlight Report, click **Back** located above the purple header bar.
To learn about other reports, see the  _[Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)_ section of the Help Center. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Reports page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14115607419675-How-to-Navigate-the-Reports-page)
  * [How to Use the Publication Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6945453054491-How-to-Use-the-Publication-Report)
  * [How to Use the Progress Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9570272877211-How-to-Use-the-Progress-Report)
  * [How to Use the Assessment Score Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470501549467-How-to-Use-the-Assessment-Score-Report)
  * [How to Use the Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report)
  * [How to Navigate the Snapshot Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report)
  * [Leaderboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/26174274831643-Leaderboard)
  * [How to Navigate the Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33952794758299-How-to-Navigate-the-Standards-Report)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F360000669128-How-Do-I-Change-My-Password "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24192808156571-Additional-Features)


#  How Do I Change My Password? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers with manually created accounts can change their password at any time in their Studies Weekly Online Account Dashboard. 
If a teacher account was created using an automated rostering method, such as ClassLink or Clever, a password change must be requested by the teacher to their rostering admin within the district. 
From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account
  1.     1. Click on the **Profile Menu** in the top-right corner of the page.
    2. In the pop-up box, select **Account Settings**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37861024919195)
    3. Navigate to the Password box and type your new password. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37861024920091)
       * Passwords must be a minimum of 5 characters
       * Need at least one capital letter
       * Need at least one number
    4. Type your new password again under Confirm Password.
    5. Click **Save**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31545172256155)


To change passwords for student accounts, visit the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) Help Center article. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How Do I Change My Password?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000669128-How-Do-I-Change-My-Password)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  How To Create a Classroom 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers may create multiple classrooms in their Studies Weekly Online account. If you teach several grades or several classes of one grade, you can set up each as a separate online class. 
Note
Districts using Studies Weekly to create classrooms and roster user accounts for use of a single sign-on (SSO) will not be able to add additional classrooms to their account.
To create a classroom, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account.
  1. In the menu bar select the **Classrooms** tab.
  2. Click the **Create Classroom** button.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35821147359259)
  3. Fill in the classroom **Name** , **Grade** , **Subjects** , **Start of School Date** , and **End of School Date**.
  4. Choose with features to toggle **On/Off** (these can be edited at any time).
  5. Select a **Classroom Image**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37037455286171)
  6. Click **Continue** in the lower right corner. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37037455290523)
  7. Add publications by clicking the checkboxes for each publication you want (this step can be skipped and done later). **You may need to reset the dropdown boxes to find publications.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30774156354715)**
  8. Click **Continue** in the upper right corner. 
  9. Add students by typing or copying and pasting their names into the text box (this step can be skipped and done later).![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29128685083163)
  10. Click **Create Classroom**.


To learn more, see the [How to Navigate the Classrooms Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-Navigating-the-Classes-Page) article.

title: How to Navigate the Classrooms Page
meta_description: The Classrooms page is where teachers land upon logging in. Here, they have quick access to find, create, archive, and view classrooms....
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classrooms-Page#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  How to Navigate the Classrooms Page 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Classrooms page is where teachers land upon logging in. Here, they have quick access to find, create, archive, and view classrooms. Access assigned publications, Reports, Customized Content, rosters, and grade student submissions.
Classroom Page Actions:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819635268635)
**A**.**Refresh Button** : R**efresh the list of Classrooms**
**B**. **Active** /**Inactive** : Swap between Active and Inactive Classrooms.
**C**. **Search** : Type the name of a classroom you have access to.
**D**.**Create Classroom: Follow the steps to create a new classroom if your district is not using a single sign-on (see the [How to Create a Classroom ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom)article).**
**E**. **Classroom Expiration** : This notification will appear 30 days prior to expiration for _manually created_ Classrooms. Select **Update** to extend the date range. After 30 days the classroom will move to the **Inactive** tab. 
**F**. **Classroom Cards** : Each class assigned to the teacher or created by the teacher is visible on the Classrooms Page.
#### Individual Classroom Actions 
The card view of each classroom has navigation buttons that when clicked, will open specific classroom elements. The horizontal scroll bar allows teachers to view and click directly into a publication.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606845723)
** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819635271323)**Move** : The move feature allows teachers to organize the classroom cards into any order. **
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606847387)Actions:** Allows you to deactivate the classroom. (This is only available if you created the classroom.)
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606848155)**View All** : Takes you to the Publications page for the selected classroom.**
Clicking a classroom’s name within a card, will take you to the [Publications page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page) for that classroom. The quick links pictured above (People, Teacher Notes, Grade, Reports, Customized Content, and Classroom Settings) correspond with the tabs on the left side of the screen (pictured below). Either link you select will take you to the same place.
To view the [Join Code](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code) or view a different Classroom, select the dropdown arrow next to the name of the current classroom.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606850459)
For further instructions on navigating Studies Weekly Online, view additional [Teacher articles here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher) _._
Note
At the end of the school year, classes will be auto-archived the day after the chosen **End of School Date**. To learn more, see the [How to Edit, Archive, and Recover Classes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Archive-and-Recover-Classrooms) article.

  * [How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms)

(This is only available if you created the classroom.) **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606848155)**View All** : Takes you to the Publications page for the selected classroom.** Clicking a classroom’s name within a card, will take you to the [Publications page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page) for that classroom. The quick links pictured above (People, Teacher Notes, Grade, Reports, Customized Content, and Classroom Settings) correspond with the tabs on the left side of the screen (pictured below). Either link you select will take you to the same place. To view the [Join Code](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code) or view a different Classroom, select the dropdown arrow next to the name of the current classroom. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35819606850459) For further instructions on navigating Studies Weekly Online, view additional [Teacher articles here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher) _._ Note At the end of the school year, classes will be auto-archived the day after the chosen **End of School Date**. To learn more, see the [How to Edit, Archive, and Recover Classes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Archive-and-Recover-Classrooms) article. Articles in this section * [How to Navigate the Classrooms Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classrooms-Page) * [How To Create a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom) * [How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms) * [Viewing Student Progress in Inactive Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22608582033819-Viewing-Student-Progress-in-Inactive-Classrooms) * [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay) * [How to Use the Join Code](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code) * [How to Turn Off/On Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6969890508187-How-to-Turn-Off-On-Games) Recently viewed articles * [How To Create a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom) * [How Do I Change My Password?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000669128-How-Do-I-Change-My-Password) * [How to Navigate the Snapshot Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report) * [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type) * [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content)

meta_description: (Currently available to support unpacking the TEKS in Texas Science publications.) The Professional Development section allows admins to...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23714960439579-Professional-Development-Classroom#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [Professional Development](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/23987965693595-Professional-Development)


#  Professional Development Classroom 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**_(Currently available to support unpacking the TEKS in Texas Science publications.)_**
The Professional Development section allows admins to create a classroom for educators and assign an on-demand Professional Development Publication. It can only be assigned by a district or school admin in Studies Weekly Online and is not visible to students.
The Professional Development Publication assigned to the classroom looks just like a student publication. Users who are enrolled, will answer Article Questions, just like a student. District or school admins will have access to view teachers’ completion in the Gradebook. 
Create Grade
To assign the publication to teachers, the district or school admin must first create a Professional Development classroom. Select the Professional Development tab from the top navigation bar.
After selecting the Professional Development button for the first time, admins will be prompted to create their classroom.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530317956123)
Additional classrooms can be created using the **Create Classroom** button in the top right corner of the screen.
#### **Step 1 of 3: Enter Classroom Information**
Changes can be made to the class name, dates, or class image after saving, by visiting the **Classroom Settings** of the **Classroom Card.**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530059195035)
#### **Step 2 of 3: Choose Publication**
The available Professional Development Publication(s) will depend on your district or school. Select the available publication and choose **Continue** in the bottom right corner.
#### **Step 3 of 3: Assign Users**
District admins can assign teachers throughout the district to the Professional Development class. School admins creating a class, can assign teachers or other admins within their building to the class.
Studies Weekly Online users registered as a district or school admin can be given access to participate in the class as an **Admin** or **Teacher**. These users will have a checkbox beside their name for both the **Admin** column and the **Teacher** column (when selecting users for the class). Examples of admin users in the image below include Hazel Nutt and Marsha Mellow.
  * Selecting the **Admin Checkbox** will allow Gradebook access and users will navigate as if teaching the class. Additionally, they can assign or remove teachers.
  * If the **Teacher Checkbox** is selected, those users will participate in the Professional Development class as a student and can only see their own progress.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530095657371)


After choosing schools and user roles with the **Checkboxes** , finish by selecting **Create Classroom**.
If you need to add or remove users after creating the classroom, visit the **People** section of the **Classroom Card**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530059208219)
Note
After teachers have been assigned to a class, the Professional Development publication will be available in their dashboard. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26951029480091)
**Gradebook:**
The Gradebook will be available to users that have Admin access to the publication and will show which teachers have been assigned to the publication and who has completed the comprehension questions. 
Teachers must answer each multiple choice question correctly before advancing, exactly the same way that students respond to [Article Comprehension Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23813451785115-Article-Comprehension-Questions). This ensures mastery before progressing. Answers to questions are found within the articles and teachers are encouraged to go back to the Article to find the answer with every incorrect response. Unlimited attempts are available to reach the correct answer. Therefore, completion of Article Comprehension Questions will be shown with a checkmark in the Gradebook, as a reflection that they reached the correct responses. 
To begin, select**Grade** from the **Classroom Card.**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530059213723)
Use the available filters to view any completion data for Article Questions.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26951132959771)
Select a **Teacher Name** to view how they responded to questions.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/23987776115739)
**Quick Grade:**
Quick Grade will only be necessary if there are Assessments or Activities that have questions that require grading. 
For more precise information on the Grade Section visit [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) in the Help Center.
### Articles in this section
  * [Professional Development Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23714960439579-Professional-Development-Classroom)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5651306494619-Student-Experience)


#  How To View Weekly Progress 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students can view their weekly progress in the Table of Contents section by Publication. Each week of content displays progress information:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38792631408155)
  1. This box shows the progress bar displays the percentage of required articles students have completed for that week.
  2. As students progress, they earn coins for completing articles and activities. Each week shows how many coins the student has collected and how many coins remain.
  3. If students have taken the weekly assessment, an **Assessment Score** will appear. If the teacher has given the option to retake it, a **Retake Assessment** button will be available below the score.
  4. If students have not taken the weekly assessment, they will see a **Take Assessment** button. This is also true for a student if the teacher has allowed for a retake.
  5. Text saying “Assessment Not Available” will show if the teacher has turned the assessment off or there is not a Studies Weekly Online assessment for that week.


To learn more about the teacher view, see the [How to Navigate the Table of Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-Navigating-the-Table-of-Contents) _[s](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-Navigating-the-Table-of-Contents)_ article.

# Getting Started
New to Studies Weekly? Check out these articles to get your students online right away!
###  [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)
  * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started)

#  What teacher materials are included? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Each of our print edition publications has teacher materials designed for it, including a Teacher Edition. The Teacher Edition may include assessments, lesson plans, answer keys, activities, and more. The physical Teacher Edition will be sent in your shipment.
Recommendation
The Teacher Edition is also available online. See the [How to Access the Teacher Edition](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17772923416603) article to learn more.
If you have not yet created your online account, you should do so. You will find many other amazing teacher materials online including lesson plans, games, virtual field trips, highlighting/note taking, science lab videos, thousands of primary sources, and more.
See the [How to Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-an-Online-Account) article for step-by-step instructions to create your online account.

title: How to Use the Publication Report
meta_description: The Publication Report shows each student’s progress for the selected publication in a classroom. An updated report will be available...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6945453054491-How-to-Use-the-Publication-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6945453054491-How-to-Use-the-Publication-Report "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Use the Publication Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Publication Report shows each student’s progress for the selected publication in a classroom. An updated report will be available every 15 minutes. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Select **Reports**. 
  2. Under **Publication Report** , select a publication.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36067090404379)


**A**. Use the dropdown to change the publication.
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D**. Click any column header to sort the rows by that category. If your screen size doesn’t show all of the columns, use the scroll bar under the report to see more columns.
  * **Average Assessment Score** : Shows the student’s average score on weekly assessments (created by Studies Weekly).
  * **Number of Assessments Taken** : Shows how many weekly assessments (created by Studies Weekly) were taken by each student.
  * **Highlights:** Shows the students' total number of highlights made across the publication.
  * **Article Comprehension Questions Answered** : Shows the number of article questions each student answered.
  * **Explore More Media Questions Answered** : Shows the students' number of Explore More media questions answered.


The following items will only appear in the report if they are present in the selected publication:
  * **Average Rubric Score** : For publications that contain Rubric(s), the student’s average score will be shown.
  * **Crosswords** : Shows the number of crosswords students have completed.
  * **Misspilled** : Shows the students' time on their most recent attempt of a Misspilled vocabulary review.
  * **Activities Submitted** : Shows the number of activities each student has submitted.


### **Individual Student reports**
Select a student name to view individual student reports. Each week of the selected publication will be shown with the same columns as the class view. (Loading times will vary.) Use the buttons or scroll bar to access the **Assessment Overview** and **Comprehension Progress** below the week chart.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35200686111387)
The **Assessment Overview** graphs the student assessment score for each week. Hovering over a score dot will show the student’s score for that week. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35166983588635)
Note
The line will only be present when sequential weeks are completed.
The **Comprehension Progress** graph will show the total percentage of Article Questions, Explore More Media Questions, and Activity Questions answered by the student, regardless of the number of times it took the student to correctly answer them. Some questions need to be graded by the teacher.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26534382250139)
**Article Questions** are comprehension questions at the bottom of an article. Some articles do not have article comprehension questions.
**Explore More Media Questions** are comprehension questions found in the [Explore More Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5468975162267-How-to-Access-the-Explore-More-Media) section at the bottom of some articles. Some articles do not have Explore More Media.
**Activity Questions** are questions for Activities, as identified on the Table of Contents. Some activities will need to be completed offline.
The**Rubric Scores** graph will show the students exact scores for the week when you hover over the orange bars.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/23646285251355)
**To return to the Publication Report, click ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35199709290011) **at the top of the page.
### **Printing the Publication Report**
Before printing, teachers may need to edit the **Rows per page** option if not all the students in the class are visible. In the bottom right corner of the screen, click the down arrow to expand the number of students visible.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35199656459035)
To learn about other reports, see the [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) section of the Help Center. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Reports page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14115607419675-How-to-Navigate-the-Reports-page)
  * [How to Use the Publication Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6945453054491-How-to-Use-the-Publication-Report)
  * [How to Use the Progress Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9570272877211-How-to-Use-the-Progress-Report)
  * [How to Use the Assessment Score Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470501549467-How-to-Use-the-Assessment-Score-Report)
  * [How to Use the Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report)
  * [How to Navigate the Snapshot Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report)
  * [Leaderboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/26174274831643-Leaderboard)
  * [How to Navigate the Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33952794758299-How-to-Navigate-the-Standards-Report)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14115607419675-How-to-Navigate-the-Reports-page#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F14115607419675-How-to-Navigate-the-Reports-page "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Navigate the Reports page 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Reports page is where teachers can access their student data for the selected classroom.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click the **Reports** button. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38822294733723)


For detailed information on each report, visit the articles below.
  * [**Publication Report**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6945453054491-How-to-Use-the-Classroom-Report): shows student progress for the selected publication within a classroom. 
  * [**Progress Report**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9570272877211-How-to-Use-the-Progress-Report) : shows student progress in completing the weekly content. 
  * [**Assessment Score**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470501549467-How-to-Use-the-Weekly-Assessment-Score-Report)**:** shows the average score for weekly assessments.
  * [**Customized Content Report**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report) : shows the average score for each customized content item. 
  * [**Snapshot Report**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report) : shows student statistics on comprehension questions and student highlights in the articles. 
  * [**Leaderboard**](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/26174274831643-Leaderboard): shows how many coins students earn for a chosen date range in a classroom.


As a reminder, to learn more about updates to Studies Weekly Online, visit the Resource in the bottom left corner of the screen. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16364865449755)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Use the Customized Content Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can access a Customized Content Report to see student scores for Customized Content. 
Note
Customized Content includes any teacher-created or district-created content. Students can view assigned Customized Content on their To-Do list or in the Table of Contents. To learn more, see the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787) article.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click **Reports**.
  2. Select **Customized Content Report**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35201477969563)
**A**. The default view for the Customized Content Report is the **Classroom Overview**.
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D**. Hover over each bar to see the average score for the Customized Content. 
Teachers can also click or tap on each item to see individual student scores.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35201448926363)
To view the total average Customized Content score for each student, select **Student Overview**. The list will include all students enrolled in the class and their average score. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35201448932251)
To see how individual students performed on each piece of Customized Content, select a name from the list. 
Note
If Customized Content includes Open Response question types, the student responses must be graded by the teacher before the scores will appear on the list.
The submission date, title of the Customized Content, and score will be visible for each piece of **submitted** content. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35201448937499)
To review a student's responses, select a piece of content from the list. In the pop-up, a teacher can leave comments for the student or print the submission. When finished click **Cancel** or the **X** in the upper right corner of the pop-up. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/19789148496283)
To learn about other reports, visit the [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can create new student accounts. When a new student account is created, teachers will be prompted to choose a username and password for the student. This article addresses some common issues with student usernames and passwords.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired**Classroom Card:**
  1. Click **People**.
  2. In the Students bar, click the click the **Create Student** button ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/17890870916123) to create a unique username and password for your students. In the dialog box that appears, type a **First Name** , **Last Name** , **Username** , and **Password**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30679153951771)
You may find auto-filled information or a message stating that the username is taken. Click on the tabs below to see how to resolve these issues.
**Browser Auto-fills Information**
Sometimes the browser will automatically fill the _First Name_ , _Last Name_ , _Username_ , and _Password_ with your saved information. Delete your information to type in the student’s name, username, and password.
**The Username is Taken**
Studies Weekly has students in all 50 states using the online product. Usernames must be unique so they don’t access another student's account. If the username has already been taken, try adding a number to the name or use the student's school ID number.
**The Student Already Has a Username and Password**
If students have used Studies Weekly Online before, they can continue to use the same username and password. The student will need to be transferred from the previous class to the new class.
If the student doesn’t remember their previous username and password, ask their previous teacher for the student’s login information.
For more ways to add students, see the [How to Add Students to Your Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom) article. To edit existing student usernames and passwords individually or in bulk, see the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article.

  * [How To Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts)

  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Share a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Classroom)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38782745566235-Utilizing-Google-Translate-in-Studies-Weekly-Online#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [Technology FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510752603035-Technology-FAQs)


#  Utilizing Google Translate in Studies Weekly Online 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers and admins can enable Google Translate for students who require language support, as well as for their own use. When Google Translate is enabled, all text included in Studies Weekly Online pages will be translated. However, any embedded videos with audio and text highlighting within the Audio Reader will remain in English.
#### **Enable Google Translate for Adult Users**
To enable Google Translate for yourself, open **Account Settings** in the **Profile Menu**. Then enable the **Google Translate Toggle** to blue. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38789477001371)
The page will automatically refresh and the Google Translate option will appear in the top navigation bar. Use the **Select Language** bar to change the language.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38784702915483)
To quickly turn translation back off for your Studies Weekly Online account, use the **Options** dropdown above the top navigation bar and choose **Turn off translation for this site** or click the **X** next to the dropdown.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38784702917147)
#### **Enable Google Translate for Students**
Some students could benefit from having Google translate enabled. Teachers can enable it for one student at a time or for all students in the **People** section.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38820365821595)
Once Google Translate is enabled, students can log in and select their language.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38787753272731)
Family account holders can also enable Google Translate for their accounts, just like a teacher or admin. The [Navigating the Family Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard) article provides instructions and can be shared with families.
### Articles in this section
  * [Utilizing Google Translate in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38782745566235-Utilizing-Google-Translate-in-Studies-Weekly-Online)

  * [Which Question Types have the Audio Reader Function? ​​](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9340334621595-Which-Question-Types-have-the-Audio-Reader-Function)
  * [How to Clear Your Cache and Cookies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416415911963-How-to-Clear-Your-Cache-and-Cookies)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2023-2024](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/15075843254427-2023-2024)


#  February 2024 Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**User Avatars for Students and Teachers**
Students and teachers have the ability to change their user Avatar by navigating to Account Settings within the Profile Menu.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22977710248859)
Select Change Avatar
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22978820248347)
Change the color of your background or select a picture by clicking on it, then Save in the bottom right corner.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22978820296731)
**View Student Progress in Archived Classes**
Teachers have the ability to view student progress in Archived Classrooms. This includes data from Customized Content, the Grade section, and Reports. For complete details visit the Help Center article[ Viewing Student Progress in Archived Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22608582033819-Viewing-Student-Progress-in-Archived-Classrooms). 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22979519696923)
**Highlighting Text in Questions**
When students select the play button for questions (and answers) within Articles, Activities, Assessments, and Customized Content text will be highlighted as they are being read by Studies Weekly Online.![2024-02-19_10-41-24.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/23069992941211)
**Print All Feature in Teacher Resources**
Teachers can now print all or make a specific selection using the **Print** button inside headers of sections containing PDFs. To learn more about Teacher Resources visit the Help Center article [How to Access and Navigate Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17772923416603-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-Teacher-Resources).
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/23229045275419)

#  Which Question Types have the Audio Reader Function? ​​ 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online has many question types for assessments and Customized Content. Most question types have an audio reader function, which can play the text aloud to students.
![Screen_Shot_2022-10-04_at_15.59.47.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9340290628379)
The question types that currently have audio are:
  * True False
  * Multiple Choice
  * Check All That Apply / Multiselect
  * Open Response
  * Fill In the Blank / Inline Choice*
  * Numeric
  * Drawing
  * Sorting*
  * Labeling*
  * Matching*
  * Grouping*
  * Hot Spot*
  * Hot Text*
  * Text
  * Media
  * Digital Printable*


* These question types will not have text highlighting of answers along with audio. 
To learn more, visit the [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader) article.

title: How to Navigate the District Admin Role
meta_description: As a District Administrator using Studies Weekly Online, you have access to view all of the Teachers, Students, and Classrooms connected...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators)


#  How to Navigate the District Admin Role 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
As a District Administrator using Studies Weekly Online, you have access to view all of the Teachers, Students, and Classrooms connected to your organization. You also have the ability to log in as any teacher or student. This article will cover how to navigate your role. Additional information can be found in the [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online) article.
**District Overview Usage Report**
The District Overview refreshes nightly and shows how the district is rostered (if applicable), the sync status, and when the sync was last started. It also shows the total number of Students, Teachers, and Classrooms connected to your district. All accounts will appear here, no matter how they were created. Select each option (Students, Teachers, and Classrooms) to view the available columns. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36057648605723)
**A**. If your district **_manually_** enrolls students in Studies Weekly Online, the **Roster Method** will say None. The **Sync Status** and **Sync Last Started** will say N/A.
**B**. This is the total number of Students, Teachers, and Classrooms connected to your district. This data makes it easier for you to keep track of the total number of users. Each tab can be clicked to see the full list of names.
**C**. A **Search** feature allows you to type in the name of a student, teacher, or classroom you want to find.
**D**. If your district is **_manually_** enrolled, the ID column for Students, Teachers, and Classrooms will say Not Rostered.
**E**. Click the column header to reorder the information in each column.
**F**. If you wish to see more rows per page, use the dropdown menu to add more rows. You can also click the arrows to advance to the next page or visit a previous page.
When you click a student’s name from the list, a pop-up modal will show the **Student Details** including the **LOG IN AS** feature. This allows you to log into the student’s account.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31495620735387)
When you click a teacher’s name from the **Staff** tab, a pop-up modal will show the **Teacher Details** including the **LOG IN AS** feature. This allows you to log into the teacher’s account.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33332238500891)
The **Classrooms** tab will list all of the rostered or manually created classrooms in your district. When you click a classroom’s name, a pop-up modal will show the Classroom details including the grade level, teacher, and number of students assigned.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31495637499803)
In the Classroom Details you will also notice an option to click the **LOG IN AS** feature to impersonate the teacher or students.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31495620751131)
For more information on Rostering, see the [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs-) article. 
The Usage Report lists all of the schools in your district with access to Studies Weekly Online. The report includes the total number of teachers and students assigned to each building and how many teachers and students logged in over the course of the school year. To view the teachers and students who have logged in, select the blue link in each column.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31495620757019)
The Usage Report will show: 
  * **Teachers Enrolled** : Total number of teachers with classes assigned in Studies Weekly Online. 
  * **# of Unique Teacher Logins this Month** : Count of individual teachers who have logged in. 
  * **Total Teacher Logins this Month** : Total teacher logins over the course of the month.
  * **# of Unique Teacher Logins this School Year** : Count of individual teachers who have logged in. 
  * **Total Teacher Logins this School Year** : Total teacher logins over the course of the school year. 
  * **Students Enrolled:** Total number of students assigned to a class in Studies Weekly Online. 
  * **# of Unique Student Logins this Month** : Count of individual students who have logged in.
  * **Total Student Logins this Month** : Total student logins over the course of the school year. 
  * **# of Unique Student Logins this School Year** : Count of individual students who have logged in.
  * **Total Student Logins this School Year** : Total student logins over the course of the school year. 


Note
User level roles are easy to identify by the color of the navigational sidebar. A District Admin’s sidebar is dark gray, while a School Admin’s sidebar is green. A Teacher’s sidebar is blue, and a Student’s sidebar is purple.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26948523550875)
If you are a School Administrator, visit the [How to Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187) article.
For information on navigating the student dashboard, visit the [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531).
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role)
  * [How to Create and Share District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content)
  * [District Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report)
  * [District Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report)
  * [Manual Sync of District Roster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003-Manual-Sync-of-District-Roster)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)


#  How District and School Administrators Can Register 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
District and School Administrators can manually create a user account with Studies Weekly Online. Many districts choose to roster accounts for all users and students district wide through a variety of automated processes. 
**B****efore admins create an account please review the[ Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs-) options in our [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).**
**If you are a homeschool teacher, please[ register as a teacher here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account). **
To register your district or school admin account manually, go to [online.studiesweekly.com ](https://online.studiesweekly.com/)
  1. Click the **Administrator** button. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035452150043)
  2. Fill out the form with your information. 
Important Note
Once your account has been created you will **_not_** be able to change your state, district, or school unless you reach out to Customer Support.*
  3. Click **Register Account**.**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30674248941979)**


After submitting the form, you will see a message at the top of the page saying that your account is pending. Someone will reach out to let you know your account is active.
***** If you need assistance with your account please contact Customer Support at 866-311-8734, or via chat or email in the Resource Center.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30674425970203)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002738242715-Technology)
  3. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5661909188635-Technology)


#  Hardware FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**What are your hardware specifications?**
Studies Weekly's online content site is designed as a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) service. It can be used with many hardware and software platforms. 
Any device that can run the most recent versions of a major web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) with JavaScript enabled can access Studies Weekly content. See the [_Technical Requirements_](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements) article for more detail.
**Do you work with iPads?**
Yes, iPads capable of running a recent version of iOS and an up-to-date web browser can access Studies Weekly's online content.
See the [_Technical Requirements_](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements) article for more detail.
**What settings are required to work with iPads (e.g., pop-ups, whitelisting, browser requirements, space)?**
The iPad should have a recent iOS operating system, an up-to-date web browser, and JavaScript enabled.
Some districts have strict firewall rules. See the [_Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?_](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Whitelist) article for a full list of websites to whitelist.
**Do you have an iPad app, or is it web-based?**
Studies Weekly's online site currently operates as a web-based service. You just need an up-to-date web browser to access Studies Weekly Online content. Studies Weekly does not plan on releasing a standalone app in the near future. See the [_Technical Requirements_](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements) article for more detail.
**How often do you update the app?**
Studies Weekly frequently updates its online web service. Major version updates are planned for release between school terms.If you need support or have feedback, click on **Submit a request** in the upper right-hand corner of this page.
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen)
  * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors)
  * [Google Class Access Restricted by Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35774800816155-Google-Class-Access-Restricted-by-Administrator)
  * [Technical Requirements](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements)
  * [Hardware FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317432328091-Hardware-FAQs)
  * [Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Which-websites-does-my-IT-department-need-to-whitelist)
  * [Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27915488755227-Setting-Up-LTI-Deep-Linking-with-Canvas-for-your-District)
  * [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher)

title: How to Navigate the Table of Contents
meta_description: Each publication has a Table of Contents. Here, teachers will see the list of content available to students, along with additional...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Navigate the Table of Contents 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Each publication has a Table of Contents. Here, teachers will see the list of content available to students, along with additional resources. There are two different views when inside the Table of Contents, the Table of Contents Overview page and the content within a week.
Open each tab below to learn more. 
Overview Navigation Options for Students and Teachers Teacher Content
The Table of Contents Overview page shows the titles of the Units, Weeks/Lessons, Articles, Activities, Crossword, Misspilled, Weekly Assessments, Unit Assessments, Rubrics, Lesson Walkthroughs, Lesson Walkthroughs, and Extended Reading Articles (online only). Not all weeks will have each item. 
The following options apply to every level of the publication in the Table of Contents.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554280558491)
**A**. **Breadcrumbs** : Navigational breadcrumbs can be used to switch classrooms, publications, or weeks within a publication (from the content page.)
**B**. **Quick Navigation Dropdown** : Allows users to navigate between Weeks/Lessons.
**C**. **Publication Dropdown** : Allows users to quickly change the publication within the classroom. 
**D**. **Sub Navigation Bar** : Change your location by selecting any of the buttons. 
**E**. **Expand/Collapse Button** : Click the button next to a Unit or Week title to open/close content in a week.
**F.** **Manage Publication** : Opens a modal that allows teachers to see:
**a**. What content is **Currently Visible** to students. Content marked as "OFF" is not counted. If specific content is not available for the selected publication, it will not be listed in the **Currently Visible** box. i.e., if there are no Rubrics or Crosswords available, they will not be listed.
**b**. **Content Toggles** to mark individual items as visible (blue) or hidden (gray) from students. By default all content is visible. 
**c**. The **Publication Visibility Toggle** will hide all content within the publication from students.
**d**. The **Revert to Default** button will revert all content within the publication back to the original order. It will also reset all toggles to the “ON” position.
**e**. Teachers will need to press **Save** to confirm any changes.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638119658139)
#### **Level-Specific Options**
Some options only apply to certain levels in the publication. Once a Unit and a Week have been selected, the additional options become visible. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638119660443)
**A**.**Hyperlinks:** Opens the content with access to the **Student View** and **Teacher Resources** tabs.
**B**. **Move Arrows** : Reorder Weeks/Lessons and content with a click and drag motion to the new location.
**C**. **Toggle** : Allows you to hide individual Weeks/Lessons and content from students.
**D**. **Quick Links:** When available, choose these links to view Printables, the Weekly Assessment PDF, Student Edition PDF, or open the Teacher Resources tab. Place your cursor over an item to see its description. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30124995449371)
**E**. **Manage Content:** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554274826523)
  *     *       * **Week/Lesson** : For each week, you can **Clear your Progress** ,**Mark as Optional** , or **Share Link to Google Classroom**.
      * **Content within the Week** : The articles and activities within each week can be marked as optional.


Opening a week within a publication will show you all the content, resources, and important features.
Once a publication has been selected, choose the content you would like to view.
  1. Click the **Expand/Collapse Button** for a **Unit** to expand and view the weeks.
  2. Click the **Expand/Collapse Button** for a **Week** to expand and view the content in the week. (If you click the hyperlink it will open the week.)
  3. To view more features, select a piece of content under the week.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638124777755)
Each item will have the same basic features above and below it. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554274828443)
**A**.**Location Dropdown** : This shows you where you are and provides access that will take you to different sections of the publication. 
**B. Rate the Article:** Optionally select a star next to the title of the item (in the blue bar) to open a pop-up window where you can leave feedback about the article.
**C**. **Audio Reader** : The Audio Reader will highlight each word as it reads with an engaging voice. To learn more visit the [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader) article. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30125573861915)
**D**. **Reader Mode** : Expands the content to fit the entire screen and will include all content on the screen. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38802242195483)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38802242196763)
**E. Previous** and**Next Buttons** : Click to navigate quickly through the articles for that week and get to the assessment or vocabulary reviews. These are sticky buttons at the top of the article and will move with users as they scroll down the page.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554274829339) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554280564507)
At the bottom of the screen, under the item content, you will see **Explore More** and the **Save** and**Submit** buttons. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30707140445851)
**Explore More** contains media such as videos, images, and audio, which often contain questions related to the media. Not all articles will have an Explore More section.
**Save** and **Submit** buttons: A student can save their work during Activities, Assessments, Crossword, and Misspilled to finish later or submit to the teacher. 
Opening content within the week provides easy access for seeing the Student View, finding Teacher Resources, Grading, viewing student Highlights and Statistics, and accessing Teacher Actions.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38802232837403)
  * **Student View** : View what a student will see, including the Article content and questions, Activities, Crossword, Misspilled, Weekly Assessments, Unit Assessments, Rubrics, Lesson Walkthroughs, and Extended Reading Articles. In the **Student View** tab teachers have the same functionality as students, in which they can select answers to content questions and leave notes. (Use the **Clear My Progress** feature to erase answers and notes.)
  * **Teacher Resources** : Quick access to available Teacher Resources for the selected article. This also includes access to Week, Unit, and Publication resources.
  * **Grade:** View and grade student submissions related to the week (visit the [Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade) of the Help Center.)
  * **Highlights:** View which sections students have highlighted and where they added comments (visit the [How To View Student Highlights](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/7081273428891) article).
  * **Statistics:** See an overview of how students performed on article comprehension questions, activities, and assessments (visit the [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions) article.)
  * **Teacher Actions:** (Below options will vary depending on the content type and which tab has been selected.)
  *     *       * **Copy Link** : Copy a direct link to the article. This link can be opened by anyone who has a Studies Weekly Online account and is in a classroom with access to the publication.
      * **Printables** : If available, will open in a pop-up window to view printable resources. 
      * **Print** : Print content from within the week.
      * **+ Customized Content** : Teachers can create Customized Content by editing their own copy of existing Studies Weekly Online content. It will prompt you to create a new copy, which you can find on the Customized Content page.
      * **Share LINK with Google Classroom** : Share the item to your Google Classroom.
      * **Answer Key** : Will provide answers to Article Questions, Crosswords, Misspilled, Customized Content, and Assessments.

  * [How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page)

  * [How to Reorder/Move Units, Weeks & Articles](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326817250203-How-to-Reorder-Move-Units-Weeks-Articles)
  * [How to Find and Print Answer Keys and Printables](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/16960761557915-How-to-Find-and-Print-Answer-Keys-and-Printables)

There are two different views when inside the Table of Contents, the Table of Contents Overview page and the content within a week. Open each tab below to learn more. Overview Navigation Options for Students and Teachers Teacher Content The Table of Contents Overview page shows the titles of the Units, Weeks/Lessons, Articles, Activities, Crossword, Misspilled, Weekly Assessments, Unit Assessments, Rubrics, Lesson Walkthroughs, Lesson Walkthroughs, and Extended Reading Articles (online only). Not all weeks will have each item. The following options apply to every level of the publication in the Table of Contents. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554280558491) **A**. **Breadcrumbs** : Navigational breadcrumbs can be used to switch classrooms, publications, or weeks within a publication (from the content page.) **B**. **Quick Navigation Dropdown** : Allows users to navigate between Weeks/Lessons. **C**. **Publication Dropdown** : Allows users to quickly change the publication within the classroom. **D**. **Sub Navigation Bar** : Change your location by selecting any of the buttons. **E**. **Expand/Collapse Button** : Click the button next to a Unit or Week title to open/close content in a week. **F.** **Manage Publication** : Opens a modal that allows teachers to see: **a**. What content is **Currently Visible** to students. Content marked as "OFF" is not counted. If specific content is not available for the selected publication, it will not be listed in the **Currently Visible** box. i.e., if there are no Rubrics or Crosswords available, they will not be listed. **b**. **Content Toggles** to mark individual items as visible (blue) or hidden (gray) from students. By default all content is visible. **c**. The **Publication Visibility Toggle** will hide all content within the publication from students. **d**. The **Revert to Default** button will revert all content within the publication back to the original order. It will also reset all toggles to the “ON” position. **e**. Opening a week within a publication will show you all the content, resources, and important features. Once a publication has been selected, choose the content you would like to view. 1. Click the **Expand/Collapse Button** for a **Unit** to expand and view the weeks. 2. Click the **Expand/Collapse Button** for a **Week** to expand and view the content in the week. (If you click the hyperlink it will open the week.) 3. To view more features, select a piece of content under the week. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638124777755) Each item will have the same basic features above and below it. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554274828443) **A**.**Location Dropdown** : This shows you where you are and provides access that will take you to different sections of the publication. **B. Rate the Article:** Optionally select a star next to the title of the item (in the blue bar) to open a pop-up window where you can leave feedback about the article. **C**. **Audio Reader** : The Audio Reader will highlight each word as it reads with an engaging voice. [ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Use the Progress Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers have access to a Progress Report that shows student progress in completing each week’s content. It shows who has started, not started, or finished the content, which includes weekly assessments, articles, and Vocabulary Review activities.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card:**
  1. Click **Reports**. 
  2. Click **Progress Report** , select a publication.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35200205951643)
**A**. Use the dropdown to change the publication.
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D**. Hover over each color in the bars to see the number of students who have not started (red), started (yellow), or finished (green) the content for that week. 
Teachers can also click on each bar to see the names of students in each category.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25763779104283)
To learn about other reports, see the [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002738242715-Technology)
  3. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5661909188635-Technology)


#  How to Troubleshoot Video Errors 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
If your Studies Weekly videos are not playing properly, please try these troubleshooting steps.
  * Try using Google Chrome. Please note that Internet Explorer is not a supported browser.
  * Clear your cache and cookies. See the _[How to Clear Your Cache and Cookies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416415911963)_ article for instructions.
  * Restart your browser (make sure to close all Chrome windows).
  * Whitelist a few websites. See the _[Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Whitelist)_ article for a full list.


If you are still experiencing problems, please contact customer support at 866-311-8734 or support@studiesweekly.com. You can also click on **Submit a request** in the upper right-hand corner of this page.
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen)
  * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors)

title: How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
