What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006690854-Teaching-Tools)


#  How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
In your Teacher Edition or in Teacher Resources, you may notice one of the needed materials listed is a “Words to Know” notebook. This is a domain-specific vocabulary notebook we recommend teachers make to help students keep track of new words they learn each week. You can create a class set or have each student create their own.
[![Vocab_Notebook_video.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/4406842842395)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/videos/pdod/Words%20To%20Know%20Vocabulary%20Notebook.mp4)
## **How to Make “Words to Know” Notebooks**
  1. Purchase a composition notebook or spiral notebook from a discount store.
  2. Download one of our “Words to Know” vocabulary notebook cover sheets (see below).
  3. Use glue to stick the cover sheet onto the front of your composition or spiral-bound notebook.
  4. Write your name (or have each student write their name) in the space provided at the top of the cover sheet.
  5. For a class set notebook, write the letter A at the top of the first two pages of your notebook (so you’re only writing on the right-side page). On the next two pages, write the letter B. Continue through the alphabet all the way to the letter Z. For student notebooks, have each student do this in their notebook.
  6. Look for suggested vocabulary words in your Teacher Edition or in Teacher Resources. Write those words in your notebook (or have students write them in theirs).
  7. At the end of each week, do a shared activity with your class where you go over the vocabulary words for that week.
  8. Have the words upon the board where students can see them.
  9. Elicit definitions for each word from your students.
  10. Have students write their definitions in their notebooks, or write their definitions into the class set notebook.


Have older students site where they found their definitions.
For ESL students, have them write definitions in their home language, draw pictures, or cut out images from their Studies Weekly student edition and glue them into their notebook.
## **Cover Sheets:**

  3. [Company FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/38719571510555-Company-FAQs)


#  Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The state of California has rules and laws that impact its social studies curriculum. For example, it requires 'fair and equitable coverage' of the LGBTQ+ community. We provide this content in our articles. Each district, school, and teacher can choose if they will cover those articles with students.
Here are the articles in our publications that pertain to California’s social studies content requirements for the LGBTQ+ community:
  * **Grade 2, Week 34:**[Alan Turing](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127985/units/128020#/articles/156208), Inventors
  * **Grade 2, Weeks 36:**[Harvey Milk & Sally Ride,](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127985/units/128022#/articles/156318) People Making a Difference
  * **Grade 4, Week 24:**[Charley Parkhurst: One Tough Stagecoach Driver](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128049#/articles/157100), gender differences
  * **Grade 4, Week 33:** [George Takei](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128058#/articles/154664), California Industries
  * **Grade 4, Week 35:** [Gay Rights Timeline](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128060#/articles/157326), California Government
  * **Grade 5, Week 19:**[Billie Jean King](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127830/units/128073#/articles/135054), Equal Rights
  * **Grade 5, Week 31:** [The Price of Freedom, Then and Now](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127830/units/128086#/articles/155164), Harvey Milk
  * **Grade 8, Week 5:** [States Rights](https://online.studiesweekly.com/teacher/classrooms/c9f41312-0068-40cb-b0e2-983d6654b2c0/publications/27/units/48/week/865/articles/17054), brief mention of same-sex marriage
  * **Grade 8, Week 24:** [Charley Parkhurst](https://online.studiesweekly.com/teacher/classrooms/c9f41312-0068-40cb-b0e2-983d6654b2c0/publications/27/units/48/week/884/articles/17516), gender differences


Please share this list with your peers to assist in selecting the material you feel most appropriate for your students.
### Articles in this section

  * [How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity)
  * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws)

We provide this content in our articles. Each district, school, and teacher can choose if they will cover those articles with students. Here are the articles in our publications that pertain to California’s social studies content requirements for the LGBTQ+ community: * **Grade 2, Week 34:**[Alan Turing](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127985/units/128020#/articles/156208), Inventors * **Grade 2, Weeks 36:**[Harvey Milk & Sally Ride,](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127985/units/128022#/articles/156318) People Making a Difference * **Grade 4, Week 24:**[Charley Parkhurst: One Tough Stagecoach Driver](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128049#/articles/157100), gender differences * **Grade 4, Week 33:** [George Takei](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128058#/articles/154664), California Industries * **Grade 4, Week 35:** [Gay Rights Timeline](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127820/units/128060#/articles/157326), California Government * **Grade 5, Week 19:**[Billie Jean King](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127830/units/128073#/articles/135054), Equal Rights * **Grade 5, Week 31:** [The Price of Freedom, Then and Now](https://app.studiesweekly.com/online/publications/127830/units/128086#/articles/155164), Harvey Milk * **Grade 8, Week 5:** [States Rights](https://online.studiesweekly.com/teacher/classrooms/c9f41312-0068-40cb-b0e2-983d6654b2c0/publications/27/units/48/week/865/articles/17054), brief mention of same-sex marriage * **Grade 8, Week 24:** [Charley Parkhurst](https://online.studiesweekly.com/teacher/classrooms/c9f41312-0068-40cb-b0e2-983d6654b2c0/publications/27/units/48/week/884/articles/17516), gender differences Please share this list with your peers to assist in selecting the material you feel most appropriate for your students. Articles in this section * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011618633-How-does-Studies-Weekly-handle-American-Indian-vs-Native-American-Terminology) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity) * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14325674495643-Texas-Science-Studies-Weekly-Component-Navigation) * [2023 Florida Publication Information](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14325803145883-2023-Florida-Publication-Information) Recently viewed articles * [How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406842650267-How-to-Create-Words-to-Know-Vocabulary-Notebooks) * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors) * [How to Use the Progress Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9570272877211-How-to-Use-the-Progress-Report) * [How to Navigate the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents) * [Hardware FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317432328091-Hardware-FAQs)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002825633-Ordering)
  3. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006715213-Ordering)


#  How to Select Shipping Preferences 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly has updated the order process for all orders made online, by phone, mail, or fax to include the options for Partial Shipments and Blackout Dates. To determine which options are the right choice for you, please review the information below.
### Full vs. Partial Shipping
Orders will **only** ship once **all** products are in stock **unless** you opt in to receive partial shipments. Partial shipping means available products will ship out right as they become available. If you decide to select the option to receive partial shipments, various SKUs may be sent to you at different times, depending on when each product is in stock.
If you are placing your order online, these shipping options are available on the Checkout page. Please check the box next to your shipping preference.
####  Attention
Please note that large orders using freight shipment do not have the option for partial shipping.
![Screen_Shot_2021-06-14_at_7.55.28_AM.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/4402308749083)
### Selecting Blackout Dates
Blackout Dates are timeframes that you are not available to receive a delivery. By selecting a Blackout window, this will ensure that your materials will not arrive when your school or district office is closed.
If you are available any weekday to receive your order, simply check the box next to “ _I can receive shipment at any time”_ and we’ll ship your order as soon as possible.
If you have a period of time when you are not available to receive your order, click the button _“Add Date Range”_ to specify which days you are unavailable. You can add multiple date ranges as needed.
![Screen_Shot_2021-06-15_at_3.28.49_PM.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/4402308766107)
When you are adding a date range for your Blackout Dates, a calendar will appear where you can select the first date of the Blackout and highlight the duration of your outage.
####  Attention
Please note that you do **not** need to specify weekends or national holidays for Blackout dates, as shipments will only arrive on regular business days.
![Screen_Shot_2021-06-15_at_4.25.24_PM.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/4402316523547)
You may select up to five Blackout date spans, as necessary. We will not ship out any materials to you during your selected blackout dates. You can also remove any blackout dates you don’t need by selecting the red trash can icon on the right.
![Screen_Shot_2021-06-15_at_4.44.40_PM.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/4402308791067)
Note
If you do not select an option for either partial or full shipment on your order, and no blackout dates are provided, your order will default to partial shipping starting in mid-August.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Order Studies Weekly for Homeschool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260804730270-How-to-Order-Studies-Weekly-for-Homeschool)
  * [How to Order from the Studies Weekly Online Store](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019253213-How-to-Order-from-the-Studies-Weekly-Online-Store)
  * [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-How-to-Select-Shipping-Preferences)

title: How To Navigate the School Admin Role
meta_description: As a School Administrator using Studies Weekly Online, you have access to view all of the teachers, students, and classrooms connected to...

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991516063003-School-Administrators)


#  How To Navigate the School Admin Role 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
As a School Administrator using Studies Weekly Online, you have access to view all of the teachers, students, and classrooms connected to your school. School Admins also have the ability to log in as any teacher or student. This article will cover how to navigate your role. Additional information can be found in the [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online) article.
School Overview Usage Report
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31532857067803)
  1. This feature shows the total number of Students, Teachers, and Classrooms connected to your school, which makes it easier for you to keep track of the total number of users. Each tab can be clicked to see the full list of names. 
  2. The **Search** feature gives you quick access to type in the name of a student, teacher, or classroom you want to find. 
  3. If your school is **_manually_** enrolling students in Studies Weekly Online the **ID** column for Students, Teachers, and Classrooms will say Not Rostered.
  4. If you wish to see more rows per page, use the dropdown menu to add more rows. You can also click the arrows to advance to the next page or visit a previous page.


When you click a Student’s name, a popup window will show the **Student Details** including the **Log In As** feature. This allows you to log into the student’s account. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31493034603675)
When you click a Teacher’s name, a popup window will show the **Teacher Details** including the **Log In As** feature. This allows you to log into the teacher’s account. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33332182152347)
When you click on a classroom, a popup window will show the **Classroom Details**. Here, you will also notice an option to click the **Log In As** feature to impersonate the teacher or students.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31493018142491)
The Usage Report lists all of the classes in your building with access to Studies Weekly Online. The report includes the total number of teachers and students enrolled and how many teachers and students have logged in over the course of the year. (To view the teachers and students who have logged in, select the blue link in each column.)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31532889188891)
The Usage Report will show: 
  * **Teachers Enrolled** : Total number of teachers with classes assigned in Studies Weekly Online. 
  * **# of Unique Teacher Logins this Month** : Count of individual teachers who have logged in. 
  * **Total Teacher Logins this Month** : Total teacher logins over the course of the month.
  * **# of Unique Teacher Logins this School Year** : Count of individual teachers who have logged in. 
  * **Total Teacher Logins this School Year** : Total teacher logins over the course of the school year. 
  * **Students Enrolled:** Total number of students assigned to a class in Studies Weekly Online. 
  * **# of Unique Student Logins this Month** : Count of individual students who have logged in.
  * **Total Student Logins this Month** : Total student logins over the course of the school year. 
  * **# of Unique Student Logins this School Year** : Count of individual students who have logged in.
  * **Total Student Logins this School Year** : Total student logins over the course of the school year. 


Note
User level roles are easy to identify by the color of the navigational sidebar. A District Admin’s sidebar is dark gray, while a School Admin’s sidebar is green. A Teacher’s sidebar is blue, a Student’s sidebar is purple, and the Family role is teal. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26948531736219)
If you are a District Administrator, visit the [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003) article. 
For information on navigating the student dashboard visit the article[How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531).
### Articles in this section
  * [How To Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role)
  * [School Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36083842437147-School-Admin-Standards-Report)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-How-to-Select-Shipping-Preferences)
  * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws)
  * [How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406842650267-How-to-Create-Words-to-Know-Vocabulary-Notebooks)
  * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors)
  * [How to Use the Progress Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9570272877211-How-to-Use-the-Progress-Report)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24192808156571-Additional-Features)


#  Professional Development Publication for Teachers 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**_(Currently available to support unpacking the TEKS in Texas Science publications.)_**
Professional Development content will only be available on your dashboard if a Studies Weekly district or school admin has assigned it to you. It contains an on-demand Professional Development Publication for educators and is not visible to students.
If you have been assigned to a Professional Development Classroom by an administrator, you will see the Professional Development tab under Classes.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27068820535579)
From there, select the available publication from the **Classroom Card.**
Using the navigation arrows in the Table of Contents, you can open the first Week and Article of the Professional Development content, or pick up where you left off.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27069006280219)
The Professional Development publication looks and functions like a student publication. Users who are enrolled in this publication will read the articles and answer the comprehension questions as a student. They will not be able to clear their responses since participation is required from their admin. District and/or school admins will have access to view teachers’ completion in the Gradebook. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31530757519515)
If you are new to Studies Weekly Online, visit the [How to Navigate the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents) article.
### Articles in this section

title: How to Roster with the Studies Weekly CSV Method
meta_description: Along with rostering through third-party applications such as Clever and ClassLink, Studies Weekly also provides a first-party CSV...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Studies Weekly CSV](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690791956891-Studies-Weekly-CSV)


#  How to Roster with the Studies Weekly CSV Method 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Along with rostering through third-party applications such as Clever and ClassLink, Studies Weekly also provides a first-party CSV rostering method. This option is useful for districts that utilize Google-sourced emails for their teachers and students and automate their file uploads using SFTP. The Studies Weekly CSV rostering method is also compatible with users who are not able to automate their file uploads and are not using Google-sourced emails. These users will need to log into the **[Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/online.studiesweekly.com)** site directly.
If your district is interested in rostering with Studies Weekly CSV, we have created a helpful presentation to walk you through the process of where to download the CSV template files and how to properly format and upload them. Click to begin setting up your CSV roster.
**Studies Weekly Required CSVs**
**[schools.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/schools.csv)**
This file is used to provide us with each school in your district that will be using Studies Weekly. Each school using Studies Weekly must be listed in this file in order for accounts to be created and for your users to see the publications your district has purchased.
**[teachers.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teachers.csv)**
This file is used to create user accounts for anyone you’d like to have the teacher role on their account. We will use the teacher's email address as their username, and they will be able to use the reset password link to set up their account for the first time. If you’d prefer, we have the ability to send each new user an email with their login information. 
**[students.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Spreadsheets/students.csv)**
This file is used to create user accounts for anyone that needs the student role on their account. How you set their username and password will be dependent on which method you would like your students to log in with. 
For Google SSO, this file will contain four columns: student name, student email, student ID and username. The Google-hosted email address must be assigned in the username column.
For custom usernames and passwords, this file will contain five columns: student name, student email, student ID, username, and password*.
*_Each password_** _must_** _be at least 5 characters and include a number. If no password is provided, please include the header in the file, and we will auto-generate one for you._
**[classes.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/classes.csv)**
This file is used to create all of the classrooms at any and all schools within your district. This is also where you will assign the main teacher to their classroom. Additional teachers can be assigned to a class in the teacher_class.csv file. In order for your teachers to have a classroom online, a classroom needs to be declared in this file.
**[student_class.csv](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/student_class.csv)**
This file is used to assign students to classrooms. If you find that one of your teachers is missing a student, you can check this file to ensure they are assigned to their teacher accordingly. 
**[teacher_class.csv (optional)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/resources/teacher_class.csv)**
This file is used to assign a co-teacher or a second teacher to a classroom. The teachers added to this file will have the same abilities as the main teacher. The only ability the main teacher will have that the secondary teacher will not is deleting a classroom. The main teacher will be assigned in the classes.csv file.
Need Assistance?
If you have any questions or concerns about using this rostering method, please reach out to 
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering Using Studies Weekly CSV FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs)
  * [How to Roster with the Studies Weekly CSV Method](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Pro and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting)

The teachers added to this file will have the same abilities as the main teacher. The only ability the main teacher will have that the secondary teacher will not is deleting a classroom. If you have any questions or concerns about using this rostering method, please reach out to Articles in this section * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting) Recently viewed articles * [Professional Development Publication for Teachers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24657758955419-Professional-Development-Publication-for-Teachers) * [How To Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role) * [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-How-to-Select-Shipping-Preferences) * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws) * [How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406842650267-How-to-Create-Words-to-Know-Vocabulary-Notebooks)

#  How does Studies Weekly Handle Closed Captioning? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly strives to ensure all our videos have quality closed captioning. We prioritize accuracy for our teachers and students by manually generating all captions. This takes time, but ensures quality. 
Captions can be enabled by selecting the **three dots** in the bottom right corner of videos. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34787761435547)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34787774929179)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)


#  How to Log In to Your Online Account 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
All users with a Studies Weekly Online account can log in with a username and password at [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/). Additionally, Students have the ability to log in with a QR Code.
If you are new to Studies Weekly Online and do not have an account yet, visit the [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Getting-Started) section of the Help Center.
**Username and Password QR Code Google/Clever/Classlink**
  1. Enter your **Username**
  2. Enter your **Password**
  3. Click **Log In**


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035710033051)
Students have the ability to log in with a QR Code or a username and password.
For instructions on printing QR Codes visit the [How to Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords) article in the Help Center. 
  1. Click the **Scan Here** button on the login screen.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035710037147)
  2. In the pop-up select the **Allow** button to use your camera to scan the QR Code.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26721959882267)
  3. Hold the QR Code up to the camera and it will log the student in instantly. 


If your district uses a 3rd party integration platform, click the appropriate link (Google, Clever, or ClassLink) and follow the on screen instructions.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33867404646683)
Watch this video to learn more.

title: How to Add Students to Your Classroom
meta_description: Teachers can add students to a classroom in a variety of ways. Explore the options below to find the best way for you.  Teachers using...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How to Add Students to Your Classroom 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can add students to a classroom in a variety of ways. Explore the options below to find the best way for you. 
Teachers using Google Classroom may also find this article helpful;[How to Use Google Classroom with Studies Weekly Online.](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Use-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
If the classroom was created by rostering, you will not be able to add students manually. See our articles on rostering [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering). A manually created classroom allows you to add and edit student accounts.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click **People**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38822067582875)
**Create a New Student**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30678564877723)
  1. In the Students bar, click the **Create Student** button ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179709039899).
  2. Fill out all fields and click **Create**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30676951130139)


Recommendation
Student Password criteria:
  * A lowercase letter
  * A capital (uppercase) letter
  * A number
  * Minimum of five characters


**Create Multiple Students**
  1. In the Students bar, click the **three dots![3_dots_purple.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12772724450715) **then select**Create Multiple Students**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26698258300187)
  2. Type in or copy and paste each student name on a new line.
  3. Click **Create**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30676951134619)


Note
Usernames and passwords will automatically be generated but can be changed later. For more information see the [How to Edit Students](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article.
**Add Students Using a Join Code**
Join Codes are a simple way to invite students to a classroom. Teachers can either:
  * Copy and share the Join Code from the classroom sub navigation bar.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30676951143707)
  * In the Students bar, click the **three dots![3_dots_purple.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12772724450715) **then select **Generate Student Join Codes** to print and distribute them to students.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26698228763291)


The [Register page](https://online.studiesweekly.com/register#studentTab) for students has a space to enter the Join Code. Or if students already have an account, they can log in and enter the Join Code when they click the “+” **Add Classroom** button on the Classrooms page.
**Import Students Using a CSV**
Importing multiple students using a CSV file is the fastest way to (one time) bulk add students to your classroom. Download the provided CSV file or create your own (with the required fields below).
  1. In the Students bar, click the **three dots![3_dots_purple.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12772724450715)** then select **Import Students (CSV)**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26698201011355)
  2. Download and fill in the columns in the CSV Template and save it to your laptop.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26698300923675)
  3. Drop the CSV file in the area provided or click to browse for the CSV file to upload it.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26698341291803)
  4. From the dropdown menu, select the fields you will use on the import.
  5. Confirm the student information is correct by clicking the boxes to the left of the student names.
  6. Click **Import**.


Recommendation
Student Password criteria:
  * A lowercase letter
  * A capital (uppercase) letter
  * A number
  * Minimum of five characters


**Import an Existing Student**
Teachers can import existing students assigned to them from another one of their Studies Weekly Online classrooms.
  1. In the Students bar, click the **three dots** ![Screen_Shot_2022-08-23_at_18.12.51.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179709070747) then select **Import Student**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699516834203)
  2. Teachers will see the students who have previously used Studies Weekly Online with you as the teacher. Select a student, then click **Import**.


![Screen_Shot_2022-08-23_at_18.09.52.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179718037531)
**Transfer a Student from another Teacher in Your Building/District**
Teachers can transfer a single student into their classroom using the student's current username and password.
  1. In the Students bar, click the **three dots** ![3_dots_purple.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179709145755) then select **Transfer Student**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699561896603)
  2. In the pop-up window, enter the student’s current username and password.
  3. Click **Transfer**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699700417307)


The username and password must match for the transfer to work. Repeat for each student you want to transfer into your classroom.
Note
The student will still appear in the previous teacher’s classroom until that teacher has removed the student from their class.
See the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article to learn how to view and edit student usernames and passwords.
**Move a Student Out of the Current Classroom and into Another**
Teachers can move students between classrooms they have created or to classrooms they share with a co-teacher.
  1. In the Students section click the **three dots** ![3_dots_purple.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179709220123) then select**Move Students**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699704298523)
  2. In the pop-up window, click the down arrow to select the classroom where you wish to move the students. Then click the boxes next to student names to select the students you wish to move. Click **Move **to move these students to the selected classroom**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699786555291)**
  3. After clicking **Move** , you will be prompted to remove the students from the original classroom. If you click **Yes** , students will be moved successfully to their new classroom. If you click NO students will remain in the original classroom.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26699900991899)![Screenshot_2023-02-14_at_11.24.37_AM.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25179718229915)
Note
Teachers may need to refresh their screen to see the updated roster.

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [How to Play Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690681345947-How-to-Play-Games)


#  How to Play Study Buddies 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Study Buddies game is located in the user profile menu in the upper right corner of a student’s screen. To access it, click the **Profile Menu** next to the notification bell and select **Study Buddies**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26947525928987)
First, students will click **Choose a Buddy** to select one.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24533160412443)
The Study Buddies students can choose from are Rev the rat, Zora the bird, Ham the hedgehog, Ned the turtle, and Claw the dinosaur. The student can select a different Study Buddy any time.
![SBnew3.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12439194952219)
Students can use the coins they earn in Studies Weekly Online to decorate their Study Buddy’s home. They can also click on the green pipes to enter and decorate different rooms.
To purchase items for the Study Buddy’s home, click a category. The total number of coins available to spend will display on screen. Click the item you want to purchase. The item will disappear from the BUY STUFF tab and move to the MY STUFF tab. To exit, click **Cancel** or **X** and your purchases will be saved in your MY STUFF tab.
![study_buddies_GIF_buy_items.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12439237319579)
Note
Purchased items are stationary and cannot be moved around their buddy’s home.
Students may choose to display or stash items that have been purchased. 
![stash_items.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12439281968027)
To exit Study Buddies, click the **Return to Reading** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18251367637403)
To learn more, check out the [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-Coins) and [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115) articles.
### Articles in this section

  * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled)
  * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword)
  * [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers)
  * [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies)

title: How to Navigate the Customized Content Page
meta_description: Teachers can manage their content, like custom quizzes, on the Customized Content page. This article will cover the options for all...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  How to Navigate the Customized Content Page 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can manage their content, like custom quizzes, on the Customized Content page. This article will cover the options for all Customized Content and actions available for each option. 
Making edits to an existing Studies Weekly Online assessment creates a new copy that appears on the Customized Content page. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click the **Customized Content button**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821883803803)
Note
Customized Content is only accessible to students in their **To Do** tab. 
### Options for All Customized Content
The options at the top of the page allow you to find, sort, and add Customized Content and select from **To Do** or **Archived**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530162464283)
  * **Find Customized Content** : Search for a Customized Content you’ve already created.
  * **Sort By:** Sort customized content by Created Date, Due Date, or Title, Created by Admin, or To Do Order.
  * **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530162466715)Create Customized Content:** See the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787) article
  * **![three_dots.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12439988779291)Actions** : Import tests from Legacy Studies Weekly Online or refresh Customized Content.


### Actions for Individual Customized Content
In the **To Do** section of the Customized Content page, teachers will see all customized content assignments with a future due date. 
The **Archived** section will show all the customized content assignments with an expired due date. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530144525339)
To the left of the title of each Customized Content, teachers will see the **Move** icon ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/17682569770523). This allows teachers to reorder their view of content with a drag and drop. This will also reorder content in the students **To Do** tab. 
On the right, use the **Visibility Toggles** to hide or make content visible.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530162471579)
Important Note
To change the order of your Customized Content, you must use the dropdown box and navigate to **To Do Order.** You may also need to clear your cookies and cache if you do not see the **Move** icon. 
To the right of each piece of Customized Content, select the **three dots** ![Screen_Shot_2022-09-02_at_13.07.35.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/8546507411355) to see the actions available. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530162473627)
**Student View**
This gives you an inside look at exactly what your students will see when they open the assigned Customized Content. Click on the title you want to open, to see the Student View.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31068187708059)
**Print**
See a Print Preview and/or Print the questions in the Customized Content by selecting the **Teacher Actions** button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31068156865307)
**Grade**
Grade Customized Content submissions and leave comments for students. 
It also has the option to **Allow Retake** for each student.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37530144532635)
To learn more about grading and allowing retakes, view the [Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade) in the Help Center. 
**Statistics**
View how the class did on each Customized Content question. Teachers can select a Test Question on the left to see a graph and chart of how students answered that question.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31069290900507)
You can also select **Customized Content Overview** to see a Student Score Overview. This shows a list of students and their scores, and graphs them side by side. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30164900834459)
The drop down menu also allows you to select **Question Type Overview**. This shows a list of students and their scores, but graphs them by percentage.
**Edit**
Edit the title, instructions, dates/times, or decide if you want to **Randomize Questions**. Changes can also be made to the questions if no students have started the Customized Content.
As long as no students have started the Customized Content, the teacher can add or make edits to questions, answers, and the point value.
When the Customized Content does have responses submitted by any student:
  * Teachers can make changes to the **Title,****Instructions** , and **Start/End Date** at any time. 
  * If a teacher attempts to make edits to **Questions** , **Answers** , or **Point Value** after any student has begun the Customized Content a pop-up will appear stating **“A student has already started the**** _“Insert title of Customized Content”_****so the Customized Content can no longer be modified. Click OK to create a copy, make any changes, and then click “Create” to save****it!"**
    * If a teacher does not want to proceed with changes they will click the Cancel button (in top right corner of the pop-up).
    * If “Ok” button is clicked, the teacher is taken to a **copy** of the original Customized Content so the user can make any changes and then click “Create.”


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31069290904091)
**Remove**
Permanently delete that piece of Customized Content.
To learn more, visit the [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). 
### Articles in this section

  * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content)
  * [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content)

  * [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content)
  * [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [Company FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/38719571510555-Company-FAQs)


#  How does Studies Weekly handle American Indian vs. Native American Terminology? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
There is much debate and strong feelings in our nation about how to identify various groups. At Studies Weekly, we work to create and nurture an inclusive environment. To ensure that we write about indigenous people using language that is not offensive, we consulted several sources. First,  states that the term 'American Indian' is more appropriate. It claims that the expression, 'Native American,' has fallen out of popularity. In the Native Times and Native Sun News, tribal journalists state that the term 'Native American' was thrust upon them by a white activist and does not reflect their desires. Whenever possible, they like to be identified by the tribe. For generalized references, they prefer to be called 'American Indian.'
Part of our rationale is also to be in alignment with the federal government of the United States of America. To be officially recognized by the federal government, the tribe has to have a political relationship with the U.S. government. When a tribe has that legal status, then it is known as an American Indian tribe with the power to self-govern as a separate nation. If the tribe is not federally recognized, then it is known as Native American. In summation, all American tribal members can be called Native Americans, but it is a higher and more prestigious status to be called an American Indian.

  * [How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity)
  * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws)

title: Rostering and Integration FAQs
meta_description: While each rostering method comes with its own advantages and disadvantages, there are general rules that apply to each rostering method...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Getting Started with Rostering ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18713449851291-Getting-Started-with-Rostering)


#  Rostering and Integration FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
While each rostering method comes with its own advantages and disadvantages, there are general rules that apply to each rostering method within Studies Weekly Online. These questions and answers will hopefully address concerns you may currently have when considering rostering with Studies Weekly.
What is Rostering?
Rostering with Studies Weekly allows districts to create and manage user accounts for teachers and students district wide through a variety of automated processes. Studies Weekly is also able to integrate roster data through third-party applications, such as ClassLink or Clever to allow Single Sign On with these applications. 
User data that is sent through the roster will be given a Studies Weekly Online account and be assigned either a district admin, teacher, or student role. 
If a family email is being shared with a student account in the district SIS, that email will also be linked to the student's Studies Weekly Online account. 
Why would I choose to roster my teachers and students?
As a District Admin that manages the roster data for your district, you will have the ability to manage the user accounts for all users at your district that utilize the Studies Weekly materials you’ve purchased. If you have a lot of users at your school, you can help them get a head start on the school year by setting up their online accounts for them. You can easily transfer classrooms from one teacher to another, remove unused student or teacher accounts, and see high-level usage reports for your district (broken down by school).
Do I have to roster my users?
No, if you would rather allow your teachers to manage their own classrooms and students, you can direct them to the registration page where they can create their own accounts. The teachers will have the option to create their student accounts in bulk using a variety of methods explained in this article:[How to Add Students to Your Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611)
The teacher registration page can be found here: [Teacher Registration Page](https://online.studiesweekly.com/register#TeacherTab)
What options do you have for automated rostering?
We offer integrations with third-party applications such as ClassLink or Clever, Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) with CSV formatted files, or a direct connection with your Student Information System (SIS) through OneRoster API. 
How often are you able to sync data?
Studies Weekly will sync data each night to ensure we have the latest information. Studies Weekly is also able to sync upon request as well. Users with district administrator accounts can request a sync by following the instructions in this article:[Manual Sync of District Roster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003)
Do you offer Single Sign-On (SSO)?
Yes, we offer Single Sign-On through OAuth 2.0 Handshake, Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) by IMS Global, or Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML).
Could we use Studies Weekly with a Learning Management System?
Yes, once we have set up a roster connection and we have users in the database, those who have an account will be able to login using an LMS. An LMS such as Google Classroom, Canvas, or Schoology gives teachers the opportunity to post lessons, assign homework, administer assessments, and communicate with students.
What LMSs do you integrate with?
Studies Weekly Online can integrate with any LMS that is compatible with LTI 1.0/1.1/1.2/1.3 Advantage.
This is the current list of LMS platforms that we have successfully integrated with: 
  * Canvas
  * Schoology
  * It's Learning
  * Blackboard Learn
  * Agilix Buzz
  * Thrivist Curve
  * Lesson Planet
  * Safari Montage
  * Infinite Campus Learning Suite


What can and cannot be manually edited within a rostered school?
Rostered users **can** do the following:
  * Add and remove publications from the classrooms created through rostering
    * If a publication is manually added, it will remain in the classroom during the sync
    * If a publication is manually removed, it will stay hidden during the sync
  * Create new classrooms not managed by the rostering sync


Rostered users **cannot** do the following inside classrooms created by rostering integrations:
  * Archive Classrooms
  * Add Co-Teachers
  * Add Students
  * Use the Join Code to Invite Students
  * Edit Student Name, Username, or Password
  * Transfer Students
  * Import Google Classroom Students
  * Create Multiple Students
  * Import Student
  * Generate Student Join Codes


Note
This means that they won’t see the three dots / action menu ![Three_dots.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/10278279957275) to perform these actions (e.g., on the Classroom tile).
What will happen to our existing accounts?
**If you are not using an automated rostering integration with Studies Weekly,** then account continuity is based on the email of the existing account. If the roster user's email matches the existing email, then the roster-provided account will be merged into the existing account. If no email match is found, an entirely new account will be created in Studies Weekly Online. Any existing accounts not matching an email from the roster data will not be affected.
Any classrooms in already existing accounts will remain active until they are archived manually. Entirely new classrooms will be created from the roster data that will not have any progress from students. 
Will account progress and reports merge to the new accounts?
New rostered accounts will merge with existing accounts if the email of the rostered account matches the existing account. Otherwise, a new account will be created that will have no access to existing data.
How long will it take for accounts to be created?
We have a pretty quick turnaround time. Once you share your roster data with us we can get the accounts created within 24 hours.
How do family accounts get created and how will they login?
Teachers can manually add a family email to a student account under the Edit Student section of the People page by following the instructions in this article:
[How To Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339)
This allows a parent or guardian view-only access to the student's account. 
Can our school roster or can rostering only be done at the district level?
If your school is independent from the district (your Student Information System(SIS) is independent from the district or the district does not include your school or any of it's users in rostering), then Studies Weekly can set up your school to roster. If not, then rostering must be done at the district level.
Can we roster after the school year has started?
Yes, you may still set up an automated rostering integration even if the schools in your district are already in session. However, since existing account data does not necessarily merge to new rostered accounts, your teachers and students may lose progress in their online publications if they have already been utilizing the materials through manually created accounts. Depending on how far you are into the school year, it will be up to you as the district to decide if you would like to roster now or wait until the next school year begins.
Can I use Google Classroom if my account is rostered?
If the email associated with your rostered account is the same as the user's Google Classroom email, then you will be able to use Google Classroom with Studies Weekly Online.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs)
  * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)
  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)

  * [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page)

#  Sign Up for the Studies Weekly Newsletter and Free Events 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Would you like to learn new ways to use Studies Weekly? 
Take your class to the next level by:
  * Signing up for our[ Newsletter](https://www.studiesweekly.com/newsletter/)
  * Attend [free training webinars](https://www.studiesweekly.com/events/)
  * Customizing your training with [PD experts](https://www.studiesweekly.com/professional-development/)


You will receive new lesson plans, videos, supplemental activities, and other resources via email when participating.
[![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24537856428315)](https://www.studiesweekly.com/newsletter/)
There is also a [Studies Weekly Blog](https://www.studiesweekly.com/blog/) and [Tutorials page ](https://www.studiesweekly.com/category/tutorials/)for teaching tips, education trends, and additional inspiration.

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002825633-Ordering)
  3. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006715213-Ordering)


#  How to Order from the Studies Weekly Online Store 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
If you are a district educator ordering for only 1-2 classes, place your order in our Online Store by following the steps below.
Important
  * If you are a homeschooling parent, see the [How to Order Studies Weekly for Homeschool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260804730270-Ordering-Studies-Weekly-for-Homeschool-Charters) article.
  * Homeschool Charters, ordering more than 10 publications can follow the ordering steps below. 


  1. Navigate to [store.studiesweekly.com](https://store.studiesweekly.com/). 
  2. Choose your state from the drop-down menu in the top right corner of the screen.
  3. Choose **Social Studies** , **Science** , **Health and Wellness** or **Other** at the top of the screen.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35026423191451)


## **On the order page:**
  1. Select your grade level.
  2. Choose how many years you want the subscription to last under the Multi-Year Options.
  3. For the format, choose **Print & Online** (default) or choose **Online Only**.
  4. If the publication is also offered in Spanish, then there will be a Language field in which you need to choose English or Spanish.
  5. Enter the number of students and teachers. For example, if you choose 100 students and 5 teachers, we will ship 5 boxes of 20 student copies (one box for each teacher).
  6. Click **Add to Cart**.
![Order_Page.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770081794075)
  7. Repeat these steps for any additional grade levels or subjects.
  8. Click the shopping cart icon in the top right corner.
  9. Review your order, then click the **Checkout** button.![Checkout_Page.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770119993499)


## **Checkout Steps:**
When you click **Checkout** , you will see the option to Log In (if you have an account already) or to Create Account.
**![Login_to_Checkout.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9770106940315)**
Once you have logged into your account, fill out the fields in the Checkout form. 
  1. Enter the shipping recipient's **First Name** and **Last Name**.
  2. Enter the **Email Address** you would like to use for shipping notifications. 
     *        * The email entered will be used as the Studies Weekly Online account login.
  3. Select the **Shipping Address Type**.
  4. Enter your school **Zip Code** , then select your school from the drop-down menu -**OR-** select **Homeschool/Custom** and enter your home address.
  5. Select the **School Year** and optionally add the **School Start Date**.
  6. Choose your shipping options. See [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-Selecting-Shipping-Preferences) to learn more.
     *        * Select **Ship all materials together** if you want all materials to come at the same time when they are all ready.
       * Select **Ship each product when in stock** if you are okay with materials coming separately, if they are ready at different times.
       * Select **I can receive shipment at any time** OR select date ranges for when you are NOT available to receive shipment.
  7. Enter a Discount code, if you have one.
  8. Select**Card** or**Purchase Order** and enter requested information.
     *        * If you are using a PO, please enter the PO number and select your organization from the list. If your organization is not listed among the options, please contact us at or 866-311-8734
  9. If the billing and shipping information are different, uncheck the box next to **Billing Address** and enter the address. 
     *        * If your organization is not listed among the options for billing and shipping or if an edit of the information is needed, please contact **support@studiesweekly.com** or **866-311-8734**.
  10. Review the information and select the box stating you have read the **Terms & Conditions**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29866368570267)
  11. Then click **Continue to Payment** or **Place Order**.


Important
To avoid duplication of your order, please do not send a copy of the PO to Studies Weekly.
### Articles in this section

  * [How to Select Shipping Preferences](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402316527259-How-to-Select-Shipping-Preferences)

#  Scope and Sequence and Standards Correlation 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Scope and Sequence and the Standards Correlation may be found in the Teacher Resources at the Publication Level.
Note
**The Standards Correlation and Scope and Sequence are available when the user's state matches the state indicated in the publication**. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, open a publication and navigate to the Teacher Resources.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37647948530331)
That opens the**Teacher Resources** tab within the content for the week. The Scope and Sequence and Standards Correlation will be found under the Publication Resources section.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37647948534811)
The selected document will open in a new browser tab. Users can download a copy to their device or print the PDF. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31807985478939)
To learn about additional Teacher Resources visit the [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools) section.

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  Viewing Student Progress in Inactive Classrooms 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers have the ability to view historical student progress data in deactivated classrooms. This includes data from Customized Content, grading, and Reports. If the classroom was created manually, teachers can follow the steps in the Help Center article [How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms) to be able to recover the classroom and make changes.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, navigate to the **Classrooms** tab and select **Inactive** :
  1. From the desired Classroom Card, select the data you wish to review. 


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35823483242267)
Inside of any selected reports, the gold bar at the top of the page reminds the teacher they are in read-only mode. Teachers can use all the usual navigation features including printing student progress.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35835042126619)
Additionally, teachers can open any publication assigned to the archived class and view the data. 
When you are finished viewing data and want to return to your active classrooms list, select the**Classrooms** tab at the top of the page.
For data from Classrooms prior to the 2024-25 school year, please submit your request to support@studiesweekly.com.

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24745242502683-Additional-Features)


#  How To Use the Highlighting Tool 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students can highlight text and media (images, videos, audio) and add notes in their publications. If a student highlights a word or phrase that is listed as a weekly vocabulary word, they will be able to read and listen to the definition. Highlights can be made in Articles, text and media sections, Activities, Customized Content, and Explore More.
To add highlights and notes, students will choose the article they would like to read.
iPad Users:
If using an iPad, you can highlight text by placing your finger on the first word you want to highlight. Hold it until the word turns blue, then drag your finger across the remaining words you want to highlight. Once you release your finger the blue selection bubbles appear. Do not lift your finger until all the text you want to highlight has been selected. The following steps in the process are the same as they would be on a computer.
To view vocabulary definitions, add highlights, or add notes, students will choose the article they would like to read.
  * **View Vocabulary Definitions** : Click and drag the cursor over the vocabulary word and select the **Vocabulary** tab. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34684893552667)
When users highlight a vocabulary term that is associated with an image, the image will appear next to the definition in the **Vocabulary** tab of the highlight box. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34829979595419)
  * **Highlight Text and Add a Note** : Click and drag the cursor over the section of text to be highlighted. Place the cursor in the **Notes** box and add your text. Select **Save** when finished. ![2025-03-06_12-29-22.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34684893562139)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34684893564827)
    * For Activities only, highlights must be saved **_before_** clicking Submit at the end of the activity.


  * **Add Image Note** : Click any article image to enlarge it. Select the **Highlight** button to write a note.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31269869368219)


  * **Add Video Note** : Select a video from the publication or inside Explore More. Then find the highlighter button. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31269869370267)


#### **From there, students can:**
  1. Click the **Play** button to hear the audio for the highlighted selection.
  2. Click anywhere inside the **Notes** box to enter text.
  3. Click any of the colored circles to choose a highlighting color. The selected color will appear with a checkmark.
  4. Click the **X** to close the dialog box and not save your work.
  5. Weekly vocabulary words and phrases are found within the articles. Students can read and listen to the definition of a vocabulary word or phrase, after it is highlighted. The definition also appears in the bottom of the dialog box. Vocabulary definitions can be disabled by teachers under the [Edit Students](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) tab from the People page.
  6. Click **SAVE** to record your notes and highlights. 
  7. To remove an existing highlight and note, click anywhere on the highlight. In the dialog box, click the **Trash Can**.


### Articles in this section
  * [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool)
  * [How To Use the Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool)
  * [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [Viewing Student Progress in Inactive Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22608582033819-Viewing-Student-Progress-in-Inactive-Classrooms)
  * [Scope and Sequence and Standards Correlation](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/31727978021531-Scope-and-Sequence-and-Standards-Correlation)
  * [How to Order from the Studies Weekly Online Store](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019253213-How-to-Order-from-the-Studies-Weekly-Online-Store)
  * [Sign Up for the Studies Weekly Newsletter and Free Events](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24537856436123-Sign-Up-for-the-Studies-Weekly-Newsletter-and-Free-Events)
  * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs)
