[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Getting Started with Rostering ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18713449851291-Getting-Started-with-Rostering)


#  How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can connect their Studies Weekly Online account to their Google Classroom. The two options include:
  * Making the connection to **existing** Studies Weekly Online student users, ensuring **student usernames match** their Google Classroom email addresses. 
  * Import new students from Google Classroom into Studies Weekly Online.


Teachers and students will need to accept Google permissions to allow Studies Weekly Online access to Google Classroom. 
**Edit Student Usernames in Studies Weekly Online**
Teachers can manually change usernames for existing students to their Google Classroom email addresses.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click the**People** tab.
  2. Edit each student’s username to match their Google Classroom email address.
     * **One at a time:** Click on the three dots / action menu ![Screen_Shot_2022-10-06_at_13.57.42.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9394484502427) to the right of the student and select Edit.
     * **In bulk:** See the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27260219022491)
**Import Students from Google Classroom into Studies Weekly Online**
Teachers can import their students from Google Classroom into Studies Weekly Online. The option to import Google Classroom students is **not** available for rostered schools and districts. (Clever, Classlink, etc.)
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click the **People** tab.
  2. Select the three dots menu ![Screen_Shot_2022-10-06_at_13.57.42.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9394484502427) on the top right of the Students bar.
  3. Click **Import****Google Classroom Students**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27260484012315)
A pop-up window will open where you will:
  1. Log in to your Google Classroom account.
  2. Select the the Google Classroom course that has the students you want to import. 
  3. Click **Add Students to Class**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35733656341787)
A pop-up window will show that the import was successful. The student(s) will show up in your Studies Weekly Online classroom in the People tab.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35733480940443)
At the beginning of each school year, users will need to update or import their students. 
The [How to Assign Content in Google Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9395161382555-How-to-Assign-Content-In-Google-Classroom) article will walk you through three ways to assign content to your students from Studies Weekly Online to Google Classroom.
Important
If you receive the below error, your school’s Google Workspace administrator has restricted access to certain applications including Studies Weekly Online.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35775930776859)
To continue, please contact your school’s administrator and ask them to allow access to our app with the steps in the [Google Class Access Restricted by Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35774800816155-Google-Class-Access-Restricted-by-Administrator) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering and Integration FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13088296579611-Rostering-and-Integration-FAQs)
  * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)
  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002738242715-Technology)
  3. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5661909188635-Technology)


#  How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article is for any user viewing Studies Weekly on a small browser window or a small device such as a tablet, iPad, Chromebook, or smartphone. Key differences include the appearance of menu and navigation buttons, the Table of Contents view, and the Teacher Resources.
**Menu and Navigation Buttons**
If you are viewing Studies Weekly Online on a smaller screen, you may need to rotate the device for optimal viewing. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882012315)
  1. The hamburger **Menu** ![Screenshot_2022-11-22_at_08.56.34.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/10585186383003)in the top right corner contains navigation options chosen for you by the Administrator. These can include **Classrooms** , **Training and Resources** , and **Professional Development**.
  2. **Accessibility** (if enabled), **Search, Notifications,** and the **Account Profile** buttons will appear in the top right corner just as on a larger device.


**Table of Contents**
After a classroom is selected, there is a similar hamburger **Menu** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765865223323) option in the top left corner. This contains the navigation options for that classroom 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882022427)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882024219)
Use the **Quick Navigation** dropdown to change between weeks within the publication. 
To select a new publication, click the **blue dropdown** at the top of the page next to the name of the current publication. To change articles in a week, click the dropdown next to the name of the current article.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882027803)
Students can access and change weeks and articles in a week from the same location.
**Teacher Resources**
For teachers viewing the Teacher Resources on a smaller screen, you will need to scroll down to see the content below the navigation tabs.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765865233691)
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen)

  * [Hardware FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317432328091-Hardware-FAQs)
  * [Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Which-websites-does-my-IT-department-need-to-whitelist)

[Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002738242715-Technology) 3. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5661909188635-Technology) How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen? FollowNot yet followed by anyone This article is for any user viewing Studies Weekly on a small browser window or a small device such as a tablet, iPad, Chromebook, or smartphone. Key differences include the appearance of menu and navigation buttons, the Table of Contents view, and the Teacher Resources. **Menu and Navigation Buttons** If you are viewing Studies Weekly Online on a smaller screen, you may need to rotate the device for optimal viewing. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882012315) 1. The hamburger **Menu** ![Screenshot_2022-11-22_at_08.56.34.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/10585186383003)in the top right corner contains navigation options chosen for you by the Administrator. These can include **Classrooms** , **Training and Resources** , and **Professional Development**. 2. **Accessibility** (if enabled), **Search, Notifications,** and the **Account Profile** buttons will appear in the top right corner just as on a larger device. **Table of Contents** After a classroom is selected, there is a similar hamburger **Menu** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765865223323) option in the top left corner. This contains the navigation options for that classroom ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882022427) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882024219) Use the **Quick Navigation** dropdown to change between weeks within the publication. To select a new publication, click the **blue dropdown** at the top of the page next to the name of the current publication. To change articles in a week, click the dropdown next to the name of the current article. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765882027803) Students can access and change weeks and articles in a week from the same location. **Teacher Resources** For teachers viewing the Teacher Resources on a smaller screen, you will need to scroll down to see the content below the navigation tabs. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32765865233691) Articles in this section * title: How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Publications page is where teachers can view, add, or remove publications from the selected classroom. Each classroom may have different publications assigned.
Open the two tabs below to learn how to access and navigate the Publications page.
Access the Publications Page Navigate the Publications Page
Teachers can access publications from their classrooms. Each classroom may have different publications assigned.
From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click **View All Publications**. This will show you all the publications assigned to the chosen classroom. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35820812258715)
Alternately, you can click directly on a publication image from the **Classroom Card** to open a publication.
To view assigned publications in your other classes, go back to the **Classrooms** tab. 
To add additional publications see the [How to Add Publications to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom) article.
The **Publications** page for each classroom may look different depending on how many publications are assigned. Overall, each classroom will see the same options. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35820812271259)
**A**. **Find** : Allows teachers to search for a publication already assigned to the classroom.
**B**. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34791639330203)Refresh** : Allows teachers to refresh the Publications page when a change is made.
**C**. **Add Publication Access** : Shows a list of all publications available to be added to the current classroom.
**D**. **Move** : Click and hold the button, then drag to rearrange publications. 
**E**. **Expiration Banner** : A publication expiration alert will appear 30 days before it is set to expire. Teacher will also receive an alert in the Notification Center in the top right corner of the screen.
**F**. **Badges:** Can be seen attached to publications to identify specific information. These may include:
  *     * New Product - Red ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701518637979)
    * Updated - Blue ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701535832603)
    * Sneak Peek - Green ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27702059639451)
    * Discontinued - Black w/White text ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701574745627)
    * Español - Orange ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701460026395) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701875668251)
    * Online Only - Turquoise ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701477256603) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27701955371803)


**G**. **View** : Quick access to open the **Table of Contents** , **Grade** , **Reports** , or **Teacher Notes** for a publication.
**H**. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35260767990171)Individual Publication Actions** : Allows teachers to remove publication access from the classroom.
Recommendation
Missing a publication? Contact Customer Support [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) or at 866-311-8734.
To learn about viewing and navigating content within the publications visit the [_How to Navigate the Table of_ _Contents_](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents) article.

#  Why aren’t my publications already sorted? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
We print our publications in four quarterly bundles to help save money and ultimately keep costs low for our customers. Collating the publications may seem like a pain, but trust us: it’s worth it in the end. 
Watch this video to learn more.
For a walkthrough of what to do once you receive your order, watch [this video](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/swo-3/personal_development/resources/Pd9CGvDETa5jp8QorefqkDPlpkcomLOFDggZzlfC.mp4).
### Articles in this section

  * [What if a duplicate order has been placed?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017847-What-if-a-duplicate-order-has-been-placed)
  * [What teacher materials are included?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017687-What-teacher-materials-are-included)
  * [What does the package look like?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017207-What-does-the-package-look-like)
  * [Why aren’t my publications already sorted?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035201813-Why-aren-t-my-publications-already-sorted)

#  How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Many schools use a Learning Management System (LMS) to administer online learning. An LMS provides a more secure and controlled environment than a standard web browser. 
An LMS imports the school's roster to provision accounts and sets up classrooms. It gives teachers an interface to post lessons, assign homework, administer assessments, and communicate with students. It issues students their own user credentials so they can log in. It also allows users to view learning materials from content providers, such as Studies Weekly, without requiring different login credentials.
Studies Weekly integrates with several LMSs, including Canvas and Schoology. If you'd like to know if your district’s LMS can integrate with Studies Weekly and get it set up, please reach out to our team at .
**Instructional Presentations for setting up Canvas and Schoology**
Listed below are links to instructional presentations created to assist districts with getting Canvas and Schoology set up using LTI 1.3 Advantage. LTI 1.3 Advantage makes Deep Linking and Grade Passback compatible between Studies Weekly Online and your LMS platform.
**Thin Common Cartridge by IMS Global**
A common cartridge is an electronic file that contains the learning materials for a given course. Studies Weekly can provide its publications to schools that use an LMS in the form of a**thin common cartridge**. The thin common cartridge contains links to where learning materials are hosted on Studies Weekly’s website. This allows the cartridge files to remain small. It also provides a layer of security between the LMS application and the learning materials, which are hosted on the internet. This security is implemented through the LTI standard.
**Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) by IMS Global**
Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) is a standard that allows an LMS to securely communicate with a remote service provider like Studies Weekly. As the LMS communicates with a service provider, it can validate requests for content. To set up the LTI standard, Studies Weekly will provide the school with a consumer key and shared secret value. The LTI standard requires parties to use these values to digitally sign transmissions. This standard implements OAuth 1.0.

  * [How to Navigate Rostering and Integrations](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations)
  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [End-of-Year Rostering FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14673213038363-End-of-Year-Rostering-FAQs)
  * [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)

  3. [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)


#  Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
We recommend teachers spend some time getting familiar with [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) before introducing it to students.If you haven’t logged in yet, [read this article](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account) for instructions.
This platform can be a great asset for teachers and students in class and with remote learning. Here are some tips, tricks, and how-tos to improve your experience once you’ve logged in:
**1. Create a Class**
As a teacher, you will need to create a class before you can add students and give them logins. If classes have already been created for you visit the [How to Navigate the Classes Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classes-Page) article. 
Teachers may create multiple classrooms if teaching several grades or several classes of one grade. Each can be set-up as a separate online class. 
Follow the written steps in the [How to Create a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom) article. 
**2. Add Publications**
Teachers can add publications to a classroom they have already created.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click **View All Publications**. 
  2. Click the **Add Publication Access** button in the upper right corner.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30675101848987)
  3. In the **Add Publication Access** pop-up window, select the publication(s) you want to add to the classroom. Teachers should be able to see all their purchased publications. Search or filter by Subject and Grade to narrow it down. Click the **checkbox** for the publications you want to add. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30675101853083)
  4. Click **Continue**. 


For complete instructions view the [How to Add Publications to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom) article. 
**3. Add Students**
Teachers can add students to their Studies Weekly Online classes in multiple ways. Instructions for each option can be found in the [How to Add Students to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom) article.
  * Create one student at a time
  * Create multiple students at once
  * Add students using a CSV import
  * Add Students Using a Join Code
  * Import existing students from one of your other classrooms.
  * Transfer students into your classroom from another teacher.
  * Use Google Classroom to connect your students.


**4. Make sure students can log in**
After teachers create a class, add publications, and create student logins, students are ready to learn.
  1. Send students their username and password.
  2. Send them a link to Studies Weekly Online: [https://online.studiesweekly.com/.](https://online.studiesweekly.com/)


For troubleshooting student account problems, read these articles:
  * [How to Login to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Login-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts)
  * [How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5996010056987-How-to-Generate-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * or visit the [People section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People) in the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).


**5. Use Studies Weekly Online with Google Classroom**
Teachers can assign Studies Weekly Online weeks or individual assessments, articles, or other media (e.g., images, audio, video) to students in their Google Classroom. 
To link your Google Classroom students to Studies Weekly, there are two options:
  * Ensure that existing students’ Studies Weekly usernames match their Google Classroom email addresses. 
  * Import new students from Google Classroom to Studies Weekly.


Note
The option to import Google Classroom students is **not** available for schools and districts with enterprise rostering like ClassLink or Clever. 
See the [How to Use Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Use-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly) article for more details. Then follow the directions in the [How to Assign Content in Google Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9395161382555-How-to-Assign-Content-In-Google-Classroom) article to begin assigning content.
For further instructions on using Studies Weekly Online, view the additional [Getting Started articles](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Getting-Started) or visit the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started)
  * [How District and School Administrators Can Register](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012204533-How-District-and-School-Administrators-Can-Register)
  * [How To Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account)
  * [How to Log In to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online)

Send them a link to Studies Weekly Online: [https://online.studiesweekly.com/.](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) For troubleshooting student account problems, read these articles: * [How to Login to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Login-to-Your-Online-Account) * [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) * [How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5996010056987-How-to-Generate-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords) * or visit the [People section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People) in the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). **5. Use Studies Weekly Online with Google Classroom** Teachers can assign Studies Weekly Online weeks or individual assessments, articles, or other media (e.g., images, audio, video) to students in their Google Classroom. To link your Google Classroom students to Studies Weekly, there are two options: * Ensure that existing students’ Studies Weekly usernames match their Google Classroom email addresses. * Import new students from Google Classroom to Studies Weekly. Note The option to import Google Classroom students is **not** available for schools and districts with enterprise rostering like ClassLink or Clever. See the (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Use-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly) article for more details. Then follow the directions in the [How to Assign Content in Google Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9395161382555-How-to-Assign-Content-In-Google-Classroom) article to begin assigning content. For further instructions on using Studies Weekly Online, view the additional [Getting Started articles](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Getting-Started) or visit the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). Articles in this section * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started) * [How District and School Administrators Can Register](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012204533-How-District-and-School-Administrators-Can-Register) * [How To Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account) * [How to Log In to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online) Recently viewed articles * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs) * [Why aren’t my publications already sorted?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035201813-Why-aren-t-my-publications-already-sorted) * [How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24745242502683-Additional-Features)


#  How to Use the Audio Reader 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online has an Audio Reader function, which is located at the top of each article. The Audio Reader will highlight each word as it reads with an engaging voice. Students and teachers can adjust the Audio Reader speed by clicking the **fast forward** button and dragging to a faster or slower speed from the pop-up box.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21272510147867)
Students and teachers can also adjust the speed when using the [Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool). 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21272543085339)
####  **Audio Reader for Assessments and Article questions**
Assessments and article questions also have the Audio Reader feature, which students can access by clicking the **play** button next to the question.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21272747241883)
Recommendation
**Reader Mode** is also found within articles and activities. Reader Mode is located in the blue bar with the title of the article. Clicking here will cause the article to fill the entire screen for those who might need fewer distractions or larger font.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794155842715)
Reader mode will open in full screen. To close Reader Mode, click the **X** in the upper right corner of the blue bar. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38794147319195)
Visit the FAQ [Which Question Types have the Audio Reader Function](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9340334621595-Which-question-types-have-the-Audio-Reader-function) to learn more.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Use the Drawing Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24745294523035-How-to-Use-the-Drawing-Tool)
  * [How To Use the Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool)
  * [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader)

title: How to Navigate the Student Dashboard

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5651306494619-Student-Experience)


#  How to Navigate the Student Dashboard 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
When a student logs in to Studies Weekly Online, they will see their Student Dashboard. This article gives students an overview of how to navigate it. Including changing their Avatar in the Profile Menu. 
To log in, students will: 
  1. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/).
  2. Enter their username and password.
  3. Click**Log In**.


**Classrooms**
On the **Classrooms** page, students will see the classrooms they are assigned to. The**Active** tab shows the classrooms that have work available. The **Inactive** tab shows classrooms that no longer have work available. 
Each classroom has its own card with icons to open their assigned **Publications** , **To Do**(customized content), and **Notes**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859873627291)
**Coins, Notifications, and Profile menu**
In the upper right corner, students will see their total number of coins, any notifications, and the Profile Menu. These features are accessible no matter where a student is within the the Student Dashboard. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859842671771)
Students should click the **Notification Bell** when they see a number attached to it. Here they can view and click to open any retakes their teacher has assigned, read comments from their teacher, view graded submissions, or see when their teacher has awarded them coins. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31264481328155)
To mark the notification as read, students will click each **envelope** to open it or click**MARK ALL AS READ**. Open envelopes can also be clicked to mark the notification as unread.
The **Profile Menu** is where students can access Explorers and Study Buddies to spend their coins (if enabled by the teacher), view Account Settings, and sign out.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859873632923)
Within the **Account Settings** of the Profile Menu, students can change their user Avatar by selecting the **Change Avatar **button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31264481333659)
Students can choose to leave the default Avatar (which is their initials) and select a new background color or choose from a Studies Weekly Online character. 
Once a selection has been made, click **Save** in the bottom right corner. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25797421877915)
Additional information about [Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies) and [Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers) can be found in the [Student Section of the Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student).
**Add Classroom**
If a student’s teacher provided a code to join a classroom, click the **Add Classroom** button in the top right corner. Once a student types in the code and clicks **ADD CLASSROOM** , the classroom will appear on the Classrooms page.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31264481335323)
**Accessing Publications, To Do, and Notes**
If a student is already assigned to one or more classrooms, they can click directly on a publication to begin or select the **View All** publications link. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859873634715)
In the**Publications** tab, click a publication to view its Table of Contents. The Table of Contents shows all of the sections and lessons within the publication. Teachers choose which publications are visible for students as well as which articles, activities, assessments, vocabulary review, and customized content are visible within the publications. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859873635995)
To navigate quickly in between weeks, use the Breadcrumbs directly above the publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26944572042139)
In the **To Do** tab of each classroom card, or the side navigation bar students will see the tasks a teacher has assigned to them. Available tasks are those that the student has not completed yet. Completed tasks have been completed, but not graded. Graded tasks have been completed and graded. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31264474635163)
Students should check the **To Do** tab regularly for tasks assigned by their teacher. To learn how to find retakes a teacher has assigned, view the [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes) article.
Student **Notes** will show all of the highlights and notes a student has made within assigned publications. Notes can be accessed in the class cards on the Classes page.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31264474642075)
**Accessibility**
If a teacher has enabled accessibility features for a student, the icon will be visible in the upper right corner of their screen. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35859842680603)
To learn more about the accessibility features see the [How to Use Accessibility Features in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard)
  * [How To View Weekly Progress](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6327022232219-How-To-View-Weekly-Progress)
  * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores)
  * [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes)
  * [Navigating Student Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader)
  * [Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Integrate with LMSs?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)
  * [Why aren’t my publications already sorted?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035201813-Why-aren-t-my-publications-already-sorted)
  * [How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page)


##  Can't find what you're looking for? 
####  Let us help you! 
[ Contact Support ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)
© Studies Weekly
Theme by 
###### Support hours: 6 a.m. - 6 p.m. MT.

Articles in this section * [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard) * [How To View Weekly Progress](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6327022232219-How-To-View-Weekly-Progress) * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores) * [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes) * [Navigating Student Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes) Recently viewed articles * [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs) * [Why aren’t my publications already sorted?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035201813-Why-aren-t-my-publications-already-sorted) * [How to Access and Navigate the Publications Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18262265151131-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-the-Publications-Page)

  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006690854-Teaching-Tools)


#  How to Print Studies Weekly Online Materials 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
There are many items in Studies Weekly Online that can be printed. 
The print button can be found on screen when looking at Reports, Customized Content, the Gradebook, Teacher Edition Notes, and Assessments. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30919892944667)
Additionally, in the **Teacher Actions** dropdown menu within the Table of Contents, a Print button is available and will print Article questions, Activities, Crosswords, Customized Content, Rubrics, Extended Reading articles and questions, and Assessments. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37904785606427)
Recommendation
Studies Weekly recommends enabling **Background graphics** to ensure the printout looks as intended. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20928106280219)
### Printing a PDF
Each time a PDF button is selected (in the Table of Contents, Teacher Edition, or in the Training and Resources section) it will open in a new browser tab. 
Click the **printer symbol** button in the upper right corner of the screen to print or save the PDF to your desktop. Depending on your web browser, the printer symbol button may be in a different location. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18386931777051)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25827291158811)
**Examples of PDFs found in Studies Weekly Online.**
  1. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37904785610651)
  2. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37904785613467)


**Visit the Help Center articles below to find additional print instructions:**
  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How to Find and Print Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How to Find and Print Answer Keys](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)


Important
All online and print materials are copyright protected and intended to be used solely by the purchaser and the properly licensed customers. Further use, duplication, or distribution to persons not covered by your license is a copyright infringement. This includes, but is not limited to, derivative works to be sold or given to third parties.
For more information visit the [Studies Weekly Terms of Service and Privacy](https://www.studiesweekly.com/legal/).

title: How to Navigate the Grade Section
meta_description: Teachers have a Gradebook and Quick Grade in the Grade section. The Gradebook is where teachers view student scores or coins for each...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade)


#  How to Navigate the Grade Section 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers have a Gradebook and Quick Grade in the Grade section. The Gradebook is where teachers view student scores or coins for each week for the entire class. The Quick Grade page is where a teacher can grade all submissions that require grading by a teacher. To learn about each option click the tabs below.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card,** click the **Grade** button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821612004891)
**Gradebook Quick Grade Rubric**
The Gradebook is a convenient place for teachers to see all student scores or coins earned all in one place. To access the Gradebook you must first choose a Publication and week in the Table of Contents dropdown. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615304621339)
  1. **Publication** : Dropdown to alternate between publications.
  2. **Week** : Dropdown to select a week within the chosen publication.
  3. **Filter By** : Sort by All, Activity, Article, Customized Content, Vocabulary Review, or Weekly Assessment. Teachers can also organize by Coins or Points.
  4. **Students** : The student rows will display all of the students enrolled in the selected classroom. Teachers may need to scroll down to see all the students or type a student name in the search box. Selecting a student name will open a **Weekly Review*** modal.
  5. **Each Item in the Week** : The selected week's content will display in columns. It shows the icon relating to the item type and the name of the item. Teachers may need to scroll right to see all the assigned content for the week.


Recommendation to View
*****Weekly Review****
Selecting a student name from the Gradebook list will open a **Weekly Review** modal. The modal will show the student’s responses and include the following:![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30863428015643)
**A.** Direct link to the week in the Table of Contents
**B.** Total Number of Submissions for the student and the date and time of the Submission(s)
**C.** Total Coins awarded for the week
**D.** Submission number, Coins earned for the submission, and Total Score for the Assessment, Activities, Crossword, and for Customized Content.
**E.** Print button
Use the scroll bar on the right side of the modal to view all the answered content for the week.
**In the Gradebook, Article Comprehension Questions will be numbered sequentially and have the following for each enrolled student:**
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063029915)****Not Started** : The student has not started the item.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063036059) **In Progress** : The student has begun the item but has not completed it. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063041435) **Completed** : The student completed the article questions. Article Comprehension Questions are designed as formative assessments for reading comprehension and give students unlimited chances to select the correct response. Reports reflect this and provide teachers with better feedback of student progress toward completion of the weekly activities.
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063049883)****Allow Retake** : Shown in the upper left corner if the teacher has allowed additional attempts of the item. Teachers may click this button to cancel a retake for the selected content.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14741504990235) **Retake not selected** : The retake button will be grayed out if the teacher did not allow the student to repeat the item. Teachers may click this button to allow the student another attempt for the selected content. 
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063056539)** **Number of submissions** : This will show the total number of attempts on an item. When you click the number in the Gradebook you will see a pop-up modal with the date and time of each submission. When you click a submission you will see the student’s answer. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30863428017819)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063059995) **Progress Bar** : The actionable progress bar shows the student count for **Not Turned In** (red), **Ungraded** (orange), **Graded** (green). Hovering over the bar with your cursor will give the totals for each color. Clicking the progress bar, will open the Grade view for that item.
#### **In the Gradebook, Activities, Assessments, Customized Content, Crosswords, and Misspilled will have the same options as above plus the following for each enrolled student:**
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577019756443)****Student score** : The student has completed the item. If the student’s score is **orange** , it needs to be graded by the teacher. Click the **score** to open the Grade view for that item.
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577019770395)****Comments available** : The comment bubble will be visible in the upper right corner if a student or teacher added a comment to the item. When you click the **comment bubble** , a Review window will appear that includes the comment(s).
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14741177511323)Time:** Time in which Misspilled was completed.
Student submissions that require teacher grading can be found in the **Quick Grade** tab. Teachers receive a notification in the upper right corner when a student has completed content that requires grading.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26732142305691)
To view the submission(s), click the **Bell** and the Notifications modal will open. Alternately, teachers can navigate directly to the **Quick Grade** tab after selecting **Grade** from the classroom card.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444496283)
  1. Teachers can select **Mark All As Read** for the notifications to go back to 0.
  2. Select the title of the content to view student responses.
  3. Click an **envelope** to mark the individual item as read.
  4. Select **CLOSE** or the **X** to exit the Notifications modal.


After a teacher clicks the **title** of a submission from the Notification modal, **Quick Grade** will open and all ungraded student submissions will be visible.
Additional Filters may be selected using the **Filter** button on the right side of the screen. The default view is **Needs to be Graded**. Teachers can use the dropdown box to view **Teacher Graded** , to see which items have already been scored. 
Each column in Quick Grade can be sorted by clicking the arrow next to the name of the column. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452595611)
When teachers select the blue **Grade Now** button, a modal containing each completed student’s submission for the assigned content will open. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452597019)
**A**. Teachers have access to see **All Questions** associated with the content. The default view is **Needs to be Graded**.
**B**. Student responses are organized by question number. In this example, teachers will grade all student responses for Question 1, before moving on to Question 9. However, teachers can choose to score the questions in any order by selecting a specific question from the list or choosing **Next Question** in the bottom corner of the modal.
**C**. If teachers are looking for a specific student, they can choose to use the Search bar and type the students name.
**D**. Select ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444506779)**Incorrect** ,![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452603803)**Partially Correct** , or ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444515227)**Correct**.
**E**. Selecting a student name, will open a new modal that displays the student's responses to the questions in the selected content. Use the back arrow to return to the class. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444516763)
**a**. A **Select Student** dropdown within the modal allows teachers to easily move on to a different student. 
**b**. The option to allow the student to retake the Assessment.
**c**. View the **Submission date** , **number of Submissions** , **Coins** , and **Score**. 
**d**. If a student has more than one **Submission** , each submission can be viewed by clicking the number and then the submission you wish to view. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444519835)
**F**. Once finished, select the **Save and Close** button. Any questions that have been graded will move to the **All Questions** tab. 
When viewing submissions for the class, the **Progress Bar** shows teachers how many students still need to be graded for the selected question. In this example, Victor has been scored, showing there are an additional 8 students remaining. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444520603)
After students have submitted their Rubric offline, teachers can leave comments and score them in the **Rubric** tab of the **Grade** section. Students can also leave comments or ask questions within the Rubric in their Table of Contents. 
The Rubric page will show:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615304633371)
  1. Publication dropdown menu
  2. Rubric dropdown menu
  3. List of students in the selected classroom
  4. Criteria for the Rubric and point value of each (example shows 1). 
  5. Comment bubbles, scores, and total points for each student
  6. Print button


To begin, select a Publication, Rubric, and student name to begin leaving comments or to add scores for the chosen Rubric.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615343253403)
Leaving Comments
Teachers and students can communicate in both the **Not Yet!** and **For Sure!** columns of the rubric before, during, and after the submission and scoring process. 
To send an individual comment, click the**Paper Airplane**. Selecting **Save** , **Next Student** or **Previous Student** will send all comments that have not been individually sent. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585230589467)
Students will get a teacher comment alert in their **Notification Center** every time their teacher leaves a comment. When a student selects the comment, the Rubric will open in the Table of Contents.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585957894555)
Teachers will get a student comment alert in their **Notification Center** every time a student leaves a comment. When the comment is selected from the list, the [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) page will open to the Rubric. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585963640091)
Teacher's may edit or delete their saved comments at any time by hovering over the comment. Selecting the **red X** will delete the comment. To save an edited comment, click the green **save** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585957904667)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585963652891)
Scoring Rubrics
Teachers can award full or partial credit for each criterion by typing the value in the **Score** boxes. Scores can be edited any time or left blank until full credit can be awarded. Students will get a **Rubric Grade Alert** in their **Notification Center** each time their teacher clicks the **Save** button. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585269177883)
When a teacher **Saves** a score for each criteria in the Rubric, the content will show as completed on the student’s Table of Contents.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27312369439899)
Visit the [Rubrics](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/20457667934747-Rubrics) article for additional information. 
Note
Make sure and refresh the web browser for the most up to date notifications.
#### **Teachers can leave a comment for the student when grading. Students can then view and reply to those comments.**
  1. At the bottom of the question block, click **Comments**.
  2. Click where it says **Add Comment**.
  3. Enter your comment.
  4. Click the **Paper Airplane** button located to the right of the comment text box to send it to the student.


Once sent, you can also hover over the comment to **edit** or **delete** the comment.
To learn how to let students retake submissions, see the[ How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section)
  * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission)
  * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions)
  * [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents)

[Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher) 3. [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade) How to Navigate the Grade Section FollowNot yet followed by anyone Teachers have a Gradebook and Quick Grade in the Grade section. The Gradebook is where teachers view student scores or coins for each week for the entire class. The Quick Grade page is where a teacher can grade all submissions that require grading by a teacher. To learn about each option click the tabs below. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card,** click the **Grade** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821612004891) **Gradebook Quick Grade Rubric** The Gradebook is a convenient place for teachers to see all student scores or coins earned all in one place. To access the Gradebook you must first choose a Publication and week in the Table of Contents dropdown. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615304621339) 1. **Publication** : Dropdown to alternate between publications. 2. **Week** : Dropdown to select a week within the chosen publication. 3. **Filter By** : Sort by All, Activity, Article, Customized Content, Vocabulary Review, or Weekly Assessment. Teachers can also organize by Coins or Points. 4. **Students** : The student rows will display all of the students enrolled in the selected classroom. Teachers may need to scroll down to see all the students or type a student name in the search box. Selecting a student name will open a **Weekly Review*** modal. 5. **Each Item in the Week** : The selected week's content will display in columns. It shows the icon relating to the item type and the name of the item. Teachers may need to scroll right to see all the assigned content for the week. Recommendation to View *****Weekly Review**** Selecting a student name from the Gradebook list will open a **Weekly Review** modal. The modal will show the student’s responses and include the following:![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30863428015643) **A.** Direct link to the week in the Table of Contents **B.** Total Number of Submissions for the student and the date and time of the Submission(s) **C.** Total Coins awarded for the week **D.** Submission number, Coins earned for the submission, and Total Score for the Assessment, Activities, Crossword, and for Customized Content. **E.** Print button Use the scroll bar on the right side of the modal to view all the answered content for the week. **In the Gradebook, Article Comprehension Questions will be numbered sequentially and have the following for each enrolled student:** **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063029915)****Not Started** : The student has not started the item. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063036059) **In Progress** : The student has begun the item but has not completed it. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063041435) **Completed** : The student completed the article questions. Article Comprehension Questions are designed as formative assessments for reading comprehension and give students unlimited chances to select the correct response. Reports reflect this and provide teachers with better feedback of student progress toward completion of the weekly activities. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063049883)****Allow Retake** : Shown in the upper left corner if the teacher has allowed additional attempts of the item. Teachers may click this button to cancel a retake for the selected content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14741504990235) **Retake not selected** : The retake button will be grayed out if the teacher did not allow the student to repeat the item. Teachers may click this button to allow the student another attempt for the selected content. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063056539)** **Number of submissions** : This will show the total number of attempts on an item. When you click the number in the Gradebook you will see a pop-up modal with the date and time of each submission. When you click a submission you will see the student’s answer. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30863428017819) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577063059995) **Progress Bar** : The actionable progress bar shows the student count for **Not Turned In** (red), **Ungraded** (orange), **Graded** (green). Hovering over the bar with your cursor will give the totals for each color. Clicking the progress bar, will open the Grade view for that item. **In the Gradebook, Activities, Assessments, Customized Content, Crosswords, and Misspilled will have the same options as above plus the following for each enrolled student:** **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577019756443)****Student score** : The student has completed the item. If the student’s score is **orange** , it needs to be graded by the teacher. Click the **score** to open the Grade view for that item. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20577019770395)****Comments available** : The comment bubble will be visible in the upper right corner if a student or teacher added a comment to the item. When you click the **comment bubble** , a Review window will appear that includes the comment(s). **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14741177511323)Time:** Time in which Misspilled was completed. Student submissions that require teacher grading can be found in the **Quick Grade** tab. Teachers receive a notification in the upper right corner when a student has completed content that requires grading. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26732142305691) To view the submission(s), click the **Bell** and the Notifications modal will open. Alternately, teachers can navigate directly to the **Quick Grade** tab after selecting **Grade** from the classroom card. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444496283) 1. Teachers can select **Mark All As Read** for the notifications to go back to 0. 2. Select the title of the content to view student responses. 3. Click an **envelope** to mark the individual item as read. 4. Select **CLOSE** or the **X** to exit the Notifications modal. After a teacher clicks the **title** of a submission from the Notification modal, **Quick Grade** will open and all ungraded student submissions will be visible. Additional Filters may be selected using the **Filter** button on the right side of the screen. The default view is **Needs to be Graded**. Teachers can use the dropdown box to view **Teacher Graded** , to see which items have already been scored. Each column in Quick Grade can be sorted by clicking the arrow next to the name of the column. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452595611) When teachers select the blue **Grade Now** button, a modal containing each completed student’s submission for the assigned content will open. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452597019) **A**. Teachers have access to see **All Questions** associated with the content. The default view is **Needs to be Graded**. **B**. Student responses are organized by question number. In this example, teachers will grade all student responses for Question 1, before moving on to Question 9. However, teachers can choose to score the questions in any order by selecting a specific question from the list or choosing **Next Question** in the bottom corner of the modal. **C**. If teachers are looking for a specific student, they can choose to use the Search bar and type the students name. **D**. Select ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444506779)**Incorrect** ,![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498452603803)**Partially Correct** , or ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444515227)**Correct**. **E**. Selecting a student name, will open a new modal that displays the student's responses to the questions in the selected content. Use the back arrow to return to the class. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444516763) **a**. A **Select Student** dropdown within the modal allows teachers to easily move on to a different student. **b**. The option to allow the student to retake the Assessment. **c**. View the **Submission date** , **number of Submissions** , **Coins** , and **Score**. **d**. If a student has more than one **Submission** , each submission can be viewed by clicking the number and then the submission you wish to view. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444519835) **F**. Once finished, select the **Save and Close** button. Any questions that have been graded will move to the **All Questions** tab. When viewing submissions for the class, the **Progress Bar** shows teachers how many students still need to be graded for the selected question. In this example, Victor has been scored, showing there are an additional 8 students remaining. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38498444520603) After students have submitted their Rubric offline, teachers can leave comments and score them in the **Rubric** tab of the **Grade** section. Students can also leave comments or ask questions within the Rubric in their Table of Contents. The Rubric page will show: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615304633371) 1. Publication dropdown menu 2. Rubric dropdown menu 3. List of students in the selected classroom 4. Criteria for the Rubric and point value of each (example shows 1). 5. Comment bubbles, scores, and total points for each student 6. Print button To begin, select a Publication, Rubric, and student name to begin leaving comments or to add scores for the chosen Rubric. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37615343253403) Leaving Comments Teachers and students can communicate in both the **Not Yet!** and **For Sure!** columns of the rubric before, during, and after the submission and scoring process. To send an individual comment, click the**Paper Airplane**. Selecting **Save** , **Next Student** or **Previous Student** will send all comments that have not been individually sent. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585230589467) Students will get a teacher comment alert in their **Notification Center** every time their teacher leaves a comment. When a student selects the comment, the Rubric will open in the Table of Contents. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585957894555) Teachers will get a student comment alert in their **Notification Center** every time a student leaves a comment. When the comment is selected from the list, the [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) page will open to the Rubric. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585963640091) Teacher's may edit or delete their saved comments at any time by hovering over the comment. Selecting the **red X** will delete the comment. To save an edited comment, click the green **save** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585957904667) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585963652891) Scoring Rubrics Teachers can award full or partial credit for each criterion by typing the value in the **Score** boxes. Scores can be edited any time or left blank until full credit can be awarded. Students will get a **Rubric Grade Alert** in their **Notification Center** each time their teacher clicks the **Save** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20585269177883) When a teacher **Saves** a score for each criteria in the Rubric, the content will show as completed on the student’s Table of Contents. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27312369439899) Visit the [Rubrics](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/20457667934747-Rubrics) article for additional information. Note Make sure and refresh the web browser for the most up to date notifications. **Teachers can leave a comment for the student when grading. Students can then view and reply to those comments.** 1. At the bottom of the question block, click **Comments**. 2. Click where it says **Add Comment**. 3. Enter your comment. 4. Click the **Paper Airplane** button located to the right of the comment text box to send it to the student. Once sent, you can also hover over the comment to **edit** or **delete** the comment. To learn how to let students retake submissions, see the[ How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) article. Articles in this section * [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions) * [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents) Recently viewed articles * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18385714221723-How-to-Print-Studies-Weekly-Online-Materials) * [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard) * [How to Use the Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5389938480155-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Integrate-with-LMSs)

title: District Customized Content Report

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators)


#  District Customized Content Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
District admins can view student responses and scores for District Customized Content in the District Customized Content Report.
  1. From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select the **District Customized Content Report** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36050841719835)
  2. Use the **Search** bar, **Date** feature, **Filter** , or scroll down the list to navigate to the content you want to view. District Customized Content must be shared with teachers to view the report. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36050841725083)If Filters are used **Status** , **Visibility** , and **Grade** filters will only be available to select if you select District Customized content from the Type.
  3. After content is selected, the item questions will be visible and individual question boxes can be unchecked to focus on specific questions within the Customized Content. (See box 1 in the image below.)
Each school will show the **Number Completed** out of the **Number of Students** the content was assigned to, and the **Average Score** for each school. (See box 2 in the image below.)
Use the **Back** button to switch to different District Customized Content options or use the **Search** bar to quickly find schools. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36050841726619)
Important
If District Customized Content includes questions that require grading, assigned schools will **_not_** appear on the list until the student responses have been graded by a teacher.
  4. Select a school to view classroom scores. District admins can see the teachers assigned to each classroom and use the **Filter** to adjust the date range for when the students completed the selected Customized Content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36050849682459)
  5. After a classroom is selected, the questions remain visible and individual student scores are displayed. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36050849685787)
  6. To view how individual students answered each question, select a student’s name. A review page will pop-up and can be printed. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31496536765723)


Teachers can view student responses and scores in the [Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report).
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role)
  * [How to Create and Share District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content)
  * [District Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report)
  * [District Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report)
  * [Manual Sync of District Roster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003-Manual-Sync-of-District-Roster)


## Recently viewed articles
