title: District Admin Standards Report
meta_description: Standards Report will only appear if it is available for one of your publications.  District admins can view average scores from schools,...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators)


#  District Admin Standards Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Standards Report will only appear if it is available for one of your publications.
District admins can view average scores from schools, classrooms, and individual students of the standards covered in Studies Weekly Online Unit and Weekly Assessment questions using the Standards Report.
From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select the **Standards Report** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36519454175643)
**A** : Dropdown to select a publication. 
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D** : Select individual standard links to open a pop-up modal displaying the standard and questions available for the publication. Standards are organized alphabetically and numerically.
**E** : Search for a specific school by typing the name in the **Find** bubble. Schools are organized alphabetically. Use the caret ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36057808096155) at the top of the list to change the order from Z-A.
**F** : Average district score for each standard on a student's _first_ Assessment attempt. District scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the district for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the district. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = district score)
**G** : Select an individual school to view the average scores for classrooms. Classroom scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in that class. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students in the class = classroom score)
**H**. School scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the selected school for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the school. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = school score)
Important
  * The scores on this report contain scores from the students' first attempt. If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt will appear on this report.
  * This report is cached. An updated report will be available every morning.
  * When no data is available there is a (**-**) in the standard box.
  * The Standards Report will only appear if it's available for one of your Publications.


#### **Additional options after selecting a school**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086425710235)
**I** : Back button to return to the district list of schools. 
**J**. Select a classroom to view classroom individual student scores. 
#### **Additional options after selecting a student**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086420643355)
**K**. Select the **three dots****![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36057798000283)**to the right of a student's name to either**Edit** the account or **Log In As** the student.
**L**. Select an individual student score to view the standard, questions associated, student answer selections, and Total Score of the standard (points earned/points possible.) _More information is provided below._
#### **Individual Student Scores**
Each standard's score is calculated by averaging the scores of all answered questions linked to it. This report displays scores from your students’ first submission of each assessment question. (See letter **L** above.) If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086420647195)
**M** : Student name, average percentage score, and Total Score. Shown as total points earned/ total points possible.
**N** : Standard number and skill.
**O** : Link to open the Assessment in the publication.
**P** : Submission Time and Date.
**Q** : Student’s response to the question. Response will be red if incorrect, green if correct.
**R** : Question Score (points earned/points possible).
**S** : Option to **Print**.
#### **Printing**
Selecting **Print** within an individual student’s standards pop-up modal (see letters **E** and **S** above) allows you to view and print the student’s responses to the questions. As well as see the date and time each question was submitted.
Selecting **Print** within the Standards pop-up modal (see letter **C** above) allows you to view and print the (unanswered) questions associated with the selected standard.

cleaned_markdown: Articles : District-Admin-Standards-Report . What can we help you with? 1. (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us) 2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators) 3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators) District Admin Standards Report FollowNot yet followed by anyone Standards Report will only appear if it is available for one of your publications. District admins can view average scores from schools, classrooms, and individual students of the standards covered in Studies Weekly Online Unit and Weekly Assessment questions using the Standards Report. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select the **Standards Report** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36519454175643) **A** : Dropdown to select a publication. **B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All. **C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. **D** : Select individual standard links to open a pop-up modal displaying the standard and questions available for the publication. Standards are organized alphabetically and numerically. **E** : Search for a specific school by typing the name in the **Find** bubble. Schools are organized alphabetically. Use the caret ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36057808096155) at the top of the list to change the order from Z-A. **F** : Average district score for each standard on a student's _first_ Assessment attempt. District scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the district for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the district. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = district score) **G** : Select an individual school to view the average scores for classrooms. Classroom scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in that class. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students in the class = classroom score) **H**. School scores are calculated by adding together the scores of all eligible students in the selected school for a specific standard divided by the number of eligible students in the school. (Eligible student scores total / eligible students = school score) Important * The scores on this report contain scores from the students' first attempt. If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt will appear on this report. * This report is cached. An updated report will be available every morning. * When no data is available there is a (**-**) in the standard box. * The Standards Report will only appear if it's available for one of your Publications. **Additional options after selecting a school** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086425710235) **I** : Back button to return to the district list of schools. **J**. Select a classroom to view classroom individual student scores. **Additional options after selecting a student** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086420643355) **K**. Select the **three dots****![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36057798000283)**to the right of a student's name to either**Edit** the account or **Log In As** the student. **L**. Select an individual student score to view the standard, questions associated, student answer selections, and Total Score of the standard (points earned/points possible.) _More information is provided below._ **Individual Student Scores** Each standard's score is calculated by averaging the scores of all answered questions linked to it. This report displays scores from your students’ first submission of each assessment question. (See letter **L** above.) If a retake has been allowed, only the first attempt appears on this report. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36086420647195) **M** : Student name, average percentage score, and Total Score. Shown as total points earned/ total points possible. **N** : Standard number and skill. **O** : Link to open the Assessment in the publication. **P** : Submission Time and Date. **Q** : Student’s response to the question. Response will be red if incorrect, green if correct. **R** : Question Score (points earned/points possible). **S** : Option to **Print**. **Printing** Selecting **Print** within an individual student’s standards pop-up modal (see letters **E** and **S** above) allows you to view and print the student’s responses to the questions. As well as see the date and time each question was submitted. Selecting **Print** within the Standards pop-up modal (see letter **C** above) allows you to view and print the (unanswered) questions associated with the selected standard. [ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18411960987803-Training-and-Resources)


#  Studies Weekly Online Instructional Strategy Templates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers use a multitude of instructional strategies to deliver their lessons to students. There is no one size fits all strategy in the learning process and with that in mind Studies Weekly Online has created a variety of **Instructional Strategy Templates**. These resources will help students become actively involved in the learning process.
Did you know Studies Weekly also has a [Blog](https://www.studiesweekly.com/blog/), [Newsletter](https://www.studiesweekly.com/newsletter/), and a page? Check them out for How To’s, education trends, teaching tips, and more.
The Instructional Strategy Templates are universally applicable teaching and learning resources for all grades and subjects. The following Instructional Strategy Templates are included in Studies Weekly Online _**plus more not listed**_ : 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25802715135643)
To access the PDF templates, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account: 
  1. Click the **Training and Resources** tab. 
  2. Select **Resources**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26978846197659)
  3. Scroll down until you see the**Instructional Strategy Templates** section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26978898295451)
  4. Click a PDF to open it in a new tab. Each PDF is available in English and/or Spanish, has instructions, and has a section for student name and date. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25802715184539)


This video will help you use our PDF templates in your classroom.
[![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38373327107739)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Videos/KWL+Chart+\(Instructional+Strategies+Series\).mp4)
To learn about additional resources, visit the [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Find and Print Training and Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6969588998683-How-to-Find-and-Print-Training-and-Resources)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Instructional Strategy Templates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17282878681371-Studies-Weekly-Online-Instructional-Strategy-Templates)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Primary Source Analysis Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17282812984475-Studies-Weekly-Online-Primary-Source-Analysis-Tools)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Graphic Organizers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17258062993819-Studies-Weekly-Online-Graphic-Organizers)
  * [Studies Weekly Online Student Artifacts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17283150237467-Studies-Weekly-Online-Student-Artifacts)

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/37597764232731-June-2025-Product-Updates#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F37597764232731-June-2025-Product-Updates "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025)


#  June 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Table of Contents has a NEW LOOK**
Units are easier to identify on the Table of Contents with their highlighted pastel background. Units can be opened or closed with the new expand/collapse buttons ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37597801151259)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37597801152539) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37719151333019)
The **Teacher Resources** button was replaced by a **Manage Publication** button. Teacher Resources are still available using the button found on the Table of Contents. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37599658804123)
When **Manage Publications** is elected it opens in a pop-up modal allowing users to: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37599761549723)
**a.** What content is **Currently Visible to students**. Content marked as "OFF" is not counted. If specific content is not available for the selected publication, it will not be listed in the Currently Visible box. i.e., if there are no Rubrics or Crosswords available, they will not be listed.
**b. Content Toggles** to mark individual items as visible (blue) or hidden (gray) from students. By default all content is visible. 
**c.** The **Publication Visibility** Toggle will hide all content within the publication from stu**dents.**
**d.** The **Revert to Default** button will revert all content within the publication back to the original order. It will also reset all toggles to the “ON” position.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37853435626651)
**Crosswords Print on Single Page**
Crossword puzzles, clues, and the word bank will now print on one page. 
After selecting Student View**>** Teacher Actions**>** Print:![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37720048742811)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37720048751003)
**Google Grade Passback**
Google Grade Passback has been added to allow teachers to view student scores from Studies Weekly Online Unit and Weekly Assessments, Activities, and Customized Content in Google Classroom. Full instructions can be [found here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9395161382555-How-to-Assign-Content-in-Google-Classroom).
Teachers will need to accept Google permissions to allow Studies Weekly Online access to Google Classroom. This may require approval from the district Google administrator. Read the [How to Connect Google Classroom with Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5390210374299-How-to-Connect-Google-Classroom-with-Studies-Weekly) article for more information on permissions.
**Quick Grade Updates**
The Quick Grade update now organizes student submissions by content/publication vs. by individual student submissions. The option to grade by student is still available. View the new report in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38499889835675)
### Articles in this section

  * [June 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/37597764232731-June-2025-Product-Updates)

View the new report in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article. [ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Clever](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690797862939-Clever)


#  Rostering - Clever FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Click through the tabs below to see answers to commonly asked questions in regard to rostering with Clever.
**Is there a cost associated with rostering through Clever?**
Studies Weekly does not charge districts to roster with Clever. However, as with other third-party rostering services, we do require that publications have been purchased for your students and teachers so that they can fully utilize Studies Weekly Online. When a district requests Clever, we will check if the number of publications purchased justifies rostering the entire district through Clever, or if manually registering a few teachers and their classrooms would be a better option.
**Can non-teacher staff and administrator accounts be created through Clever rostering?**
Yes!
  * Users shared with Studies Weekly Online in the "Staff" section of Clever are given the [School Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187) role in Studies Weekly Online.
  * Users shared with Studies Weekly Online in the "District Administrator" section of Clever are given the [District Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003) role in Studies Weekly Online. 


To add a user to the Clever roster as staff or admin, please reach out to Clever support.
**Can we use the Studies Weekly SSO application in Clever if we aren't rostered?**
Your district will need to be rostered in order to use the official Studies Weekly Online 3.0 SSO application in Clever. However, a custom application can be created in Clever with <https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google> set as the shortcut URL. This will act as an SSO for users that have a Google-sourced email attached to their Studies Weekly Online account. 
Please Note
In order to use the Google SSO, please enable pop-ups on your internet browser. During the login process, a window will pop-up requesting you to select your account so that you can authenticate the login using your Google account.
If your users do not have Google-sourced emails, then you can set the custom application URL to be [online.studiesweekly.com](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/online.studiesweekly.com). That will take your users to the Studies Weekly Online login page.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering - Clever FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13091988253979-Rostering-Clever-FAQs)
  * [Clever - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13249037001371-Clever-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [Clever - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13318348540827-Clever-Troubleshooting)

#  What if a duplicate order has been placed? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article presents what to do when a duplicate order has been placed and ways to prevent it.
Studies Weekly is not responsible for duplicate orders. If you place an order over the phone, please do not also fax, email, or mail the purchase order. This may result in a duplicate order being placed.
Important
If you receive a double shipment or two invoices for the same order with different invoice numbers, contact our [customer service department](https://www.studiesweekly.com/contact-us/) right away. Work with them to return and cancel the duplicate order, to avoid duplicate charges.
Studies Weekly is unable to accept returns after **February 1st**. That is the end of our shipping season and returns can no longer be used.
### Articles in this section

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17315142489627-How-To-Create-and-Access-Teacher-Notes#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F17315142489627-How-To-Create-and-Access-Teacher-Notes "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18411963371675-Teacher-Resources)


#  How To Create and Access Teacher Notes 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers have the ability to highlight information, add notes, and embed Printables and Media (images, videos, and audio) when in Teacher Resources. This allows them to easily reference and review key information from the content and add it to a lesson plan. Notes and highlights are unique to a publication and will carry over to each classroom that has access to that publication within the user’s account.
Note
Notes and highlights can only be seen by the user who created them and will be saved to use year after year. 
**Create Access**
To create Teacher Resource Notes, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account: 
  1. Open the publication you wish to add Notes to.
  2. Select the **Teacher Resources** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37609458159771)
  3. Locate the content you wish to highlight. Drag your cursor over the text and type any notes that are important to you. Choose the color of your highlight and click **Save**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37609458168347)


Open a video within a publication to find the **Highlight** button in the upper right corner.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29766238312859)
Select an image within a publication and look for the **Highlight** button in the bottom center of the screen. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29766238316955)
Visit the article [How To Use the Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool) for additional details.
**Teacher Notes** can be found in the Classroom Cards. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37609458171163)
The Teacher Resource Notes page is organized by publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35312220093211)
**A**. Previous years notes carry over year to year and are accessible here.
**B**. Select a different publication.
**C**. Teachers can **Search** for specific annotations.
**D**. Filter by a specific **Unit** or**Week**.
**E**. **Units** , **Week** s, and **Articles** are hyperlinked for quick access.
**F**. A comment bubble will signify when an annotation is added.
**G**. Media can be selected and viewed from Teacher Notes.
**H**. The **Print** feature gives teachers the option to **Save as PDF** or **Print** their notes, allowing them to share notes with another teacher.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29469593569563)
Studies Weekly Online recommends selecting the **Background graphics** box for optimal printing.

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade)


#  How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online recommends using the [Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155) to score student submissions. However, teachers have the option to grade or view student submissions using the Table of Contents. Visit the printing tip at the bottom of this article for printing student responses and Answer Keys. 
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click a publication to open it or click **View All Publications**. Once a publication has been selected, open **Unit** and **Week** , then click **Grade** : 
From the **Grade** tab, teachers can perform the following actions:
  1. Navigate to different content within the selected week. (In this example, Week 1: Government Assessment was clicked.) If you do not see the Navigation Bar on the left, you will need to zoom out. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31114241655835)
  2. Use the **Graded** , **Not Turned In** , or **Ungraded** buttons to filter student submissions. **All** Students is the default view. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31114241660315)
  3. Select a student to view or grade their submission(s) for the chosen content. (In this example the student “Sunny Day” was selected.)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31114241663003)
     * If the teacher or student made a comment, the **Comment** button will be visible. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24165947305371) To learn more about comments, visit the article [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section).
     * Teachers can also assign a retake by clicking the **Retake Button.****![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24165947324059)**This will change the view to a**Submissions** section to be able to view each submission separately. To learn more about retakes, visit the article [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) and click the**Publication** tab.
     * Clicking the **three dots** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24165958994971)to the right of a student name, allows the teacher to **Edit** the student account or **Login As** the student. 
  4. After a student submission is selected, teachers will see the **Date** and **Time** , **Number of Submissions** ,**Coins** , and **Score** for the selected content. (In this example, Week 1: Government Assessment is selected for Sunny Day.) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31114253659163)
     * A drop down box allows quick access to view **All** , **Needs to Be Graded** , **Incorrect** , **Correct** , or **Partially Correct responses**. 
     * Quickly change a student’s score from **Needs to Be Graded** by clicking the appropriate option; **Correct** , **Partially Correct** , or **Incorrect** , then click **Update Scores**.
     * The **Retake Not allowed** button can be clicked to change it to **Retake Allowed**. This allows the student another attempt at the selected content and will change the view to a **Submissions** page. Teachers will be able to view each attempt separately. 


**Printing an Answer Key or Student Submissions Tips**
Teachers are encouraged to use the [Answer Keys](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/16960761557915) found in the **Teacher Actions** dropdown, rather than try to create their own.
Student Submissions can be printed or saved as a PDF by opening the **Teachers Actions** dropdown and selecting **Print**. If the Print button is missing for a Student is indicates the student has not submitted the content.
To learn more about retakes, visit the article [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) and click the**Publication** tab.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section)
  * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission)
  * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions)
  * [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents)

title: How to Play Explorers
meta_description: In Explorers, students can customize their avatar and decorate a treehouse. The Explorers game is located in the student user profile...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [How to Play Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690681345947-How-to-Play-Games)


#  How to Play Explorers 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
In Explorers, students can customize their avatar and decorate a treehouse. The Explorers game is located in the student user profile menu in the top right corner of the screen. To access it, students will click their **Profile Menu** next to the notification bell, then select **Explorers**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38338598283803)
**Customize the Avatar**
Coins are not required to customize the avatar and changes can be made anytime by clicking the default avatar in the top left corner of the screen. 
![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/P81NC2KYdHkKGu71xqe6Y3QhZ1-ozzMaFwvfC6O4SzW74Ayetax0HeqSXktoYGScFB301WcFEwncxOoshSiH4uGv_y_ClE8j-66svIPA8MjxOEYEV3OHX75u5ZkrdQS6sukDNyr-D51RMXqFffeAnjw)
To make changes to the avatar click the arrows next to the option you want to change. 
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/YrPinq4_egjmFmWKLC2hsYSghyLjs69Snj2LN2dp2Db0Oy9EA-7nxeXDYCIDo8i7rzyd6-iAiddmwUfaweopCqmbCGYYMHUlN066ylmF6cbL6m7mq8I2p6H9XbGnPoT0vh7fqVPiZg9CYuuM5MIMP2I)
When you are finished making changes, click **OK**. The saved avatar will appear on screen
![](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/wQfl9QGeV-TMMP0_sG3LfotgaoZEosbnUz8L2sJbOwW0gcFuzuFrS9YQDq-N9aIkLKPkLqpo7IgPaSZabeu8d5QtxO3R-apmKJzpifMJKKZjxEeWUffGv_Bh2bZ647Uf1ZK-qbPoDRPE8_z3KJQRwxQ)
To return to reading, select the book button. ![](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/sImaoxRjYdfpvB0uIPHk6q_Mv7g_5MebminEDHLNf65gYkdcX_vTBLYoxgI6SDlckEhLgItfFTYaJ_1bASSQdUurOcsMIOgN11_nWhQabWt6TyD8fzq4A9zhJLGGmngyyz82nri-syR1vN11bEGkpXY)
**Decorate the Treehouse**
As students progress in Studies Weekly Online by completing learning activities, they earn coins. As students earn coins, the progress bar in the upper left corner will fill in. When the progress bar is filled, students earn a gem. The more coins a student earns in Studies Weekly Online, the more gems they will receive. Gems can be used to make special purchases in the Treasure Box. 
![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/1qZDMJynvQ6z6JRiF8hK2wvvoeVNINO1_n0NkratcO8O0i30EJ5RidpvE2--SGSUuVpBY7bWTCq-9kZmIYmq-wH9_6Irb59xCNX_JrGH3ruEeb-m7nQPrNUdZnQljOfShvrijSr6RK2CF9SLqIRYUVg)
To move around the treehouse, use your mouse, trackpad, or touch screen to click the location where you would like your avatar to move. 
To make a purchase using your Studies Weekly Online coins or gems, click the **Treasure Box![treasure_box.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683729897371)** in the bottom right corner of the screen.
Items are organized into clickable categories. At the top of each category, the items can be sorted by cost (dollar symbol) and favorites (star). 
Click the **arrows** at the bottom of the screen to view the items on the next page.
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/5tobJq4-K_9Cy8sE5cQGtHBHLrFoj6usbC2ZpVie4yQA9LFG5KxKPcqOk4m6Gzd1Re_ALV6DVZ_rMWAopmJ9qBsCV53RR_pek4uDUMS28nkIw-v0sXlVtkIoK6XpBBA1pBTalDDJGzV0VzapZOJ-jQc)
To make a purchase, click on the item , then click **Buy**. 
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jtrEXUwEc7jcNkG-1vc0pQPTGF1r8pPNRFzSfnC6A2yAg63aphsOvp7LO5wi7heTDkzYRP2t6Ccb4LXJC-emKiTjK6WwqW5Fm9uwEWlJ5W-Vl1K8iaX6I3RlhICgJnLFnrFdwJipo4Yd3M3kghylWfE)
The item will appear (highlighted) on screen, click and hold while you drag the item into place. When you are satisfied with your placement, click the **green checkmark**. If the item is red, it cannot be placed in that location. Students will then be able to purchase more items or close the Treasure Box in the upper right corner. 
![buying_items_in_Explorers.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12684808555547)
Items can be moved after you place them and some items can be rotated. Click and **hold the item** until it highlights green. 
![move_or_rotate_an_item.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683838748699)
Students can drag and drop the item into a new place or click the **Rotation Button![rotate.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683936253595)**
When you’re finished, click the **Green Checkmark![checkmark.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683941775899)**
To remove items, click the open Treasure Box ![return_items.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683989891867)
Once clicked, the items will disappear from the Treehouse and go back into the Treasure Box, but the items can be purchased again. Student accounts created through a rostering process will retain their purchases year after year. For this reason, they may choose to remove items that have been purchased.
To learn more, check out the [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-Coins) and the [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931) articles.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins)
  * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled)
  * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword)
  * [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers)

cleaned_markdown: Articles : How-to-Play-Explorers . What can we help you with? 1. (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us) 2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience) 3. [How to Play Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690681345947-How-to-Play-Games) How to Play Explorers FollowNot yet followed by anyone In Explorers, students can customize their avatar and decorate a treehouse. The Explorers game is located in the student user profile menu in the top right corner of the screen. To access it, students will click their **Profile Menu** next to the notification bell, then select **Explorers**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38338598283803) **Customize the Avatar** Coins are not required to customize the avatar and changes can be made anytime by clicking the default avatar in the top left corner of the screen. ![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/P81NC2KYdHkKGu71xqe6Y3QhZ1-ozzMaFwvfC6O4SzW74Ayetax0HeqSXktoYGScFB301WcFEwncxOoshSiH4uGv_y_ClE8j-66svIPA8MjxOEYEV3OHX75u5ZkrdQS6sukDNyr-D51RMXqFffeAnjw) To make changes to the avatar click the arrows next to the option you want to change. ![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/YrPinq4_egjmFmWKLC2hsYSghyLjs69Snj2LN2dp2Db0Oy9EA-7nxeXDYCIDo8i7rzyd6-iAiddmwUfaweopCqmbCGYYMHUlN066ylmF6cbL6m7mq8I2p6H9XbGnPoT0vh7fqVPiZg9CYuuM5MIMP2I) When you are finished making changes, click **OK**. The saved avatar will appear on screen ![](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/wQfl9QGeV-TMMP0_sG3LfotgaoZEosbnUz8L2sJbOwW0gcFuzuFrS9YQDq-N9aIkLKPkLqpo7IgPaSZabeu8d5QtxO3R-apmKJzpifMJKKZjxEeWUffGv_Bh2bZ647Uf1ZK-qbPoDRPE8_z3KJQRwxQ) To return to reading, select the book button. ![](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/sImaoxRjYdfpvB0uIPHk6q_Mv7g_5MebminEDHLNf65gYkdcX_vTBLYoxgI6SDlckEhLgItfFTYaJ_1bASSQdUurOcsMIOgN11_nWhQabWt6TyD8fzq4A9zhJLGGmngyyz82nri-syR1vN11bEGkpXY) **Decorate the Treehouse** As students progress in Studies Weekly Online by completing learning activities, they earn coins. As students earn coins, the progress bar in the upper left corner will fill in. When the progress bar is filled, students earn a gem. The more coins a student earns in Studies Weekly Online, the more gems they will receive. Gems can be used to make special purchases in the Treasure Box. ![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/1qZDMJynvQ6z6JRiF8hK2wvvoeVNINO1_n0NkratcO8O0i30EJ5RidpvE2--SGSUuVpBY7bWTCq-9kZmIYmq-wH9_6Irb59xCNX_JrGH3ruEeb-m7nQPrNUdZnQljOfShvrijSr6RK2CF9SLqIRYUVg) To move around the treehouse, use your mouse, trackpad, or touch screen to click the location where you would like your avatar to move. To make a purchase using your Studies Weekly Online coins or gems, click the **Treasure Box![treasure_box.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683729897371)** in the bottom right corner of the screen. Items are organized into clickable categories. At the top of each category, the items can be sorted by cost (dollar symbol) and favorites (star). Click the **arrows** at the bottom of the screen to view the items on the next page. ![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/5tobJq4-K_9Cy8sE5cQGtHBHLrFoj6usbC2ZpVie4yQA9LFG5KxKPcqOk4m6Gzd1Re_ALV6DVZ_rMWAopmJ9qBsCV53RR_pek4uDUMS28nkIw-v0sXlVtkIoK6XpBBA1pBTalDDJGzV0VzapZOJ-jQc) To make a purchase, click on the item , then click **Buy**. ![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jtrEXUwEc7jcNkG-1vc0pQPTGF1r8pPNRFzSfnC6A2yAg63aphsOvp7LO5wi7heTDkzYRP2t6Ccb4LXJC-emKiTjK6WwqW5Fm9uwEWlJ5W-Vl1K8iaX6I3RlhICgJnLFnrFdwJipo4Yd3M3kghylWfE) The item will appear (highlighted) on screen, click and hold while you drag the item into place. When you are satisfied with your placement, click the **green checkmark**. If the item is red, it cannot be placed in that location. Students will then be able to purchase more items or close the Treasure Box in the upper right corner. ![buying_items_in_Explorers.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12684808555547) Items can be moved after you place them and some items can be rotated. Click and **hold the item** until it highlights green. ![move_or_rotate_an_item.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683838748699) Students can drag and drop the item into a new place or click the **Rotation Button![rotate.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683936253595)** When you’re finished, click the **Green Checkmark![checkmark.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683941775899)** To remove items, click the open Treasure Box ![return_items.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/12683989891867) Once clicked, the items will disappear from the Treehouse and go back into the Treasure Box, but the items can be purchased again. Student accounts created through a rostering process will retain their purchases year after year. For this reason, they may choose to remove items that have been purchased. To learn more, check out the [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-Coins) and the [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931) articles. Articles in this section * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins) * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled) * [How to Complete a Crossword](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25989768355483-How-to-Complete-a-Crossword) * [How to Play Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers) * [How to Play Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies) Recently viewed articles * [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents) * [How To Create and Access Teacher Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17315142489627-How-To-Create-and-Access-Teacher-Notes) * [What if a duplicate order has been placed?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017847-What-if-a-duplicate-order-has-been-placed) * [Rostering - Clever FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13091988253979-Rostering-Clever-FAQs) * [June 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/37597764232731-June-2025-Product-Updates)

What can we help you with?

  2. [Ordering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002825633-Ordering)
  3. [Ordering FAQ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/29724849382939-Ordering-FAQ)


#  How to Request a Sample 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers and district personnel can request a free sample of our publications. Fill in the sample request form [here](https://www.studiesweekly.com/product-sample/).
[![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38309200617243)](https://www.studiesweekly.com/product-sample/)
The samples are pre-packaged. They contain a sampling of Social Studies, Science, and Health and Wellness.
Unfortunately, we cannot send physical samples to homeschools. However, you can sample our publications digitally.
To view all the helpful tips and resources we have just for homeschooling parents, visit [studiesweekly.com/homeschool](https://www.studiesweekly.com/homeschool/)[.](https://www.studiesweekly.com/homeschool/)
Recommendation
We recommend that teachers also start a **[60-Day Free Online Trial](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002948094-Free-trial-account)** to view our publications online. This will give you a clearer understanding of what comes with your subscription. There are lesson plans, games, virtual field trips, highlighting/note taking, science lab videos, thousands of primary sources, and more.
_Please note, homeschoolers are not eligible for a free online trial._
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Request a Sample](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003413174-How-to-Request-a-Sample)
  * [What if a duplicate order has been placed?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017847-What-if-a-duplicate-order-has-been-placed)
  * [What teacher materials are included?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017687-What-teacher-materials-are-included)
  * [What does the package look like?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000017207-What-does-the-package-look-like)
  * [Why aren’t my publications already sorted?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035201813-Why-aren-t-my-publications-already-sorted)

title: How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission
meta_description: Teachers can allow a student to retake content they submitted from the Grade tab, Customized Content tab, or the Publication.    Grade...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade)


#  How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can allow a student to retake content they submitted from the Grade tab, Customized Content tab, or the Publication. 
Grade Customized Content Publication
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , click **Grade.**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821667291291)
Once there, you can choose the **Gradebook** or **Quick Grade**. 
From the Gradebook
  1. Choose the publication and week. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37645070792347)
  2. Click the **Retake** button ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16010736420635)in the box of the content you want the student to retake.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37645070793627)
  3. Choose **ALLOW RETAKE**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111311366939)


From Quick Grade
  1. Click the blue**Grade** button next to the submission you would like to review. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38715323921179)
  2. If you wish to allow a student a Retake, select the student's name from the dropdown, then click the R**etake Not Allowed** button in the upper right corner. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38715303512475)
  3. Choose **Allow Retake**. After confirming, this will change the on screen button to **Retake Allowed** signifying the student has been allowed a retake.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111311376411)


From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Click the **Customized Content** button in the desired **Classroom Card**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38821813362459)
  2. Select either G**raded** within the customized content card or **Grade** in the **three dots menu**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111311383707)
  3. Click **Allow Retake**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16015951862939) next to the name of the student(s). Or teachers may click the name of the student to view the submission then click **ALLOW RETAKE**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111325845787)


From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, click the publication image in the desired **Classroom Card** or scroll to the right and choose **View All Publications**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37645047683611)
  1. Once you have chosen a publication, in the Table of Contents, find and select the content (e.g., an assessment or Crossword) you wish to grade or allow a retake.
  2. Click the **Grade** tab.
  3. Click **Allow Retake**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/16014237320475) next to the name of the student(s). Or you may click the name of the student to view the submission then click **ALLOW RETAKE**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111325845787)
  4. Once the **Allow Retake** button is clicked the color of the button will change from gray to blue and the view will change from the single submission to a **Submissions box** , where teachers can see each attempt: 
  5. When the student completes the second submission, and each additional thereafter, they will be shown in the **Submissions** box. Teachers can click to open each attempt, then click **Back to Submissions** after when finished:![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31111311392411)


To learn more, see the[ How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article.
### Articles in this section

  * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission)

title: How to Find and Print Answer Keys and Printables
meta_description: Answer keys are quickly found in the Teacher Actions dropdown menu within a publication. Answer Keys are available for Article Questions,...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/16960761557915-How-to-Find-and-Print-Answer-Keys-and-Printables#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F16960761557915-How-to-Find-and-Print-Answer-Keys-and-Printables "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Find and Print Answer Keys and Printables 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Answer keys are quickly found in the Teacher Actions dropdown menu within a publication. Answer Keys are available for Article Questions, Assessments, Crosswords, and Customized Content.
  1. Navigate to a week of your choice and open the **Teacher Actions** dropdown menu. 
  2. Select **Answer Key** or **Printables** from the list of options. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554464018587)
  3. Use the **Navigation Pane** to switch between Articles, Assessments, Crossword, and Customized Content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554542225307)
  4. The Answer Key can be printed for reference or click **Cancel** to go back to the Table of Contents.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18560536385051)


Secondarily, Answer Keys can be found in the Teacher Edition of publications. (If you are new to Studies Weekly Online, please visit the [How to Navigate the Weeks within a Publication](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13354715964187-How-to-Navigate-the-Weeks-within-a-Publication) before continuing to the additional option below.)
**Teacher Edition PDF**
The PDF version of the Teacher Edition will provide answers to Assessments, Article and Activity questions, and printable worksheets. To access the PDF Teacher Edition select the **Teacher Resources** button can be found at the week level after clicking on a unit in a publication.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638618914203)
The Teacher Resources page will open in a new browser tab, where you will see the Teacher Edition on the right side of the screen.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554542225819)
After the blue **Teacher Edition PDF** button is clicked, the PDF will open in a new browser tab. Teachers may download this to their device, print, or continue viewing online.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18377483055387)
Answers usually appear in red, bold text, in line with the question. However, some printable worksheet answers may be at the end of the PDF in regular, black text because answers for these questions are not standard. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18258188282139)
**Quarterly Assessment Key (Legacy Publications Only)**
Quarterly Answer Keys can be found within the first week of the quarter of the Teacher Edition of Legacy publications.
  1. Open a publication to the Table of Contents and click **Teacher Resources**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554542225947)
  2. Click on the corresponding first week of the quarter and the **Quarterly Answer Key** will appear in the list of resources, if available![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554464020891)
  3. Click to open it and view the answers.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21274087116059)


To learn more about the Teacher Edition and find additional resources, visit the [Online Teaching Tools ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)page in the Help Center.

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Add Publications to a Classroom 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article demonstrates how teachers can add publications to a classroom. Teachers will add publications to one classroom at a time. As soon as a publication is added, students can log in and begin using Studies Weekly Online.
From your [ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the **Classroom Card** you want to add a publication to: 
  1. Select **View All Publications** to view your ordered publications. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37403646501403)
  2. If you have not added classroom access to any publications for the selected classroom yet, the **Add Publication Access** box (step 4) will automatically pop-up. 
If you have at least one publication already assigned, you will need to click **Add Publication Access** in the top right corner.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35259114061467)
  3. In the **Add Publication Access** pop-up modal, select the publication(s) you want to add to the classroom. Teachers can search or filter by Subject and Grade to narrow down the search.
  4. Select **Add**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29129686026139)
If ordered publications are missing please contact Customer Support at (866) 311-8734. Teachers can also choose the option in the top left corner to order publications or start a 60 day trial of a publication. Teachers can also visit the [How to Place an Order](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360006598073-How-to-Place-an-Order) article.
  5. Users will see a pop-up disclaimer if they add a publication that may have a new version available. Users are required to click “I Understand” before the publication will be accessible. The publication will be grayed out until the disclaimer is accepted. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35259129524635)
After the green **Disclaimer** button is clicked, the disclaimer will pop-up and the user will click **I understand** and**Submit**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31051979321115)
Then the **View** button will turn blue and the **Disclaimer** will remain visible for reference. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31051979324955)


To learn more, visit the [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).

Teachers will add publications to one classroom at a time. As soon as a publication is added, students can log in and begin using Studies Weekly Online. From your (https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the **Classroom Card** you want to add a publication to: 1. Select **View All Publications** to view your ordered publications. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37403646501403) 2. If you have not added classroom access to any publications for the selected classroom yet, the **Add Publication Access** box (step 4) will automatically pop-up. If you have at least one publication already assigned, you will need to click **Add Publication Access** in the top right corner. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35259114061467) 3. In the **Add Publication Access** pop-up modal, select the publication(s) you want to add to the classroom. Teachers can search or filter by Subject and Grade to narrow down the search. 4. Select **Add**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29129686026139) If ordered publications are missing please contact Customer Support at (866) 311-8734. Teachers can also choose the option in the top left corner to order publications or start a 60 day trial of a publication. Users will see a pop-up disclaimer if they add a publication that may have a new version available. Users are required to click “I Understand” before the publication will be accessible. The publication will be grayed out until the disclaimer is accepted. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35259129524635) After the green **Disclaimer** button is clicked, the disclaimer will pop-up and the user will click **I understand** and**Submit**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31051979321115) Then the **View** button will turn blue and the **Disclaimer** will remain visible for reference. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31051979324955) To learn more, visit the [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us). title: How to Monitor Student Article Questions
meta_description: Teachers may choose to monitor student completion of the assigned comprehension questions at the end of Articles within Publications....
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Grade](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/13879824364315-Grade)


#  How to Monitor Student Article Questions 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers may choose to monitor student completion of the assigned comprehension questions at the end of Articles within Publications. Article questions are designed to help students learn how to identify evidence from the reading to support a claim.*****
Student responses are automatically graded by Studies Weekly Online and they receive immediate feedback. Students have unlimited chances to select the correct response, but they are incentivized with coins to correctly answer each question in as few attempts as possible.******
Studies Weekly Online reports reflect this and provide teachers with student progress toward **_completion_** of the weekly article questions in multiple places.
**Gradebook Statistics Grade Tab**
The **Gradebook** provides a quick view of assigned items and the students assigned to the classroom. Use the dropdown boxes in the Gradebook to navigate to the publication, week, and item of your choice to view completion. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37643445771291)
For each student record a teacher will see one of the following for article questions: 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21143960634267) **Not Started** : The student has not started the item.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21143960656411) **In Progress** : The student has begun the item but has not completed it. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21143960688027) **Completed** : The student completed the article questions. Scores are not shown for article questions since they must get the questions correct before moving on.
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/15093245132187)** **Number of submissions** : This will show the total number of attempts on an item. When you click a number you will see the date and time of each submission. When you click a submission you will see the student’s answer.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28114546634779)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37643456362395)
To learn about the additional symbols and more features in the Gradebook, visit the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article. 
Statistics can be found inside the Snapshot Report and in Table of Contents of publications. Statistics allow teachers to quickly check student completion of article questions.
**Snapshot Report**
The Snapshot Report is found under Reports and will show your student's statistics on comprehension questions. You must first select a Publication, Week, and Content:
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37643445779099)
When a question is selected, teachers will see a graph of the answers students chose. Below the graph, teachers will see the individual attempts by each student. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31113135814683)
**Table of Contents**
Statistics are also found after selecting a week in the Table of Contents. This will show you a Class Overview for the Article. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37643456368283)
Selecting a question within the Article, will show statistics for that question exactly as in the Snapshot Report. 
Statistics can also be used to view Activities, Crossword, Misspilled, and Assessments. To learn how to view student statistics, visit the [How to Navigate the Snapshot Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13496345220763-How-to-Navigate-the-Snapshot-Report) article.
The Table of Contents are found after opening a publication and selecting a week. To view completion of Article questions select the **Grade** tab. This action will show colored chips indicating the totals of the number of students in the class (**All**), the total **Graded** , **Not Turned In** , and **Ungraded**. These colored chips correlate with the list of enrolled students directly below. This allows teachers to quickly see who has not completed the comprehension questions for the selected Article. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31113135817627)
To learn more about navigating the **Grade** tab visit the [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents) article.
Note
***** Answers to comprehension questions are found within the articles and students are encouraged to go back to the Article to find the answer with every incorrect response. To learn more about what happens when students answer article comprehension questions incorrectly, visit the [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay) article. 
****** To learn more about how students earn coins for article questions visit the [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section)
  * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission)
  * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions)
  * [How to Grade Student Submissions from the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17586872714779-How-to-Grade-Student-Submissions-from-the-Table-of-Contents)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [Company FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/38719571510555-Company-FAQs)


#  How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
One of the most significant challenges that we face is to write publications that use inclusive terminology. We strive to use language that is acceptable to all races, nationalities, ethnicities, and diverse groups.
We take this responsibility seriously because teachers and students across the country use our publications. To ensure inclusive and respectful terminology, we refer to reliable sources for guidance.
We follow the Associated Press (AP) Stylebook guidelines. The AP Stylebook is considered the industry standard and leading reference for public communications. We have also assembled a Diversity Board to review content for cultural sensitivity. They also assist with using proper word choice in our publications.
Using the right terminology can be a challenge. We are diligent in adjusting to the appropriate language as cultural identification evolves. Studies Weekly respects all individuals and seeks to recognize each heritage appropriately. We welcome your partnership in using proper terminology as we strive to improve our publications, old and new.
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly handle American Indian vs. Native American Terminology?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011618633-How-does-Studies-Weekly-handle-American-Indian-vs-Native-American-Terminology)
  * [How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity)
  * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws)
