[Company FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/38719571510555-Company-FAQs) How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? FollowNot yet followed by anyone One of the most significant challenges that we face is to write publications that use inclusive terminology. We strive to use language that is acceptable to all races, nationalities, ethnicities, and diverse groups. We take this responsibility seriously because teachers and students across the country use our publications. To ensure inclusive and respectful terminology, we refer to reliable sources for guidance. We follow the Associated Press (AP) Stylebook guidelines. The AP Stylebook is considered the industry standard and leading reference for public communications. We have also assembled a Diversity Board to review content for cultural sensitivity. They also assist with using proper word choice in our publications. Using the right terminology can be a challenge. We are diligent in adjusting to the appropriate language as cultural identification evolves. Studies Weekly respects all individuals and seeks to recognize each heritage appropriately. We welcome your partnership in using proper terminology as we strive to improve our publications, old and new. Articles in this section * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011618633-How-does-Studies-Weekly-handle-American-Indian-vs-Native-American-Terminology) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity) * [Which articles pertain to California’s LGBTQ+ laws?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018549534-Which-articles-pertain-to-California-s-LGBTQ-laws) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14325674495643-Texas-Science-Studies-Weekly-Component-Navigation) * [2023 Florida Publication Information](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14325803145883-2023-Florida-Publication-Information) Recently viewed articles * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions) * [How to Add Publications to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom) * [How to Find and Print Answer Keys and Printables](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/16960761557915-How-to-Find-and-Print-Answer-Keys-and-Printables) * [How to Allow a Student to Retake a Submission](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088723863451-How-to-Allow-a-Student-to-Retake-a-Submission) * [How to Request a Sample](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003413174-How-to-Request-a-Sample)

title: How Teachers Assign District Customized Content
meta_description: District administrators have the ability to create and share District Customized Content with teachers across the district.  Once...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  How Teachers Assign District Customized Content 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
District administrators have the ability to create and share District Customized Content with teachers across the district. 
Once District Customized Content has been shared, teachers will need to assign it to their class(es) before it will appear in the teacher’s **Customized Content** list and in their student’s **To Do** list. 
Teachers will also have access to see student scores for the District Customized Content in the **Customized Content Report**.
The instructions below will walk teachers through the steps.
**Assign and View**
Teachers will receive an email and a notification in the upper right corner of their Studies Weekly Account Dashboard when District-Created Customized Content is shared with them. The content is not automatically assigned to classrooms or students. Teachers will do that in a follow-up step. After teachers assign District Customized Content to their class(es), they will be able to review the content and read the separate instructions for students and teachers. 
Click the **Notification Bell** to view the shared District Customized Content. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26850723262875)
Select the content shared by the district admin to assign it to your class(es).
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26850769464987)
As soon as the District Customized Content is selected, the **Classrooms** page opens. Follow the on-screen instructions and select the class(es) to assign the content. 
Make sure to select the appropriate class(s) then click **Add**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26850723282459)
Once the **Add** button is selected, a confirmation box appears on-screen and will now be available in your Customized Content list. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26850776055323)
Teachers will be able to see (as shown below) which content they have created and which content has been created by a district admin. Click the **title** to view the District Customized Content. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27519496030491)
**Edit**
When District Customized Content is created, admins have the option to allow teachers to edit the content and due dates. If the district admin selects this option, teachers will be able to make changes to content and due dates for their class(es). 
If editing has been enabled by the district admin, teachers will be able to click the **Edit** button in the **Actions Menu**. If **Edit** is grayed out, teachers will not be able to make changes.
To edit District Customized Content, click the **three dots**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26850723302683) in the bottom right corner of the label for the content you wish to edit.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851085566875)
Make the necessary edits and click **Save** at the bottom of the screen.
If you have never edited or created Customized Content before, visit the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article and select the **Edit Already Created Customized Content** tab.
**View Scores**
Teachers will see student scores for District Customized Content in the **Customized Content Report**. If you are new to using the Customized Content Report, visit the [How to Use the Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10331315717787-How-to-Use-the-Customized-Content-Report) article. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851530296219)
**Grade**
Teachers will be able to grade student responses, if that option was chosen when the District Customized Content was created. Otherwise, the content is automatically graded by Studies Weekly Online. 
If grading is required, teachers will receive a notification with a link to the student submission(s).
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851397322523)
Select the link to view the submission. This will open **Quick Grade,** teachers will see all the student submissions that need to be graded. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26851443264923)
If you are new to grading student work, visit the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article. 
Recommendation
Teachers can find **Distribution Instructions** in the info box near the top of the page. These instructions are important and visible on the **Student View** , **Grade** , **Statistics** , **Highlights** , and**Edit** tabs.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28233858809115)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2023-2024](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/15075843254427-2023-2024)


#  May 2024 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**District Admin and School Admin Usage Reports**
Admins can now see which teachers and students who have logged in. Select the blue link in each column of the report to view the names. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25621005562395)
For detailed information visit the [How to Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role) and [How to Navigate the District Admin role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role) articles.
**Science Video Pop-Up**
Teachers will now see a video that explains how to access the Teacher Edition PDF, Teacher Resources, and the Student View of the Publication. They can watch it when it pop-up or choose to watch it later. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25900768677915)
**Digital Printables in Customized Content**
Teachers can now assign Digital Printables in Customized Content. Visit the [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type) and [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) articles for more information.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25962688179995)
**Thumbnail Images for Links in Teacher Resources**
Teachers now see thumbnail images indicating a link is available to open. Previously teachers saw the link. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26258667302939)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26258667319579)

[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Getting Started with Rostering ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18713449851291-Getting-Started-with-Rostering)


#  What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Single Sign-On (SSO) is a service that allows you to use one set of login credentials to access multiple websites. Studies Weekly has SSO options that make it easier for users to log in.
On the login page for Studies Weekly Online, you’ll see options to log in with Google, ClassLink, or Clever.
  * **Google SSO:** For our users who have an email address hosted by Google (e.g., Gmail), we are able to provide SSO as an option for logging in to Studies Weekly Online. Password resets should not happen on Studies Weekly’s site as the credentials used to authenticate are the ones set through your Google account.
  * **ClassLink or Clever SSO:** Users will be able to access their ClassLink or Clever teacher or student portal to launch Studies Weekly and be authenticated into their Studies Weekly accounts. This eliminates the need for teachers and students from accessing one more URL during their busy day of learning.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35659498652955)
Click each tab to learn more about the SSOs that are compatible with Studies Weekly Online.
**OAuth 2.0 Handshake**
OAuth 2.0 is another secure protocol that allows service providers to trust authentication assertions from an identity provider. It provides methods for a user to set different levels of trust and information transfer as well as revoke previously granted permissions. Google and Facebook implement this type of authentication security. Studies Weekly can establish this protocol with your identity provider.
**Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) by IMS Global**
IMS Global has created its own standard for securely communicating and sharing an authentication assertion between an identity provider and a service provider. Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) uses the OAuth 1.0 protocol to digitally sign requests to access content from a service provider. Studies Weekly can issue a consumer key and a shared secret value that LTI-enabled applications can use to securely sign and transmit requests.
**Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML)**
SAML is a protocol for securely communicating between a service provider and an identity provider. Studies Weekly uses SAML 2.0 to broker communication, securely transmit data, and validate authentication assertions. Studies Weekly can create a custom SAML consumer endpoint to which your identity provider can direct security assertions. As most schools use identity provider systems that provide links to service providers on a central dashboard or launch panel, Studies Weekly prefers to use an identity-provider-initiated one-way login assertion SAML workflow.

  * [What SSO’s are compatible with Studies Weekly Online?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5367444001307-What-SSO-s-are-compatible-with-Studies-Weekly-Online)

title: How to Access and Navigate Teacher Resources

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18411963371675-Teacher-Resources)


#  How to Access and Navigate Teacher Resources 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Each Studies Weekly Online publication has **Teacher Resources** to support educators utilizing our materials and tailor classes to meet student needs. Teacher Resources can include a Scope and Sequence, Standards Correlation, lesson plans, vocabulary lists, printables, standards, media, and additional resources. Available resources can vary from one publication to another. This article covers how to locate the **Teacher Resources** button and navigate the resources within.
The **Teacher Edition** is a PDF document that can be found within the **Teacher Resources** or a publication.
Access Navigating Teacher Resources 
Teachers can access helpful resources from the **Teacher Resources** button in the Table of Contents or while viewing content within a week.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, open the publication you wish to find resources for and select the **Teacher Resources** button from the Table of Contents. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37613913028891)
That opens the**Teacher Resources** tab within the content for the week.
From there, teachers can view different sections using the quick links or scrolling down to view available resources for the Article/Activity, Week/Lesson, Unit, and Publication.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37719024350491)
Each section can have supplemental resources available and will vary from publication to publication. (Your assigned state under **Account Settings** must match the state of the publication to view the standards.) 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37753331056283)
To preview a digital PDF, select the red PDF button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37753368152347) This also allows you to assign it via creating a Customized Content activity or sharing the link using Google Classroom.
Selecting the print option for digital PDFs, will open them in a new browser tab. For best print quality, make sure to check the boxes for **Headers and Footers** as well as **Background graphics** in your printer settings. To learn about printing, visit the [How to Print Studies Weekly Online Materials](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18385714221723-How-to-Print-Studies-Weekly-Online-Materials) article.
The **Standards Correlation** and **Scope and Sequence** are accessible in the Publication Resources section when the user's state matches the state indicated in the publication. Visit the [Scope and Sequence and Standards Correlation](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/31727978021531-Scope-and-Sequence-and-Standards-Correlation) to learn more.
Teacher Edition PDF
***** Teachers can also access the weekly Student and Teacher Edition PDFs within the Teacher Resources. The Teacher Edition PDF contains the lesson plans for the week and may also contain Answer Keys. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37719011486363)If available, buttons to open the PDFs will be shown in the same place. After selecting a PDF, it will open in a new browser tab where it can be downloaded or printed. 
The Teacher Edition and Student Edition PDFs are not always available.
Success
When viewing the Teacher Resources on a smaller screen (e.g., on a tablet or smartphone), you may need to scroll down to see the content. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Access and Navigate Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17772923416603-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-Teacher-Resources)
  * [How To Create and Access Teacher Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17315142489627-How-To-Create-and-Access-Teacher-Notes)
  * [Scope and Sequence and Standards Correlation](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/31727978021531-Scope-and-Sequence-and-Standards-Correlation)

  * [May 2024 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25618642224411-May-2024-Product-Updates)
  * [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content)
  * [How does Studies Weekly select terms to describe race or ethnicity? ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115015987607-How-does-Studies-Weekly-select-terms-to-describe-race-or-ethnicity)

#  March 2024 Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Previous and Next Sticky****Buttons in Articles**
The Previous and Next buttons along with the Play button are now at the top of articles, activities, etc. The buttons stay visible as readers scroll down the article. 
![next buttons.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24084808493595)
**Customized Content Edit Order Toggle**
Now when editing or creating Customized content, teachers can rearrange questions using the **Edit Order** toggle.
![edit order.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24111473448347)
**Hidden Join Codes**
Join Codes for Classes are now hidden on screen behind stars and increased to 8 characters when you refresh. 
To make the Join Code visible click the eye, next to the code. 
To update the code, click the Refresh button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/24543808011163)

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003-Manual-Sync-of-District-Roster#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators)


#  Manual Sync of District Roster 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
District Admins (currently using an automated rostering method with Studies Weekly Online) have the ability to request a manual sync of their district roster. This article explains the process.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, navigate to the District Overview page. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204966506651)
The District Overview page shows the current sync status which will include one of the following:
  * Successful ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30001693511067)
  * Failed ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30001693515803)
  * Manual Sync Requested ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30001668334491)
  * Sync Processing ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30001693520155)


To initiate a manual sync, select the **Request Manual Sync** hyperlink next to the Sync Status. The status will automatically update to **Manual Sync Requested**. Sync times will vary depending on the size of the district. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35204966510747)
After the sync is successful, the user accounts and classrooms are ready for use. The district admin will need to refresh their screen to see the updated rosters.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role)

  * [District Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [How to Play Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690681345947-How-to-Play-Games)


#  How to Play Misspilled 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The objective of Misspilled is for students to determine if words are spelled correctly or incorrectly. 
![Misspilled_Main.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9768354079387)
Students drag words that are spelled incorrectly to the red liquid on the left. Words that are spelled correctly should go to the green liquid on the right.
![Misspilled_Game.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9768357358235)
Students can also earn coins by completing the Misspilled vocabulary review in a certain amount of time. Students earn a gold, silver, or bronze based on how long they take to complete it. 
![Misspilled_Results.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/9768411094427)
See the [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-Coins) article for a full breakdown of how many coins a student can earn. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Earn Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6941068617627-How-to-Earn-Coins)
  * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled)

#  OneRoster API - Troubleshooting 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article covers some of our most common questions we receive from OneRoster API users. Additional questions can be directed to .
**Why isn't the student I added to the roster able to log in?**
Was the student added to the roster server and shared to Studies Weekly or were they just added to the SIS roster? Also, we sync your roster data on a nightly basis. Was the student added to the roster after last night's sync? From your admin account, can you see if the most recent sync was successful or is it showing up as failed? If your sync is failing, reach out to rostering@studiesweekly.com
**Why can't our teachers invite co-teachers into their classroom?**
Teachers, students, and classrooms created through automated rostering can only be updated through the roster. If a rostered teacher tries to invite a rostered or unrostered teacher to their rostered classroom, they will not be able to join. They will need to be added as a co-teacher of the classroom on the roster.
**Why do my students see classes in their account that aren't associated with Studies Weekly?**
Depending on the type of roster server the district is using, your district may be unable to filter out data from the SIS when we sync your roster each night. If they have the ability to, the district roster admin should filter out any teachers, students, and classrooms that aren't utilizing Studies Weekly Online.
Troubleshooting Help
If these specific questions and examples did not address your issue, please reach out to rostering@studiesweekly.com.

#  Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article provides instruction for district administration and IT in setting up a LTI 1.3/Advantage Canvas Configuration. 
Setting up Deep Linking can only be done using a paid Root Administrator Canvas account. IT administrators should already have an understanding of navigating Canvas before proceeding. 
**Developer Keys (Part 1)**
Starting on the **Admin** tab inside of Canvas, select **Studies Weekly** , then **Developer Keys**.
On the next screen under **Account** , choose **Developer Key** , then **LTI Key**.
![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXdV6pSqbjfhgk3qF5Q9_xvVyhP42ciZFaWJM1eJkUH6A4dAJmkNVfUYboMSKG3OJLNl3jbwJXDwkdTKz8NGVgjSuXta_WXQh5CFRgLJk_0gw1gdXI1_qDiON-WxXo2AhbD1B3uLzhpNSB9cFN15T4h1fGzE?key=K90_U2JJ2tbiLHriNQJC8g)
You will revisit Developer Keys after completing the Key Settings.
**Key Settings**
It is important to use the correct Key Settings, so we recommend you copy and paste the following links. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28415562663323)
    1. **Key Name** : Studies Weekly.
    2. **Redirect URLs** : 
       * https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3
       * https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/register
       * https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/jwks
       * https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/login
       * https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/launch
       * httphttps://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/deeplink
    3. **Method:** Manual Entry. 
    4. **Title** : Studies Weekly LTI 1.3/Advantage
    5. **Description** : Studies Weekly LTI 1.3/Advantage
    6. **Target Link URL** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/launch
    7. **OpenID Connect Initiation URL** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/login
    8. **JWK Method** : Public JWK URL
    9. **Public JWK URL** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/jwks
    10. **LTI Advantage Services** : Turn on the first five options. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28239418185243)


**Additional Key Settings**
Under Additional Settings, set the **Privacy Level** to **Public**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28414422113947)
#### **Placements**
You can specify where to place Studies Weekly Online links in Canvas using the Placements dropdown menu. Canvas will include a corresponding configuration section for each placement you add. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37262168297883)
If you select **Course Navigatio** n as your placement use the following links:
  * **Target Link URI** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/launch
  * **Icon URL** : https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/img/icons/sm-coin-icon-classes.png


If you select **Link Selection** as your placement use the following links:
  * **Target Link URI** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/deeplink
  * **Icon URL** : https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/img/icons/sm-coin-icon-classes.png


If you select **Assignment Selection** as your placement use the following links:
  * **Target Link URL** : https://online-api.studiesweekly.com/lti/v1p3/deeplink
  * **Icon URL** : https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/online/img/icons/sm-coin-icon-classes.png


If you select**Link Selection** or **Assignment Selection** the **Message Type** must be set to **LtiDeepLinkingRequest**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37262168305307)
Save your **Key Settings** in the bottom right corner, to return the the Developer Keys.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28415367883163)
**Developer Keys (Part 2)**
Canvas Courses require a Client Id number for Deep Linking. Studies Weekly will need to register your Client ID number before you can link it to your courses. To start using the number, adjust the **State** toggle from OFF to **ON**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35623200282779)
Copy the **Client ID** number to install (paste) it in a Canvas Course. Proceed to **Deployment ID Settings** steps to paste the copied **Client ID**.
**Deployment ID Settings**
To select the Course you wish to add the Client ID, navigate to **Admin** > **Settings** > **Apps** > **View App Configurations**.
Next, you will need to add the Client ID. Start by selecting **+App**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34228035679387)
  1. In the modal, select **By Client ID** from the dropdown.
  2. Paste the Client ID number in the **Client ID** field.
  3. Click **Submit**.


#### ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35623654481307)
Lastly, you will select **Install**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35623654483867)
#### The Developer Key will now appear as an External App.
From here you will go to the **Settings** gear and choose **Deployment Id**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28442531208731)
Important
You will need to register with Studies Weekly by sending an email to . The following information will need shared to complete your registration. 
  * **Platform Id** : https://canvas.instructure.com
  * **Client Id** : steps can be found above.
  * **Deployment Id** : steps can be found above. 
  * **Message Type** must be set to **LtiDeepLinkingRequest**


Once you have registration confirmation from Studies Weekly the process is complete. Teachers are then able to add Studies Weekly links into Canvas. 
Visit the Help Center article [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher) for additional information.
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen)
  * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors)
  * [Google Class Access Restricted by Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35774800816155-Google-Class-Access-Restricted-by-Administrator)
  * [Technical Requirements](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements)
  * [Hardware FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317432328091-Hardware-FAQs)
  * [Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Which-websites-does-my-IT-department-need-to-whitelist)
  * [Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27915488755227-Setting-Up-LTI-Deep-Linking-with-Canvas-for-your-District)
  * [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher)

  3. [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports)


#  How to Use the Assessment Score Report 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The Assessment Score report shows the average score for weekly assessments created by Studies Weekly Online, for all students in the classroom for the selected publication.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click**Reports**.
  2. Click **As****sessment Score** , select a publication.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35200992850843)
**A**. Use the dropdown to change the publication.
**B**. The **Submission Date** dropdown allows teachers to filter student scores. The default view is All.
**C**. Select the **Print** or **Export CSV** button to save or share the report. 
**D**. Hover over each bar to see the average score of the class.
Teachers can also click a score bar for a week to view a graph of individual student scores and the average class score.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35168662708635)
Hover over a student score bar to see the student’s percentage. Click on a student score bar to be taken to the assessment grade page.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35168662709915)
To learn about other reports, see the [Reports](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647354289435-Reports) section of the Help Center.

  3. [Interested in a Free 60 Day Trial?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24195173349275-Interested-in-a-Free-60-Day-Trial)


#  How to Start Your Free Online Trial 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can get the full Studies Weekly Online experience for **60 days** —free of charge! The Studies Weekly Online platform includes lesson plans, games, virtual field trips, highlighting/note taking, science lab videos, thousands of primary sources, and more.
New Users Existing Users
To create a free trial account, go to [online.studiesweekly.com/trial.](https://online.studiesweekly.com/trial)
  1. Fill in the requested information.
  2. Click **Request Account**.
  3. You will receive an email with the instructions to complete the signup process. You may need to check your spam.


See the[ **Getting Started** section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started) of the[ Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us) to learn about the many features available to teachers including[ instructions for using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online).
Users with existing accounts can also request a 60-day trial to view additional publications and resources.
Trial publications must be assigned to a classroom. You can use an existing classroom or create a new one.
  1. If you have not yet created a classroom visit the [How to Create A Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom) article then continue to step 2 and add trial publications.
  2. Select **View All Publications** to view the available publications. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32536614286747)
  3. Select **Start 60 Day Trial**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32535405835035)
  4. Select the publications you wish to trail and then select**Add** to view their content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/32535431560219)


Student Data
Any student progress completed during the trial period will remain with the classroom. To view progress after the trial period, the publication must be purchased. 
Important
Homeschoolers cannot do free trials of the curriculum, so please order your product before creating an online account.
To test out our printed publications, visit the [How to Request a Sample](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003413174-How-to-Request-a-Sample) article. 
If you have any questions, contact us at **(866) 311-8734.**
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Start Your Free Online Trial](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002948094-How-to-Start-Your-Free-Online-Trial)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002738242715-Technology)
  3. [Technology](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5661909188635-Technology)


#  How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online content can be embedded in both Canvas and Schoology LMSs using deep linking. Deep linking uses a hyperlink to connect the user directly to a piece of web content, like a specific Studies Weekly Assessment. To access deep linking, a paid Root Administrator must first set it up. Contact your administrator or district IT for help.
From the district LMS, teachers will start the **Deeplink Selection Mode**. This sends an LTI message that informs Studies Weekly Online that teachers are entering our site and it will automatically launch. Adjust the window size to ensure visibility, then navigate to the content you want to share. 
All content, including Customized Content, Explore More Media, and Search results, can be shared with deep linking. 
**Deeplink Selection Mode from Canvas**
Teachers should already have an understanding of navigating Canvas before proceeding. When following the steps in Canvas to deep link an Assignment or Module, be sure to set the Submission Type as**External Tool.**
  * Choose **Studies Weekly** (Studies Weekly LTI 1.3/Advantage), then click **Select** to choose the Studies Weekly content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299770011)
  * Studies Weekly Online will open in a pop-up module. Navigate to the desired content page and select **Click to Share Deeplink**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299771803)
  * Then the Configure External Tool modal will appear, choose **Select** to insert the Studies weekly link into your Canvas Assignment.
  * Follow the remaining steps in Canvas to **Save and Publish**.


**Deeplink Selection Mode from Schoology**
Teachers should already have an understanding of navigating Schoology before proceeding. When following the steps in Schoology to deep link, navigate to the Materials tab and select **Add Material**. 
From the dropdown menu, select **Studies Weekly LTI Advantage (LTI v1p3)**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299776283)
Follow the remaining steps to choose Studies Weekly Online content and Schoology to **Save**. 
Note
If you do not see Studies Weekly LTI available in the menu, please reach out to your IT administrator for additional support.
Important
These steps may look different in other LMSs.
### Articles in this section
  * [How does Studies Weekly Online look on a smaller screen?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen)

Deep linking uses a hyperlink to connect the user directly to a piece of web content, like a specific Studies Weekly Assessment. To access deep linking, a paid Root Administrator must first set it up. Contact your administrator or district IT for help. From the district LMS, teachers will start the **Deeplink Selection Mode**. This sends an LTI message that informs Studies Weekly Online that teachers are entering our site and it will automatically launch. Adjust the window size to ensure visibility, then navigate to the content you want to share. All content, including Customized Content, Explore More Media, and Search results, can be shared with deep linking. **Deeplink Selection Mode from Canvas** Teachers should already have an understanding of navigating Canvas before proceeding. When following the steps in Canvas to deep link an Assignment or Module, be sure to set the Submission Type as**External Tool.** * Choose **Studies Weekly** (Studies Weekly LTI 1.3/Advantage), then click **Select** to choose the Studies Weekly content. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299770011) * Studies Weekly Online will open in a pop-up module. Navigate to the desired content page and select **Click to Share Deeplink**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299771803) * Then the Configure External Tool modal will appear, choose **Select** to insert the Studies weekly link into your Canvas Assignment. * Follow the remaining steps in Canvas to **Save and Publish**. **Deeplink Selection Mode from Schoology** Teachers should already have an understanding of navigating Schoology before proceeding. When following the steps in Schoology to deep link, navigate to the Materials tab and select **Add Material**. From the dropdown menu, select **Studies Weekly LTI Advantage (LTI v1p3)**. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35622299776283) Follow the remaining steps to choose Studies Weekly Online content and Schoology to **Save**. Note If you do not see Studies Weekly LTI available in the menu, please reach out to your IT administrator for additional support. Important These steps may look different in other LMSs. Articles in this section * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10585144592411-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Online-look-on-a-smaller-screen) * [How to Troubleshoot Video Errors](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360010522053-How-to-Troubleshoot-Video-Errors) * [Google Class Access Restricted by Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/35774800816155-Google-Class-Access-Restricted-by-Administrator) * [Technical Requirements](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317844438043-Technical-Requirements) * [Hardware FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317432328091-Hardware-FAQs) * [Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317557274779-Which-websites-does-my-IT-department-need-to-whitelist) * [Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27915488755227-Setting-Up-LTI-Deep-Linking-with-Canvas-for-your-District) * [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher) Recently viewed articles * [How to Start Your Free Online Trial](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002948094-How-to-Start-Your-Free-Online-Trial) * [How to Use the Assessment Score Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470501549467-How-to-Use-the-Assessment-Score-Report) * [Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27915488755227-Setting-Up-LTI-Deep-Linking-with-Canvas-for-your-District) * [OneRoster API - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13383443801371-OneRoster-API-Troubleshooting) * [How to Play Misspilled](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326979729435-How-to-Play-Misspilled)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Reorder/Move Units, Weeks & Articles 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can reorder the Weeks or content within the week in two ways
**Drag and Drop Weeks & Articles in the Table of Contents**
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Go to the **Table of Contents** page of a publication. 
  2. Click and drag the **Move** button next to the Week or content you would like to move.
  3. Release **Move** button once the Week or content is in the desired position. Repeat until all the content is in the order you prefer.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638465917083)


**Move a Week to another unit**
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Go to the **Table of Contents** page of a publication.
  2. Click the **Manage Content** button to the right of the Week you wish to move.
  3. Select **Move Week**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638465919131)
  4. In the pop-up, select the unit you want to move the week to.
  5. Use the **Placement** dropdown to place it before or after a selected week.
  6. Click **Move** to complete the action. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554447559707)


**Revert to the Default Order**
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Go to the **Manage Publication** button above the publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554386207131)
  2. Select the **Revert to Default** button to restore back to the original layout. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638487630747)
  3. Confirm your choice with the **Cancel** or **Continue** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37554452649883)

title: Rostering - ClassLink FAQs
meta_description: Click through the tabs below to see answers to commonly asked questions in regard to rostering with ClassLink.   Is there a cost...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [ClassLink](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690817293339-ClassLink)


#  Rostering - ClassLink FAQs 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Click through the tabs below to see answers to commonly asked questions in regard to rostering with ClassLink.
**Is there a cost associated with rostering through ClassLink?**
Studies Weekly does not charge districts to roster with ClassLink. However, as with other third-party rostering services, we require that publications be purchased for your students and teachers so they can fully utilize Studies Weekly Online.
**Can non-teacher staff and administrator accounts be created through ClassLink rostering?**
Yes, Studies Weekly Online does support staff and administrators shared through the ClassLink roster. Users with the "administrator" role in your OneRoster data will be given the [District Administrator](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003) role in Studies Weekly Online.
Users with the "Aide" or "Proctor" roles in the OneRoster data are assigned to standard teacher accounts in Studies Weekly Online.
**Which Studies Weekly SSO application should I download from the Global Application Library in ClassLink?**
The Studies Weekly Online 3.0 Oauth2 application, with the blue Studies Weekly logo, is our most up-to-date SSO application.
**What will happen to our existing accounts?**
**If you are already using an automated rostering integration with Studies Weekly** , then Studies Weekly Online will determine account continuity based on the sourcedId and email fields of your shared OneRoster user records. If the user has the same email OR sourcedId in their new ClassLink OneRoster record as in their already existing record, then the ClassLink rostering integration will seamlessly merge into the existing account. If both the sourcedId and email fields for the new record are different, a new account will be created for the user, and the old account will be disabled.
**If you are not using an automated rostering integration with Studies Weekly,** then account continuity is solely based off of the email of the existing account. If the new OneRoster record's email matches the existing email, then the ClassLink account will be merged into the existing account. Otherwise, a new account will be created. Any existing accounts not matching an email from the OneRoster records will not be affected.
**Will existing data merge to new accounts?**
Existing data will merge into new accounts if the account has a matching email OR sourcedID. If not, then the new account will not retain any data from the old account.
**How do non-teacher accounts get created, and how will those users log in?**
Studies Weekly accommodates non-primary teachers enrolled in additional classrooms in your OneRoster records. The additional teachers will have the same access to the classroom as the primary teacher. OneRoster aides and proctors are given the teacher role in Studies Weekly Online. OneRoster administrators are given the "district administrator" role in Studies Weekly Online. Non-admin users must be enrolled in the class they wish to access in Studies Weekly Online. If they do not have an enrollment record for the class, it will not be accessible from their account. Even if they are not enrolled in any rostered classes, your users can access Studies Weekly Online and manually create a test classroom to access the online publications.
Rostered users will sign in to Studies Weekly Online either by entering from the SWO 3.0 Application within ClassLink or using the "LOG IN WITH CLASSLINK" button on our login page. Users with manually created accounts will have to sign in using their credentials at the standard login page.
**When should we begin this process to be ready for activation?**
Once your district has added the Studies Weekly Online application to ClassLink and enabled roster sharing, we can change your roster configuration to use ClassLink and sync the new data immediately. This can be done at any time, but we recommend that it be done at least a week before the accounts and classrooms are needed so that we can make sure that everything is working without issue.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering - ClassLink FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs)
  * [ClassLink - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13280645120027-ClassLink-Pros-and-Cons)
  * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting)

The additional teachers will have the same access to the classroom as the primary teacher. OneRoster aides and proctors are given the teacher role in Studies Weekly Online. OneRoster administrators are given the "district administrator" role in Studies Weekly Online. Non-admin users must be enrolled in the class they wish to access in Studies Weekly Online. If they do not have an enrollment record for the class, it will not be accessible from their account. Even if they are not enrolled in any rostered classes, your users can access Studies Weekly Online and manually create a test classroom to access the online publications. Rostered users will sign in to Studies Weekly Online either by entering from the SWO 3.0 Application within ClassLink or using the "LOG IN WITH CLASSLINK" button on our login page. Users with manually created accounts will have to sign in using their credentials at the standard login page. **When should we begin this process to be ready for activation?** Once your district has added the Studies Weekly Online application to ClassLink and enabled roster sharing, we can change your roster configuration to use ClassLink and sync the new data immediately. This can be done at any time, but we recommend that it be done at least a week before the accounts and classrooms are needed so that we can make sure that everything is working without issue. Articles in this section * [Rostering - ClassLink FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs) * [ClassLink - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13280645120027-ClassLink-Pros-and-Cons) * [ClassLink - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13360655234971-ClassLink-Troubleshooting) Recently viewed articles * [How to Reorder/Move Units, Weeks & Articles](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326817250203-How-to-Reorder-Move-Units-Weeks-Articles) * [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher) * [How to Start Your Free Online Trial](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002948094-How-to-Start-Your-Free-Online-Trial) * [How to Use the Assessment Score Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470501549467-How-to-Use-the-Assessment-Score-Report) * [Setting Up LTI Deep Linking with Canvas for your District](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27915488755227-Setting-Up-LTI-Deep-Linking-with-Canvas-for-your-District)

#  Studies Weekly Online Student Artifacts 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online has compiled a robust collection of **Student Artifacts.** Teachers can use these artifacts to show students examples of how to complete the printable assignments within Studies Weekly Online.
To access this collection, from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account: 
  1. Click the **Training and Resources** tab. 
  2. Click **Resources****.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979128754971)**
  3. Scroll down until you see the **Student Artifacts** section. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979128766747)
  4. Click a PDF to open it in a new tab. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26979128774427)


Additionally, check out this video for incorporating **Student Artifacts** : [![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38372735027483)](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/marketing/Videos/Student+Artifacts+\(Instructional+Strategies+Series\).mp4)
To learn about additional resources, visit the [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).

#  User Session Timeout 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online will automatically log out users after they have been logged in for 8 hours. This includes all Studies Weekly Online accounts.
A pop-up window will notify the user their session is about to expire. If the user does not click **Continue** within five minutes, they will be logged out. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37861531986331)
The user will be redirected to the log in page, with the message their session has expired. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37861500502683)

title: Understanding Question Types
meta_description: There are many question types that students may encounter while navigating Studies Weekly Online. Teachers may use these question types...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [General FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510676842651-General-FAQs)


#  Understanding Question Types 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
There are many question types that students may encounter while navigating Studies Weekly Online. Teachers may use these question types while creating Customized Content. The options below will provide an explanation of the item types. 
If you are new to creating Customized Content, please review the following articles before proceeding. [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page) and [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content).
To see the 5 categories of question types, select the **+****Add** button from the Create Customized Content page,
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583473179)
All question types have the same formatting options representing. Bold, Italic, Underline, Heading, Bullet Points, Numbered List, Undo, Redo, Add an Image.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583476891)
**Read more info about uploading an image in the tab of this article titled Upload Images.**
Question Item Digital Printable Question Bank  Add Previously Created Customized Content Upload Images
Question type options are automatically graded by Studies Weekly Online when the students submit their responses, with the exception of Open Response, Grouping, and Drawing Tool.
  * **True or False** questions are used to determine whether a student can identify if a statement is true or false.
  * **Open Response** is used to ask students to respond with a written answer. These questions must be graded by a teacher, and instructions for grading can be found in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article.
  * **Sorting** questions are a great option for questions where the answers need to be in a particular order such as a timeline of events or sequence of scientific steps.
  * **Numeric** questions allow teachers to add a math problem.
  * **Multiple Choice** are the most commonly found question type throughout the program. To create your own, you will need to create at least two preset answer options to save your question. Otherwise, you can add as many answer options as you would like. 
  * **Fill In the Blank** / **Inline Choice** questions are statements that require students to fill in a blank space by choosing the correct answer from a **Dropdown** list, **Text Answer** , or write an **Open-Ended Response**. These questions can have varying levels of difficulty for all development levels. There should be a clear correct and incorrect choice to eliminate guessing, providing accurate representations of student understanding. 
  * **Grouping** questions are ideal for Venn Diagrams and require students to drag and drop answers into the correct group. 
  * **Hot Spot** questions require students to click a specific part or parts of an image to answer a question. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15527064098075-Hot-Spot-Question-Type).
  * **Hot Text** requires students to click a specific part or parts of a text to answer a question. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type).
  * **Check All That Apply** / **Multiselect** are similar to Multiple Choice except students can select more than one answer. These questions require possible selections to be absolutely true or absolutely false. This option would be ideal in situations like asking students to identify which animals are carnivores or which presidents served 2 terms.
  * **Matching** questions are engaging and require students to pair images or statements in one column to images or statements in another column. For instance, students can match animals with their natural habitats or dates with important historical events. 
  * **Labeling** questions require students to drag and drop text labels onto different parts of an image. These are especially useful for science and geography images.
  * **Drawing Tool** allows teachers to use a Studies Weekly image, a blank canvas, or upload their own image (coming soon). Students will reply to the prompt using a digital pen, paint brushes, and other tools. These questions must be graded by a teacher. Instructions for grading can be found in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article.


Select**Item** from the category list to open the modal to select the question type you want to add:
  * **Text** allows you to add any passage you would like your students to read. You can also attach an image and bullet points using the formatting options. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) 
  * **Crosswords** are a fun way to incorporate vocabulary terms. A minimum of three terms are required to create a Crossword. 
  * **Article** allows teachers to attach any Studies Weekly Online Article as Customized Content. This is ideal when you want students to highlight specific parts in the text or come to class ready to discuss what they read. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) Teachers can edit text and remove images within the Article Block modal before saving. 
  * **External Resources** allows teachers to share external resources as Customized Content. Some examples include publicly available internet videos, images, and other sites that do not require a login. External uploads will have a name credit under the image and display as Uploaded by [Last Name].
  * **Media** gives teachers the option to include a Studies Weekly Online image, audio recording, video, or document. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) See also the Upload Images tab.
  * **Lesson Walkthroughs** can be added as Customized Content for students to have quick access to media or text from Studies Weekly Lesson Walkthroughs.


Teachers must select **Confirm** to create a copy of the original Studies Weekly Online content before making changes. Then follow the onscreen steps to create their Customized content.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583479707)
Digital Printables allow students to interact with a printable created by Studies Weekly. Students will be able to do the following:
  * Free draw with a pen, brush, or highlighter (with color options).
  * Add basic shapes (with color and size options).
  * Add text (with font, color, and size options).
  * Highlight (with color options).
  * Earn coins.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592638235)
For detailed instructions visit the [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type) article.
Teachers can save time and take advantage of questions already created inside of Studies Weekly Online publications by creating Customized Content using our **Question Bank**. This is a great option for pre and post testing students for understanding. 
Follow the initial steps in the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article, then from the **Add** button, select **Question Bank**. 
  1. Choose the publication. More than one publication can be used 
  2. Select the Unit or Week.
  3. Apply (optional) filters to display All, Articles, Activities, or Assessments.
  4. **Select All Checkbox** will insert all of the questions into your Customized Content.
  5. Select individual checkboxes next to questions you want to add or remove (these can be edited later using the red **X**).
  6. Click **Add** to save your questions. Or, if you want to add additional questions from a second source, hold off and selecting **Add**. Instead from here, choose a new publication, or area in the Table of Contents dropdown. Your progress will not be lost.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963600679707)
**Point Value** and **Color** options can be adjusted before your final **Save.**
This feature allows teachers to retrieve Customized Content they previously created in a different classroom or content a co-teacher has created in a shared classroom. 
This can be accomplished several ways. To explore each option visit the [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content) article.
Teachers can add or upload images from their device into their Customized Content. There are 2 ways to make this happen.
  1. Using the **Add Image** button in the formatting options of all question types to upload/add an image within the Question box. 
Type your text in the box first, then add/upload your image with the **Add Image** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592665627)
  2. Use the image option within specific question types to add an image students can interact with. Select the **Add Image** button and follow the on screen prompts. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592671643)These question types include: 
     *        * Hot Spot (found under Question)
       * Labeling (found under Question)
       * Drawing (found under Question)
       * Media (found under Item)


When choosing the **Upload** option, teachers are required to check the box confirming the image complies with district policies. Once checked the **Next** button becomes available. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30900991993115)**
The teacher's last name will be shown below the image as **Uploaded by Last Name.** Teachers can optionally add an **Image Credit Label** (pictured above and below) when uploading the media. the label will appear under the image and be visible to students.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30900967970459).
### Articles in this section
  * [Article Comprehension Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23813451785115-Article-Comprehension-Questions)
  * [Understanding Question Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types)
  * [User Session Timeout](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13497468080923-User-Session-Timeout)
  * [Legacy Science FAQ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/11083859674651-Legacy-Science-FAQ)
  * [How does Studies Weekly Handle Closed Captioning?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011815154-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Handle-Closed-Captioning)


## Recently viewed articles
