cleaned_markdown: Articles : Understanding-Question-Types . What can we help you with? 1. (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us) 2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs) 3. [General FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510676842651-General-FAQs) Understanding Question Types FollowNot yet followed by anyone There are many question types that students may encounter while navigating Studies Weekly Online. Teachers may use these question types while creating Customized Content. The options below will provide an explanation of the item types. If you are new to creating Customized Content, please review the following articles before proceeding. [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page) and [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content). To see the 5 categories of question types, select the **+****Add** button from the Create Customized Content page, ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583473179) All question types have the same formatting options representing. Bold, Italic, Underline, Heading, Bullet Points, Numbered List, Undo, Redo, Add an Image. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583476891) **Read more info about uploading an image in the tab of this article titled Upload Images.** Question Item Digital Printable Question Bank Add Previously Created Customized Content Upload Images Question type options are automatically graded by Studies Weekly Online when the students submit their responses, with the exception of Open Response, Grouping, and Drawing Tool. * **True or False** questions are used to determine whether a student can identify if a statement is true or false. * **Open Response** is used to ask students to respond with a written answer. These questions must be graded by a teacher, and instructions for grading can be found in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article. * **Sorting** questions are a great option for questions where the answers need to be in a particular order such as a timeline of events or sequence of scientific steps. * **Numeric** questions allow teachers to add a math problem. * **Multiple Choice** are the most commonly found question type throughout the program. To create your own, you will need to create at least two preset answer options to save your question. Otherwise, you can add as many answer options as you would like. * **Fill In the Blank** / **Inline Choice** questions are statements that require students to fill in a blank space by choosing the correct answer from a **Dropdown** list, **Text Answer** , or write an **Open-Ended Response**. These questions can have varying levels of difficulty for all development levels. There should be a clear correct and incorrect choice to eliminate guessing, providing accurate representations of student understanding. * **Grouping** questions are ideal for Venn Diagrams and require students to drag and drop answers into the correct group. * **Hot Spot** questions require students to click a specific part or parts of an image to answer a question. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15527064098075-Hot-Spot-Question-Type). * **Hot Text** requires students to click a specific part or parts of a text to answer a question. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type). * **Check All That Apply** / **Multiselect** are similar to Multiple Choice except students can select more than one answer. These questions require possible selections to be absolutely true or absolutely false. This option would be ideal in situations like asking students to identify which animals are carnivores or which presidents served 2 terms. * **Matching** questions are engaging and require students to pair images or statements in one column to images or statements in another column. For instance, students can match animals with their natural habitats or dates with important historical events. * **Labeling** questions require students to drag and drop text labels onto different parts of an image. These are especially useful for science and geography images. * **Drawing Tool** allows teachers to use a Studies Weekly image, a blank canvas, or upload their own image (coming soon). Students will reply to the prompt using a digital pen, paint brushes, and other tools. These questions must be graded by a teacher. Instructions for grading can be found in the [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section) article. Select**Item** from the category list to open the modal to select the question type you want to add: * **Text** allows you to add any passage you would like your students to read. You can also attach an image and bullet points using the formatting options. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) * **Crosswords** are a fun way to incorporate vocabulary terms. A minimum of three terms are required to create a Crossword. * **Article** allows teachers to attach any Studies Weekly Online Article as Customized Content. This is ideal when you want students to highlight specific parts in the text or come to class ready to discuss what they read. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) Teachers can edit text and remove images within the Article Block modal before saving. * **External Resources** allows teachers to share external resources as Customized Content. Some examples include publicly available internet videos, images, and other sites that do not require a login. External uploads will have a name credit under the image and display as Uploaded by [Last Name]. * **Media** gives teachers the option to include a Studies Weekly Online image, audio recording, video, or document. (This item type will not allow students to earn coins.) See also the Upload Images tab. * **Lesson Walkthroughs** can be added as Customized Content for students to have quick access to media or text from Studies Weekly Lesson Walkthroughs. Teachers must select **Confirm** to create a copy of the original Studies Weekly Online content before making changes. Then follow the onscreen steps to create their Customized content.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34942583479707) Digital Printables allow students to interact with a printable created by Studies Weekly. Students will be able to do the following: * Free draw with a pen, brush, or highlighter (with color options). * Add basic shapes (with color and size options). * Add text (with font, color, and size options). * Highlight (with color options). * Earn coins. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592638235) For detailed instructions visit the [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type) article. Teachers can save time and take advantage of questions already created inside of Studies Weekly Online publications by creating Customized Content using our **Question Bank**. This is a great option for pre and post testing students for understanding. Follow the initial steps in the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article, then from the **Add** button, select **Question Bank**. 1. Choose the publication. More than one publication can be used 2. Select the Unit or Week. 3. Apply (optional) filters to display All, Articles, Activities, or Assessments. 4. **Select All Checkbox** will insert all of the questions into your Customized Content. 5. Select individual checkboxes next to questions you want to add or remove (these can be edited later using the red **X**). 6. Click **Add** to save your questions. Or, if you want to add additional questions from a second source, hold off and selecting **Add**. Instead from here, choose a new publication, or area in the Table of Contents dropdown. Your progress will not be lost. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963600679707) **Point Value** and **Color** options can be adjusted before your final **Save.** This feature allows teachers to retrieve Customized Content they previously created in a different classroom or content a co-teacher has created in a shared classroom. This can be accomplished several ways. To explore each option visit the [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content) article. Teachers can add or upload images from their device into their Customized Content. There are 2 ways to make this happen. 1. Using the **Add Image** button in the formatting options of all question types to upload/add an image within the Question box. Type your text in the box first, then add/upload your image with the **Add Image** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592665627) 2. Use the image option within specific question types to add an image students can interact with. Select the **Add Image** button and follow the on screen prompts. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31963592671643)These question types include: * * Hot Spot (found under Question) * Labeling (found under Question) * Drawing (found under Question) * Media (found under Item) When choosing the **Upload** option, teachers are required to check the box confirming the image complies with district policies. Once checked the **Next** button becomes available. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30900991993115)** The teacher's last name will be shown below the image as **Uploaded by Last Name.** Teachers can optionally add an **Image Credit Label** (pictured above and below) when uploading the media. the label will appear under the image and be visible to students. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30900967970459). Articles in this section * [Article Comprehension Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23813451785115-Article-Comprehension-Questions) * [Understanding Question Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587-Understanding-Question-Types) * [User Session Timeout](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13497468080923-User-Session-Timeout) * [Legacy Science FAQ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/11083859674651-Legacy-Science-FAQ) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011815154-How-does-Studies-Weekly-Handle-Closed-Captioning) Recently viewed articles * [User Session Timeout](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13497468080923-User-Session-Timeout) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17283150237467-Studies-Weekly-Online-Student-Artifacts) * [Rostering - ClassLink FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13113833386011-Rostering-ClassLink-FAQs) * [How to Reorder/Move Units, Weeks & Articles](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6326817250203-How-to-Reorder-Move-Units-Weeks-Articles) * [How to Use LMS Deep Linking as a Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12119671301019-How-to-Use-LMS-Deep-Linking-as-a-Teacher)

#  Google Class Access Restricted by Administrator 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This error indicates your Google Workspace administrator has restricted access to certain applications including Studies Weekly Online.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/35774800810523)
Google Workspace administrators can allow access to our app with the following steps:
  * Visit the Google Admin Console: 
  * Navigate to: **Security** > **API Controls** > **App Access Control**
  * Click **Add Ap** > **OAuth Client ID:**
  * Mark the app as:**Trusted**
  * Save the changes


Our application requests access to the following Google Classroom scopes to provide classroom-linked features:

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002692818075-Student-Experience)
  3. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5651306494619-Student-Experience)


#  Navigating Student Notes 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students can quickly access their notes and highlights in assigned publications. The **Notes** tab will include saved highlights (in the students selected color) and any notes they typed and saved within the publication.
There are two ways students can access their saved Notes.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, click the **Notes** button under the name of the classroom you wish to enter. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31267748994971)
In Notes, students will be able to select the following items: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38793607784475)
  1. **Publication Dropdown:** Switch between assigned publications. If a student only has one publication assigned, they will not be able to use this feature. If a student did not create highlights or notes, they will see “There are no highlights or notes for this publication.” ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14014171463963)
  2. **Search bar:** Search highlighted text and annotations made by the student.
  3. **Filter by Unit or Week** : The default view is the entire publication, but students can use the filters to jump to a specific unit or week within the selected publication.
  4. **Article, Week and Unit Labels:** Hyperlinks will take the student to that part of the publication in their current classroom. There students can edit, delete, or create new notes and highlights.
  5. **Print button** : A printer friendly version of the student's highlights and notes.


Note
Teachers may wish to view this feature as a student. To do so, teachers will click on the **Student View** of a publication. For steps on how to login as a student, view the **Individual Student Actions** section of the [How to Navigate the People Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page) article.
To learn how to create highlights and notes, view the [How To Use the Highlighting Tool](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard)
  * [How To View Weekly Progress](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6327022232219-How-To-View-Weekly-Progress)
  * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores)
  * [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes)
  * [Navigating Student Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How To Share a Classroom 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can share a manually created classroom by adding co-teachers to it. 
Co-teachers will have the same level of access and permissions as primary teachers. This includes being able to change the week order, week visibility, and manage all aspects of the classroom. Co-teachers can also modify, grade, and change the availability for weekly assessments, Customized Content, and vocabulary reviews. Co-teachers _cannot_ remove other teachers or archive the classroom.
Notes
  * This feature was not designed for setting up other teacher accounts for a school. If you need help with setting up an entire school or district, please contact .
  * This feature is not available for classrooms created by the rostering process. Contact your district's IT department if it is necessary for another teacher to have access to your classroom. 


From your[ Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click **People**.
  2. Click the **Invite Teacher to Classroom** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30679673123355)
  3. A pop-up will open asking for the teacher's email address.
  4. Enter the information, then click the FERPA check box.
  5. Click **Invite**.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30679683845147)


The invited teacher’s email address will appear under the Teacher’s section on the People page. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30679673130395)
The teacher will receive an email invitation to your classroom. Once the teacher has clicked the email link to accept the invitation, they will be logged in. The system will ask them to choose a password if they do not already have one.
The teacher will be taken to the **Classes** page and asked to **Decline** or **Accep** t the invitation. Once they accept, the shared class will be added to their online account.

  * [How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5996010056987-How-to-Generate-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Share a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Classroom)

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [People](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647328571035-People)


#  How to Navigate the People Page 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The People page is where teachers can manage other teacher and student accounts that have access to the classroom.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** , select **People**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36181506270235)
The People page is divided into two sections. Learn how to navigate the **Teachers** and **Students** sections, by clicking the tabs below.
Teachers Students
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36181511405083)
**A**. **Invite Teacher to the Classroom** : Add a co-teacher to your classroom. 
**B**. **Bulk Actions:** Add Coins or Remove the teachers in bulk.
**C.** **Find Teacher** : Search for an assigned teacher in the current classroom.
**D**. **Sort by** : Sort the teacher list by first name, last name, or username.
**E**. **Teacher Actions** : Add Coins or Remove individual teachers from accessing the classroom.
Recommendation
Co-teachers will have the same level of access and permissions as primary teachers. This includes being able to change the week order, week visibility, and manage all aspects of the classroom. Co-teachers can also modify, grade, and change the availability for Weekly Assessments, Customized Content, and all content. See more details in the [How to Share a Class](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Class) article.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36181511407003)
**A**. **Three Dots Kebab Menu** :
  *     *       * **Transfer Student : Bring a student into the classroom by entering their username and password.**
      * **Import Google Classroom Students** : Import students directly from your Google Classroom. 
      * **Create Multiple Students:** Type in a list of student names and the username/password will be created for you.
      * **Import Student** : Import your students from last year.
      * **Import Students (CSV)** : Import a spreadsheet with student names, usernames, and passwords.
      * **Move Students** : Move students individually or in bulk to a different classroom.
      * **Print Students’ Information** : [Print cards](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords) or a list with student usernames and passwords.
      * **Generate Student Join Codes** : Enter the number of student accounts you’d like, then print directions for students to create their accounts. 


**B. Create a new student:** Enter a student’s first and last name, username, and password to create their account and add them to the classroom.
**C. Bulk Actions** : Turn OFF/ON features in bulk or Drop more than one student at a time. Boxes can be individually deselected during Bulk Actions. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36181506277275)
**D**. **Find a Student** : Search the list of students in the current classroom.
**E**. **Sort by** : Sort the student list by first name, last name, or username.
**F**. Quick access to **OFF/ON** features including Accessibility, Crossword Word Bank, Vocabulary Definitions, Time Delay for article questions, and the Audio Reader.
**G**. **Individual Student Actions** :
  *     *       * **Edit** : Change a student’s credentials, add a [Family Email](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard), and toggle additional features on or off. This includes [Accessibility](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online), [Crossword Word Bank](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277602741147-How-to-Navigate-Crossword-and-Misspilled-Vocabulary-Reviews), [Vocabulary Definitions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860287573531-How-To-Use-the-Highlighting-Tool), [Time Delay for article questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay) and [Audio Reader](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader)[.](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6163155576475-How-to-Use-the-Audio-Reader) Student accounts that were created by Simple CSV, Clever, and One Roster will show Rostered N/A for the Password and cannot be edited.
      * **Log In As** : Log in as the student.
      * **Add Coins** : Award coins to a student and add an optional note.
      * **Drop** : Remove a student so they can’t access the classroom. Dropped students can be viewed by clicking on the **DROPPED STUDENTS** tab. Students can be recovered after being dropped.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36181506279067)


Recommendation
Teachers can also apply bulk actions to multiple students at once. Visit the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article. 
If Accessibility tools need enabled for individual students, you can learn more in the [How to Use Accessibility Tools in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the People Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page)
  * [How to Add Students to Your Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom)
  * [How To Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts)
  * [How to Generate Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5996010056987-How-to-Generate-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Print Student Usernames and Passwords](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5295066782747-How-To-Print-Student-Usernames-and-Passwords)
  * [How To Share a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Classroom)
  * [How to Add Coins to a Student Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8294570263067-How-to-Add-Coins-to-a-Student-Account)
  * [How to Drop Students](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12904997839643-How-to-Drop-Students)

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [OneRoster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690781233307-OneRoster)


#  OneRoster API - Pros and Cons 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Pros Cons 

Direct Connection
    Instead of going through a third party like Clever or ClassLink, your district can connect with Studies Weekly directly by setting up a roster server through your Student Information System (SIS). 

Automated Roster Updates
    After we set up the API connection between your roster and Studies Weekly Online, your roster data will be scheduled to sync on a nightly basis. If you ever need to add or remove a teacher or student, change a class, or update the credentials on an account, these updates will be automatically processed during the nightly sync. 

Single Sign-On through Google
    If the teacher and student accounts are rostered using Google-sourced emails for the usernames of the accounts, you can quickly and easily access Studies Weekly Online without the need to memorize a username or password.After verifying their Google Account, students and teachers can use one of the following options to automatically log in each time:1. Go through our [Single Sign-on interface](https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google)2. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login) and select the **LOGIN WITH GOOGLE** button. 

Google Classroom
    After setting up teacher and student accounts with Google-sourced email addresses, teachers can utilize the Google Classroom integration in Studies Weekly Online. 

Unfiltered Data
    Depending on your Student Information System (SIS) and how your district rostering admin set up their internal roster server, you may be unable to filter the data you send to Studies Weekly Online. This means that accounts can potentially be created for everyone in the SIS, even users and classrooms that are not using the Studies Weekly publication. 

Limited Visibility
    When you share your roster directly with Studies Weekly Online or through a third party service such as ClassLink or Clever, Studies Weekly Customer Support Reps can view that roster, when needed, to assist with tech troubleshooting.     But with OneRoster API connections, Customer Support Reps can only see the accounts listed in Studies Weekly Online. In cases where you are sharing users but they don't appear in Studies Weekly Online, Customer Support cannot view your roster server to help with troubleshooting.
### Articles in this section

  * [OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting)

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)


#  How To Create a Teacher Account 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teacher accounts can be created manually or through automated rostering. Each user requires an account unique to their email address.
Your district may roster teacher and student accounts, so please check with your administrator before creating an account.*****
To create a teacher account, go to [online.studiesweekly.com ](https://online.studiesweekly.com/)
  1.     1. Click the blue **Teacher** button. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035568189595)
    2. Fill in your name, state, district, and school. 
       * If you are homeschooling, please select "**Homeschool** " as your district and school.
       * If you are a charter or private school, please select "**Independent and Private Schools** " as your district, then your school’s name. 
Important Note
Once your account has been created you will **_not_** be able to change your state, district, or school unless you reach out to Customer Support.******
    3. Enter your school email address and job title. 
       * Your email address will become your username.
       * Your password will be created in a follow up step using a confirmation email. 
    4. Click **Register Account**.  ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33864367641627)
    5. A confirmation email will be sent to the email address that is now your username. Please**click the link in the email** to verify your account and complete the account creation process, including creating a password.
       * Your password must be a minimum of 5 characters and include one uppercase letter and one number.
       * If you do not receive the confirmation email and have checked your spam folder, please contact customer service at 866-311-8734.


For more information on what to do next, see the [How to Create a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom) and [How to Add Publications to a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5086944167323-How-to-Add-Publications-to-a-Classroom) articles.
***** If your district is interested in having Studies Weekly create and maintain your teacher and student accounts, please click [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-Rostering) to read more information on rostering.
****** If you need additional assistance after your account has been created please contact Customer Support at 866-311-8734, or via chat or email in the Resource Center of the Teacher Dashboard.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33864367647387)
### Articles in this section

title: Studies Weekly CSV - Pro and Cons
meta_description: Pros Cons    First Party Support Using the Studies Weekly CSV rostering service means you are working with a program that is developed...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Studies Weekly CSV](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690791956891-Studies-Weekly-CSV)


#  Studies Weekly CSV - Pro and Cons 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Pros Cons 

First Party Support
    Using the Studies Weekly CSV rostering service means you are working with a program that is developed and fully supported by Studies Weekly Online. With that, you can easily find helpful articles within this help center for setting up and troubleshooting your roster. Plus, we can more readily implement your feedback about improving the rostering process because we have full control over how the Studies Weekly CSV rostering process is handled, and are not working through a third party rostering system. 

Automated Rostering through FTP
    If your district is familiar with using a file transfer protocol (FTP) client and syncing that with the district Student Information System (SIS) data, then the rostering process through Studies Weekly CSV can be automated. This accommodates changes you make in your SIS, automatically generating new files and updating the FTP server that connects with Studies Weekly Online. Because Studies Weekly Online syncs all files on a nightly basis, your roster will be updated daily. 

Single Sign-On through Google
    If the teacher and student accounts are rostered using Google-sourced emails for the usernames of the accounts, you can quickly and easily access Studies Weekly Online without the need to memorize a username or password. After verifying their Google Account, students and teachers can use one of the following options to automatically log in each time:1. Go through our [Single Sign-on interface](https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google) 2. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login) and select the **LOGIN WITH GOOGLE** button. 

Google Classroom
    After setting up the teacher and student accounts with Google-sourced email addresses, the teachers can also utilize the Google Classroom integration in Studies Weekly Online. 

Maintain Rostered Accounts
    This is the only roster method that allows you to switch back to manual access without losing data. This lets teachers have control over adding and removing students and managing their online accounts. 

Updating Files Difficult for Manual Users
    If your district is not automating the roster using a file transfer protocol (FTP), then any time you need to add or remove a teacher, student, or classroom, you will need to re-upload all 5 CSV template files (schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, classes.csv, student_class.csv). Even if the change is just for one student, all of these CSV files are needed because they designate how your roster connects to Studies Weekly Online.     _Please find more information about the CSV formats in this[Rostering explanation article](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations). _ 

Strict Formatting
    Your CSV template files need to follow the [formatting guidelines](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations) in order for the roster to sync successfully. While we continually make updates to make this formatting less strict, it is important to know that any blank rows, extra columns, duplicate users, and unmatching IDs in the files will cause the roster to sync incorrectly. 

Administrator Accounts
    Unlike other roster methods, administrator accounts cannot be created through Studies Weekly CSV rostering. We are working to change this, but for now, this must be done manually. Email our rostering team at with a list of the users that need district/school administrative access and we will create those accounts for you.
### Articles in this section
  * [Rostering Using Studies Weekly CSV FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs)
  * [How to Roster with the Studies Weekly CSV Method](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Pro and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons)
  * [Studies Weekly CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting)

[Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering) 3. (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690791956891-Studies-Weekly-CSV) Studies Weekly CSV - Pro and Cons FollowNot yet followed by anyone Pros Cons First Party Support Using the Studies Weekly CSV rostering service means you are working with a program that is developed and fully supported by Studies Weekly Online. With that, you can easily find helpful articles within this help center for setting up and troubleshooting your roster. Plus, we can more readily implement your feedback about improving the rostering process because we have full control over how the Studies Weekly CSV rostering process is handled, and are not working through a third party rostering system. Automated Rostering through FTP If your district is familiar with using a file transfer protocol (FTP) client and syncing that with the district Student Information System (SIS) data, then the rostering process through Studies Weekly CSV can be automated. This accommodates changes you make in your SIS, automatically generating new files and updating the FTP server that connects with Studies Weekly Online. Because Studies Weekly Online syncs all files on a nightly basis, your roster will be updated daily. Single Sign-On through Google If the teacher and student accounts are rostered using Google-sourced emails for the usernames of the accounts, you can quickly and easily access Studies Weekly Online without the need to memorize a username or password. After verifying their Google Account, students and teachers can use one of the following options to automatically log in each time:1. Go through our [Single Sign-on interface](https://online.studiesweekly.com/online/google) 2. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login) and select the **LOGIN WITH GOOGLE** button. Google Classroom After setting up the teacher and student accounts with Google-sourced email addresses, the teachers can also utilize the Google Classroom integration in Studies Weekly Online. Maintain Rostered Accounts This is the only roster method that allows you to switch back to manual access without losing data. This lets teachers have control over adding and removing students and managing their online accounts. Updating Files Difficult for Manual Users If your district is not automating the roster using a file transfer protocol (FTP), then any time you need to add or remove a teacher, student, or classroom, you will need to re-upload all 5 CSV template files (schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, classes.csv, student_class.csv). Even if the change is just for one student, all of these CSV files are needed because they designate how your roster connects to Studies Weekly Online. _Please find more information about the CSV formats in this[Rostering explanation article](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations). _ Strict Formatting Your CSV template files need to follow the [formatting guidelines](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5317977142171-How-to-Navigate-Rostering-and-Integrations) in order for the roster to sync successfully. While we continually make updates to make this formatting less strict, it is important to know that any blank rows, extra columns, duplicate users, and unmatching IDs in the files will cause the roster to sync incorrectly. Administrator Accounts Unlike other roster methods, administrator accounts cannot be created through Studies Weekly CSV rostering. We are working to change this, but for now, this must be done manually. Email our rostering team at with a list of the users that need district/school administrative access and we will create those accounts for you. Articles in this section * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13114564794523-Rostering-Using-Studies-Weekly-CSV-FAQs) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/14449091656219-How-to-Roster-with-the-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Method) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13251384944795-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Pro-and-Cons) * (https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13378842283675-Studies-Weekly-CSV-Troubleshooting) Recently viewed articles * [How To Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account) * [OneRoster API - Pros and Cons](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13281484944539-OneRoster-API-Pros-and-Cons) * [How to Navigate the People Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470047594651-How-to-Navigate-the-People-Page) * [How To Share a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4862134261787-How-To-Share-a-Classroom) * [Navigating Student Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes)

#  What does the package look like? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly typically ships via FedEx, one box per teacher, the full year sent at one time. Each class will receive a blue box with the full year of student publications and teacher materials inside. The box will be labeled with the school name, address, grade level, publication, invoice number, and purchase order number.
Note
We are able to put individual teacher names on the box if you provide the teacher’s information at the time you place your order.
![new_box_design_mockup.jpg](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/360000034708)
For a walkthrough of what to do once you receive your order, watch [this video](https://cdn.studiesweekly.com/swo-3/personal_development/resources/Pd9CGvDETa5jp8QorefqkDPlpkcomLOFDggZzlfC.mp4).

[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13318348540827-Clever-Troubleshooting "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [Clever](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690797862939-Clever)


#  Clever - Troubleshooting 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article covers some of our most common questions we receive from Clever users. Additional questions can be directed to .
**Why can't the student I added to the roster log in through Clever?**
Was the student added to the roster in Clever and shared to Studies Weekly or were they just added to the Student Information System(SIS) roster? Also, we sync your roster data on a nightly basis. Check if the student was added to the roster after last night's sync. From your admin account, can you see if the most recent nightly sync was successful or is it showing up as failed? If your sync is failing, reach out to rostering@studiesweekly.com
**Why can't our teachers invite co-teachers into their classroom?**
Teachers, students, and classrooms created through automated rostering can only be updated through the roster. If a rostered teacher tries to invite a rostered or unrostered teacher to their rostered classroom, they will not be able to join. They will need to be added as a co-teacher of the classroom in Clever.
**Why do my students see classes that aren't associated with Studies Weekly in their account?**
We advise roster administrators with your district to make sure they are only sharing admins, teachers, students, and classes that are utilizing the Studies Weekly publication. If you have students with classes that are not associated with Studies Weekly in their account, please reach out to your district roster administrator and have them filter out the classrooms on the Clever roster that is shared with Studies Weekly.
**Another school in our district purchased Studies Weekly during the school year. Why don't they have access to Clever even though I have added them to the roster we are sharing with you?**
When we approve your district's request to roster with Clever, we set your Clever license count to the amount of schools you originally requested to roster with Studies Weekly Online. If you would like to add a license for another school, please reach out to rostering@studiesweekly.com.
Troubleshooting Help
If these specific questions and examples did not address your issue, please reach out to rostering@studiesweekly.com.

#  Texas Science Studies Weekly Component Navigation 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article gives information on accessing specific features in Studies Weekly Online after logging in. 
To access the Studies Weekly Online digital **Student Edition** , open the desired publication. The Table of Contents is the default view and also contains the purple button that opens Student Edition in a new browser tab. The Student Edition is only found at the week level.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37857512725403)
When teachers select the blue **Teacher Resources** button, it opens the **Teacher Resources tab** for the content you selected. This example shows, **Unit 1 > Week 2 > Activity** 2: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37857512726427)
From there, teachers will see all the resources available for the Activity, Week, Unit, and Publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37857528396315)
Within each section you can find the following resources (not all resources will be in every publication). Some items can be found at multiple levels. One possible location for each item is shown below.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/14672683544091)
TEKS Explained articles are also available online for students in grades 2-5. Look for these Extended Reading articles in the last week of a unit, after the last activity.

title: Article Comprehension Questions
meta_description: Article comprehension questions are designed to help students learn how to identify evidence from the reading to support a claim....
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/23813451785115-Article-Comprehension-Questions#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [General FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510676842651-General-FAQs)


#  Article Comprehension Questions 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Article comprehension questions are designed to help students learn how to identify evidence from the reading to support a claim. Students receive immediate feedback when completing article comprehension questions and are incentivized to complete each question correctly in as few attempts as possible in order to earn as many coins as possible.
This provides a chance to learn and improve without the pressure of being graded, which can often induce fear of failure. Unlike our Weekly Assessments, the questions on article comprehension are not tied to specific standards and are intentionally not graded.
Article comprehension questions are worth 10, 5, 3, or 1 coin(s) depending on how many tries it takes to get the correct answer.
  * 1st attempt = 10 coins
  * 2nd attempt = 5 coins 
  * 3rd attempt = 3 coins
  * Last attempt = 1 coins


There is no submit button, so students are automatically awarded these coins based on the number of attempts.
Below are additional articles that discuss comprehension questions and awarding coins.
  * [How to Monitor Student Article Questions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260803223169-How-to-Monitor-Student-Article-Questions)
  * [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay)
  * [How to Add Coins](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8294570263067-How-to-Add-Coins)

title: How to Use Accessibility Tools in Studies Weekly Online
meta_description: Students and teachers have access to accessibility tools inside Studies Weekly Online through accessiBe. Teachers can enable...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [Technology FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/6510752603035-Technology-FAQs)


#  How to Use Accessibility Tools in Studies Weekly Online 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students and teachers have access to accessibility tools inside Studies Weekly Online through . Teachers can enable accessibility features for themselves in their Account Settings of the Profile Menu. For students, teachers can enable the feature on an individual basis.
As a shortcut, Accessibility adjustments can also be opened and closed by pressing Alt-9 on PC or Option-9 on Mac.
To enable accessibility tools for a student from your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account and within the desired **Classroom Card** :
  1. Click the **People** button.
  2. Next to the student's name, you can toggle the accessibility features to **Enabled** or **Disabled**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37038707659675)
Once you enable accessibility tools for the student, they will see the **Accessibility** option in the top navigation bar.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26592433925915)
Students may need some help knowing which accessibility tools to use. We recommend that teachers log in as the student (under the classroom’s People tab) to turn on the accessibility features for that student.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37038707661211)
Teachers will see several accessibility tools and features to choose from, including Accessibility Adjustments, Content Adjustments, Color Adjustments, and Orientation Adjustments. 
Teachers can adjust their own account’s accessibility features by clicking the Accessibility button ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29908313383707) in the upper right corner of the screen; after enabling it in the Profile Menu.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37038707663899)
Note
In the event a teacher accidentally leaves their device in Read Mode, the screen will appear white with text only. To turn off Read Mode select the Accessibility button then scroll down and click the **Read Mode** button. The screen will revert back as soon as it is selected. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29908313386523) ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29908341354779)
To learn more about each of the accessibility features, please view the attached overview from accessiBe below.
  * [accessiBe Technology Overview.pdf](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/10564203020315)
(2 MB)


### Articles in this section
  * [Utilizing Google Translate in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/38782745566235-Utilizing-Google-Translate-in-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [How to Use Accessibility Tools in Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/10562670660251-How-to-Use-Accessibility-Tools-in-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [Which Question Types have the Audio Reader Function? ​​](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9340334621595-Which-Question-Types-have-the-Audio-Reader-Function)
  * [How to Clear Your Cache and Cookies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416415911963-How-to-Clear-Your-Cache-and-Cookies)

[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Additional Features](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/24192808156571-Additional-Features)


#  Navigating the Family Dashboard 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Parents, guardians, and caregivers can be given view-only access to see everything a student sees within their Studies Weekly Online account, including coins, notifications, Notes, the To Do list, and progress within Publications.
Accept the Email Invitation Navigate the Family Dashboard
When a teacher sends a family email invitation, the family member will receive an email from Studies Weekly titled "Studies Weekly Family Invite."
  1.     1. Click the link inside the email to accept the invitation. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37860603896603)
    2. After the link is selected, the family member will fill out a form to register for a family account. Fill out all fields and click **Register Account.**
Passwords must contain a minimum of 5 characters, including one capital letter and one number.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37860618951579)
    3. Once registered, click the link to log in at [online.studiesweekly.com.](https://online.studiesweekly.com/)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27068063952283)
    4. As a reminder the username is the family member’s email. Enter the password you created and click **Log In**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38790315121819)


Once logged in to the Family Dashboard, the family member will see the student(s) assigned to the email account. 
  * Each student assigned to the family email will have a card on the Family Dashboard.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27068037034651)
  * Select a student card to have view-only access to the student’s account, including the student’s assigned **Classrooms.** Click the **Dropdown Menu** to navigate to the coursework of another student that is assigned to the family account.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27068037039515)
  * Use the **Return to Family Dashboard** button in the upper right corner to go back to the main landing page. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27068037044379)


Some family members may benefit from enabling Google Translate. This can be done by opening the **Account Settings** under the **User Profile** menu. Then select the **Google Translate Toggle**.
When Google Translate is enabled, all text on Studies Weekly Online pages will be translated. However, any embedded videos with audio and text highlighting within the Audio Reader will remain in English.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38790315123611)
The page will automatically refresh and the Google Translate option will appear in the top navigation bar. Use the **Select Language** bar to change the language. 
![g trans GIF.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38790315124379)
To quickly turn off translation for the site, use the **Options** dropdown above the top navigation bar and choose **Turn off translation for this site** or select the **X**.
Visit the [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard) article to learn more.
Note
If you want family access, please reach out to your student's teacher. Teachers can find instructions to send the family email invitation in the [How to Edit Student Accounts](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5294959965339-How-To-Edit-Student-Accounts) article under the **Edit Individual Students** tab. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How Do I Change My Password?](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000669128-How-Do-I-Change-My-Password)
  * [Sign Up for the Studies Weekly Newsletter and Free Events](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24537856436123-Sign-Up-for-the-Studies-Weekly-Newsletter-and-Free-Events)
  * [Navigating the Family Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard)
  * [Professional Development Publication for Teachers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24657758955419-Professional-Development-Publication-for-Teachers)

title: OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting
meta_description: This article covers some of the most common questions we receive from OneRoster CSV users. Additional questions can be directed to...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Rostering](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18714794293787-Rostering)
  3. [OneRoster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18690781233307-OneRoster)


#  OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
This article covers some of the most common questions we receive from OneRoster CSV users. Additional questions can be directed to .
**My student is rostered, why can't they log in?**
1. Check the CSV files to confirm that the student was on them and was shared to Studies Weekly Online.2. Check when they were added to the roster. Were they added after last night's sync? (Remember, we sync your roster data on a nightly basis).3. Contact your district rostering administrator. They will need to log in through their rostering admin account, to check if the most recent sync was successful. If the sync failed, they can reach out to .
**Why can't our teachers invite co-teachers into their classroom?**
Teachers, students, and classrooms created through automated rostering can only be updated through the OneRoster system. If a rostered teacher tries to invite a teacher to their rostered classroom, the new teacher won’t be able to join. They need to be added as a co-teacher of the classroom through OneRoster.
**Why do my students see classes in their account that aren't associated with Studies Weekly?**
If your students see other classes besides your Studies Weekly classroom, it is because your district rostering admin shared this information in their Student Information System (SIS) rostering data given to Studies Weekly.Depending on the type of roster server the district is using, your district may be unable to filter out data from the SIS when we sync your roster files each night. There are some roster servers and SIS servers that don't provide the ability to filter the data that is being shared to the CSV files that are uploaded to the Studies Weekly FTP server. Because of this, there may be teachers, students, and classrooms that are created in Studies Weekly Online for users that are not using the Studies Weekly publication.If they have the ability to do so, the district roster admin should filter out any teachers, students, and classrooms that aren't utilizing Studies Weekly Online before sharing their OneRoster CSV file.
Troubleshooting Help
If these specific questions and examples did not address your issue, please reach out to [rostering@studiesweekly.com](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/rostering@studiesweekly.com).

  * [OneRoster API - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13383443801371-OneRoster-API-Troubleshooting)

title: How to Manage Assessments
meta_description: Studies Weekly Online offers multiple ways to assess students’ progress. After each week within a Unit, there is a Weekly Assessment,...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17842140476827-How-to-Manage-Assessments#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F17842140476827-How-to-Manage-Assessments "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647138470811-Publications)


#  How to Manage Assessments 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Studies Weekly Online offers multiple ways to assess students’ progress.
After each week within a Unit, there is a Weekly Assessment, found in the Table of Contents. To familiarize yourself with the Table of Contents, visit the [How to Navigate the Table of Contents](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5465616070427-How-to-Navigate-the-Table-of-Contents) article in the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).
Before students take assessments, they prepare by answering formative comprehension questions at the end of each article. Students earn coins by answering the questions and can use their coins to play the embedded online games called [Study Buddies](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/9339007403931-How-to-Play-Study-Buddies) and [Explorers](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5481133657115-How-to-Play-Explorers).
Once students have completed all the Weekly Assessments, they will be ready to take the summative Unit Assessment. Not every publication will have a Unit Assessment. 
**Preview and Edit the Assessment**
Teachers can preview assessments from the Table of Contents of the publication.
In the Table of Contents, navigate to the desired week and click the **Assessment**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638223474587)
This will open the **Student View** of the assessment. Here, teachers can preview the questions and take the assessment as a student. If you would like to make changes, click the **Teacher Actions** dropdown, then select the **+Customized Content** button. This will create a copy of the assessment so it can be edited.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31052748030363)
Questions can be removed, reorganized, and additional questions can be added. For detailed instructions on creating customized content visit the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article.
**Assign the Assessment**
By default the assessment is **enabled** and visible to the students in the selected classroom. To disable or make it hidden, click the blue toggle. It will turn gray and be hidden from students. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37638228334747)
**Grade the Assessment**
Assessments are automatically graded, but teachers may need to grade an open response question. To grade open response questions, navigate to Grade and follow the steps in the article [How to Navigate the Grade Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13879825760155-How-to-Navigate-the-Grade-Section).

  3. [Student Experience](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5651306494619-Student-Experience)


#  How Students View Their Scores 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Students can see some of their scores immediately after submitting activities and assessments. If the submission has questions that require teacher grading (e.g., open response), then students will see the message “Some questions still need to be graded.” Once the teacher grades it, students can view their score online.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38793074740507)
#### To see their overall scores for each week, students can:
  1. Click on a publication in a Class Card or click the **View All Publications** button.
  2. Once a publication has been selected, the **Table of Contents** will open and students will see which assessments they have taken and their percentage score. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38793067012379)


#### To see their scores for each teacher created task, students can:
  1. Go to the **To Do** tab.
  2. Click the **Graded** tab.
  3. Click the **Review** button on the task they want to see.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31266449074459)


#### When reviewing their submissions, students will see the number of attempts, date and score. For each submission they will be able to:
  * See questions they answered correctly in green.
  * See questions they answered incorrectly in red and the correct answer.
  * See any open response questions their teacher needs to grade.
  * Comment on their response or score by typing in the text box and clicking the send button.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26945887221915)


Visit the [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes) article to learn more.

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36683589166363-May-2025-Product-Updates#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center

What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Studies Weekly Online Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/15075446043675-Studies-Weekly-Online-Updates)
  3. [2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025)


#  May 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Updated Design of Labeling Question**
The Labeling question type has been updated to improve the student experience. 
  * The size of the image and label boxes were adjusted to ensure the student no longer has to scroll right to view the answer options.
  * A maximum of 6 labels are allowed for new questions.
  * Drop zones are highlighted in purple when students hover over the dot.
  * Drop zone dots turn from black to blue when a label has been dropped.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36683589163163)
**Mobile Experience - Drawing Tool & Digital Printables**
For the best user experience on mobile devices (as a student or teacher), viewing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions is limited to tablets, laptops, or desktops, and users will see an alert.
  * Display Alert for student: “This is only available on a tablet, laptop, or desktop.” on Drawing and Digital Printable questions. 
    * **Submit** button is also disabled on Mobile Device, for any questions containing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions. For the best user experience on mobile devices (as a student or teacher), viewing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions is limited to tablets, laptops, or desktops, and users will see an alert.
    * ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37022184356635)
  * Display Alert for teacher: “Please complete and submit on tablet, laptop, or desktop.” at top of page below the save alert IF any question contains a drawing or Digital Printable question. 
    * ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37022184360475)


**Notification for Publication Expiration**
Teachers will receive a notification 30 days before the expiration of a publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035202146843)
**Drawing Tool and Digital Printables have Vertical Text**
When adding text to Digital PDFs, a blank canvas, or an image using the Drawing Tool, students can select the down arrow to make the text vertical.
**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37400569021595)**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37400569023259)
**Drawing Tool and Digital Printables have Full Screen Mode**
A full screen button was added for Digital Printable and Drawing Tool questions that allow students to expand the canvas while using a tablet, Chromebook, or laptop. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37451768384667)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37451768386075)
**Improved Global Search**
Search results are now divided into 2 tabs, **Media** and **Publications**. The **Refine Search** options have been moved to the right side of the screen.
Visit the Help Center article [How To Search for Articles and Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media) to learn more. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37488722027035)

[2024-2025](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/21603605749275-2024-2025) May 2025 Product Updates FollowNot yet followed by anyone **Updated Design of Labeling Question** The Labeling question type has been updated to improve the student experience. * The size of the image and label boxes were adjusted to ensure the student no longer has to scroll right to view the answer options. * A maximum of 6 labels are allowed for new questions. * Drop zones are highlighted in purple when students hover over the dot. * Drop zone dots turn from black to blue when a label has been dropped. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36683589163163) **Mobile Experience - Drawing Tool & Digital Printables** For the best user experience on mobile devices (as a student or teacher), viewing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions is limited to tablets, laptops, or desktops, and users will see an alert. * Display Alert for student: “This is only available on a tablet, laptop, or desktop.” on Drawing and Digital Printable questions. * **Submit** button is also disabled on Mobile Device, for any questions containing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions. For the best user experience on mobile devices (as a student or teacher), viewing the Drawing Tool or Digital Printable questions is limited to tablets, laptops, or desktops, and users will see an alert. * ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37022184356635) * Display Alert for teacher: “Please complete and submit on tablet, laptop, or desktop.” at top of page below the save alert IF any question contains a drawing or Digital Printable question. * ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37022184360475) **Notification for Publication Expiration** Teachers will receive a notification 30 days before the expiration of a publication. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035202146843) **Drawing Tool and Digital Printables have Vertical Text** When adding text to Digital PDFs, a blank canvas, or an image using the Drawing Tool, students can select the down arrow to make the text vertical. **![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37400569021595)** ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37400569023259) **Drawing Tool and Digital Printables have Full Screen Mode** A full screen button was added for Digital Printable and Drawing Tool questions that allow students to expand the canvas while using a tablet, Chromebook, or laptop. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37451768384667)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37451768386075) **Improved Global Search** Search results are now divided into 2 tabs, **Media** and **Publications**. The **Refine Search** options have been moved to the right side of the screen. #  February 2025 Product Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**New Customized Content Experience **
Teachers will find the new experience for creating Customized Content much easier with the 3-step process. Follow the new steps [here](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content). 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34239060823963)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34239039995675)![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/34239039996571)
Visit the [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content) article to learn more.
**Access Limit When Sharing Customized Content**
When teachers share their Customized Content with other Studies Weekly users, the link will expire after 60 days. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33796604182555)
Teachers can stop sharing the link with users before the link automatically expires after 60 days. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33796604189467)
Visit the [Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher) article to learn more.
