title: How to Create and Share District Customized Content
meta_description: Users with a district admin credential have the ability to create Customized Content and share it across the district. Along with the...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [District and School Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/18991469854747-District-and-School-Administrators)
  3. [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators)


#  How to Create and Share District Customized Content 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Users with a district admin credential have the ability to create Customized Content and share it across the district. Along with the current Customized Content features available for teachers, district admins have the ability to leave separate instructions for students and teachers.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account, select **District Customized Content** from the **District Admin** tab in the primary navigation bar at the top of the screen. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178023963)
Create Share Edit Clone
Every piece of District Customized Content will appear on the **Customized Content** list and be visible for all district admins. The District Customized Content will not appear for teachers **until** it is shared with them by a district admin. It will not appear for students until it is assigned by their teacher. 
**Step 1 of 2: Details**
From the District Customized Content page, select the **Create Customized Content** button in the upper right corner. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178025755)
Use the following image and instructions to create content for the district. 
#### **Step 1 of 2: Details**
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459222717211)
  1. Choose a **Title** that will be visible to students.
  2. Add **Instructions** students will be able to follow.
  3. If you wish to set a future Start Date, turn off the **Immediately Available** toggle. Then choose your dates and times.
     *        * The default Due Date is one week from the Start Date. 
       * The optional Start Time and Due Time will default to 12:00 AM and 11:59 PM when the Immediately Available toggle is disabled.
  4. Choose whether to allow teachers to: 
     *        * Edit the District Customized Content (title and instructions only).
       * Edit the Start/Due dates.
       * Grade the Customized Content. This box will be required for certain questions types that require teacher grading.
  5. Choose a **Grade** level for the content. whether allow teachers to:
  6. Select a **Folder** to organize the content so it is easier to find.
  7. Add Distribution Instructions for teachers.
  8. Click **Next** in the bottom left corner to move on to Step 2 adding content.


**Step 2 of 2: Content**
Select the **+Add** button to insert your own **Question** , **Item** , choose from **Add Previously Created Customized Content** questions, Studies Weekly created **Digital Printables** , or the **Question Bank**. For a deeper dive into the question types visit the [Understanding Question Types](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22275497378587) article.
If you would like to add Open Response question types, consider who will grade the responses. If the box remains unchecked for teachers to grade District Customized Content, those question types will be disabled. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459222718235)
[![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31811504641563)](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher)
  1. Once you make your selection, fill in all the fields for the question type and select **Save**. (Questions are added one at a time.)
  2. To add additional questions or items, click the **+Add** button..
  3. Click **Create** to save. This does not share the content with teachers or students.


Sample Multiple Choice question: ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459222722075)
**Utilizing Folders**
District admins are encouraged to create Folders to house the Customized Content items they create. Folders can be created before, during, or after creating Customized Content. Creators can also have a Folder within a Folder. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178032027)
Studies Weekly recommends titling your Folder(s) for specific content areas, schools, or for the author of the content. After naming your Folder(s) and assigning a color, click **Create**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459222724891)
Folders can be edited or removed later by using the **3 dots menu** next to the name of the Folder. Only empty Folders can be **Removed**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178033307)
Customized Content items not assigned to a Folder will be shown under the Customized Content list.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178034971)
As the school year goes on district admins may need to use the search bar or filter options to locate specific items. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459222730139)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178036763)
District Customized Content can be shared individually with teachers or with all teachers assigned to selected schools containing a specific activated publication.
Note
Teachers will receive an email and a notification (in their Studies Weekly Online Account Dashboard) that a district admin has shared District Customized Content with them. The content will then need to be assigned to their classes. Visit the [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content) article to learn more. 
To share District Customized Content, navigate to the **Customized Content** page and click the **Share** button in the bottom right corner of the piece of content.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502185878043)
A pop-up modal will appear containing the sharing options. Once the content has been shared, the questions cannot be modified.
Success
If a district admin attempts to edit the already shared Customized Content, a pop-up modal will appear, Click **OK** and a new copy will be created. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502170791067)
The original can be hidden by the district admin using the Visibility Toggle. Read more about the Visibility Toggle in the**Edit** tab of this article.
Use the following image and correlating options below to share District Customized Content. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/26950018723611)
  1. Copy the shareable link and send it to any users in the district via email or other digital communication. If this option is chosen, the recipients must select which class(es) will be**assigned** the District Customized Content.
  2. Choose a publication to filter out extra schools or classes. Publications can be filtered by grade level to narrow down the list. 
  3. Select which schools will receive the content. When schools are selected, teachers in those schools are automatically selected in the next step and then can be filtered.
  4. Choose which teachers will receive the content. If this option is chosen, the recipients must then select one or more of their classes to receive the content before it is visible to students. As the content is assigned by teachers, the number in the **Assigned** bubble will change. 


When finished with your selections, click **Save** for the District Customized Content to be shared or**Cancel** to start over. After clicking **Save** , a notification will appear at the top of the screen confirming that sharing was successful.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/18987561337883)
Recommendation
District admins can see which classrooms teachers have assigned the District Customized Content to by selecting **Assigned** in the **three dots** menu.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/36459178038427)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502185890075)
There are two options for editing District Customized Content, please review each option before sharing what you have created with teachers. 
Content can be removed from the Customized Content list as long as it has not been shared with any teachers. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502170802971)
Non-Shared
If content has not been shared yet, you may edit everything within the District Customized Content. Navigate to the District Customized Content you want to edit and click the **title** or find the Edit button in the**three dots** menu as shown above. 
The District Customized Content will appear on screen. Make the necessary edits (including adding more questions) then select**Save** in the bottom right corner. 
The content is now ready to be shared. 
Already Shared with Teachers
If District Customized Content has already been shared with teachers, the only things that can be edited are the **Title** , **Dates** , and **Times**. If you try to remove or add questions, or change point values, a pop-up modal appears stating that the content can no longer be modified.
However, you do have the option to create a new copy and share the edited version by clicking **OK** on the pop-up modal. Then follow the steps above as if you were creating new content.
If you do not want to create a new copy, click the **X**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502185896603)
Once the new version of District Customized Content is created, you will want to make the original copy hidden to teachers and students by toggling the **Visibility Toggle** off (from blue to gray) to prevent confusion. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502185878043)
If the **Visibility Toggle** is changed to gray, this will remove it from the teacher’s Customized Content list and the student’s To Do list. The box around the piece of content will also appear grayed out on the district admin’s Customized Content list as shown. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/21408977026715)
The new copy is now ready to be shared with teachers. 
If teachers select their **Notification Bell** and click the original shared District Customized Content, they see a message stating it has been disabled, ensuring it is no longer accessible. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502170808603)
Cloning creates a duplicate version of the selected Customized Content. All of the original information will carry over including**Instructions** , dates and times, **Allow Teachers to** preferences, **Grade** , **Distribution Instructions** , **Randomize Questions** , and content **Questions.** The Clone can remain “as is” and be saved, or be edited as if it were newly created Customized Content. If the Due Date has expired, a new Start Date and Due Date will need to be chosen. 
Navigate to the District Customized Content you want to Clone, then find the **Clone** button in the**three dots** menu.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502170811291)
The content will open and show the title has automatically been updated to reflect it is a Clone.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/27310121072923)
Titles can be edited with additional information, along with everything else as if creating new Customized Content. Make the necessary edits (including adding more questions) then select**Save** in the bottom right corner. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31502170814619)
The Clone is now ready to be shared with teachers. 
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role)
  * [How to Create and Share District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content)
  * [District Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report)
  * [District Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report)
  * [Manual Sync of District Roster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003-Manual-Sync-of-District-Roster)


## Recently viewed articles
  * [February 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33796088207643-February-2025-Product-Updates)
  * [May 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36683589166363-May-2025-Product-Updates)
  * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores)
  * [How to Manage Assessments](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17842140476827-How-to-Manage-Assessments)
  * [OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting)


##  Can't find what you're looking for? 
####  Let us help you! 
[ Contact Support ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)
© Studies Weekly
Theme by 
###### Support hours: 6 a.m. - 6 p.m. MT.

Articles in this section * [How to Navigate the District Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13277448223003-How-to-Navigate-the-District-Admin-Role) * [How to Create and Share District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18958759876891-How-to-Create-and-Share-District-Customized-Content) * [District Customized Content Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19741970914203-District-Customized-Content-Report) * [District Admin Standards Report](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36057798003739-District-Admin-Standards-Report) * [Manual Sync of District Roster](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/30001674591003-Manual-Sync-of-District-Roster) Recently viewed articles * [February 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/33796088207643-February-2025-Product-Updates) * [May 2025 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/36683589166363-May-2025-Product-Updates) * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores) * [How to Manage Assessments](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17842140476827-How-to-Manage-Assessments) * [OneRoster CSV - Troubleshooting](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13540129023899-OneRoster-CSV-Troubleshooting)

title: How to Search for Articles and Media
meta_description: Teachers can search for media referenced throughout Studies Weekly Online, including the Teacher Edition and the article content of...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools)
  3. [Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006690854-Teaching-Tools)


#  How to Search for Articles and Media 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can search for media referenced throughout Studies Weekly Online, including the Teacher Edition and the article content of available publications.
From your [Studies Weekly Online](https://online.studiesweekly.com/) account:
  1. Select the **Search** button in the upper right corner. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457579551899)
  2. Type a subject or keyword into the search bar at the top of the page and press**Enter** on the keyboard (or click the **Search** button).
  3. Use the filters to narrow down your search by **Language** and/or **Media** type.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457565422107)
This example search yielded 89 results, which include 46 media files and 43 publications.
  4. Select a file to add it to Customized Content or Google Classroom. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457565424411)


**Example Search: Find Spanish Articles**
In this example, we want to locate an article about Thomas Jefferson in Spanish.
  1. Type “Thomas Jefferson” in the search bar. 
  2. Press**Enter**(or the **Search** button).
  3. Select the **Spanish** filter under Languages.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457565427867) This example search yielded 15 results, which include 14 articles and one video.


**Example Search: Find Images**
In this example, we want to locate images relating to mental health.
  1. Type “mental health” in the search bar.
  2. Press**Enter**(or the **Search** button).
  3. Select the **Image** filter under Media. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457579561755)
This example search yielded 22 image results.


**Example Search: Find Audio**
In this example, we want to locate audio for mockingbirds.
  1. Type “mockingbird” in the search bar.
  2. Press**Enter**(or the **Search** button).
  3. Select the **Audio** filter under Media.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457579565211) This example search yielded 2 audio results.


**Example Search: Find Videos**
Teachers have access to over 100 videos to enhance their students' learning experience. 
In this example, we want to locate videos relating to World War II.
  1. Type “World War II” in the search bar.
  2. Press**Enter**(or the **Search** button).
  3. Select the **Video** filter under Media.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37457579567259)This example search yielded 150 video results.
Teachers can find lesson-specific video links in the lesson plans located in Teacher Resources. There are also related videos in the Explore More section below articles in a publication. (See the [Explore More Pages](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5468975162267-Explore-More-Pages) article.)
![SWO_3.0_SS_videos_Explore_More.png](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/6695565568923)
Note
Not every article or lesson plan will have related videos.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Print Studies Weekly Online Materials](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/18385714221723-How-to-Print-Studies-Weekly-Online-Materials)
  * [Materials Calculator for Publications](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/29399943306011-Materials-Calculator-for-Publications)
  * [How to Create “Words to Know” Vocabulary Notebooks](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406842650267-How-to-Create-Words-to-Know-Vocabulary-Notebooks)
  * [How to Search for Articles and Media](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007515393-How-to-Search-for-Articles-and-Media)

#  Which websites does my IT department need to whitelist? 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
To ensure your district/school has full access to all Studies Weekly videos, your IT department will need to whitelist the following:
  1. s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com
  2. .studiesweekly.com
  3. releases.flowplayer.org
  4. code.jquery.com
  5. cdn.jsdelivr.net
  6. stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com
  7. maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com
  8. pro.fontawesome.com
  9. apis.google.com
  10. www.googletagmanager.com
  11. www.google-analytics.com
  12. classroom.google.com
  13. www.gstatic.com
  14. ssl.gstatic.com
  15. fonts.googleapis.com
  16. http://acsbapp.com/

  2. [FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002656603675-FAQs)
  3. [Company FAQs](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/38719571510555-Company-FAQs)


#  2023 Florida Publication Information 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
In kindergarten and first grade, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. will be referenced as “Martin Luther King Jr.” to align with developmental readability for those grades. 
In grades second and above, when making a reference about the person and leader, he will be identified as Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
For all grades, when making a reference to the federal holiday, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day will be used (officially Birthday of Martin Luther King Jr.).

markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Getting Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002200493-Getting-Started)
  3. [Essential Functions](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006691254-Essential-Functions)


#  Navigate Studies Weekly Online 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can create classrooms, assign publications, and manage student accounts. They can also view and Grade student submissions, view Reports, create Customized Content, and access [Online Teaching Tools](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360002819354-Online-Teaching-Tools), including resources, training videos, and professional development opportunities.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38126398339483)
Visit the [Teacher Section](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher) to learn about these features plus many more. 
There are four additional user account levels in Studies Weekly Online and each role has specific access. Read about each level below to learn the differences. 
**Student**
Students can see the content assigned to them by a teacher, including their progress, scores, and coins. 
Visit the [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard) article to learn more.![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30675726711835)
**Family**
A **Family Email** can be added to a student(s) account giving parents or guardians access to view student(s) progress in the Family Dashboard. Family accounts can only be created by invitation from a teacher or admin. 
Visit the [Navigating the Family Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19928409446555-Navigating-the-Family-Dashboard) article for more information. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30675726714779)
**School Admin**
School Admins have all the same access a teacher does with some additional features. 
  * Access to view all of the Students, Staff, and Classrooms connected to their school.
  * A Usage Report that shows the number of times each teacher and student has logged in.
  * They have the ability to log in as any teacher (or student) in their school for detailed classroom and student data. 


For a full explanation visit the [How To Navigate the School Admin Role](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/12909790796187-How-To-Navigate-the-School-Admin-Role) article.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035909695771)
**District Admin**
District Admins have all of the same access as a School Admin with some additional features. 
  * Access to view all of the Students, Staff, and Classrooms connected to their organization. 
  * The Usage Report will show all the schools connected to the district. 
  * They can create District Customized Content to be shared precisely across the organization. 


For a full explanation visit the [District Administrators](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/18991507231131-District-Administrators) section in the Help Center.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37035909701147)
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Get Started](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034959674-How-to-Get-Started)
  * [How District and School Administrators Can Register](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012204533-How-District-and-School-Administrators-Can-Register)
  * [How To Create a Teacher Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115016060747-How-To-Create-a-Teacher-Account)
  * [How to Log In to Your Online Account](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5995955795355-How-to-Log-In-to-Your-Online-Account)
  * [Instructions for Teachers Using Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045172794-Instructions-for-Teachers-Using-Studies-Weekly-Online)
  * [Navigate Studies Weekly Online](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5187528026779-Navigate-Studies-Weekly-Online)

#  April 2024 Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
The majority of April we focused on backend product updates. 
**Drawing Tool**
Students will begin encountering questions that give them access to an interactive Drawing Tool. They will be able to write, draw, highlight, and add shapes to a blank canvas or on top of images
![2024-04-19_10-46-48.gif](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/25415468273435)

#  How Students Access Retakes 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers may choose to allow their students multiple retakes of submissions. Students have easy access to the retake opportunity, as well as previous submissions of Assessments, Customized Content, Crosswords and Misspilled.
When a teacher has allowed a retake the student will see a number attached to the Notification Bell in the upper right corner. To view their notifications, students will click the **Notification Bell**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31268396887835)
Retakes can be opened by clicking the alert. Clicking the**envelope** will mark the item as read but it will not open the item. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/20106291615899)
#### Assessments
When a teacher has allowed an Assessment retake, the student can access the retake through the **Notification Bell** or click the **RETAKE ASSESSMENT** button in the Table of Contents. After the **RETAKE ASSESSMENT** button is clicked, the assessment will open.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/38793149970331)
Students may open a previous submission by clicking the blue number (representing each submission) or click the **RETAKE** button to proceed. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31267521327899)
#### Customized Content
When a teacher has allowed a Customized Content retake, the student can access the retake through the **Notification Bell** or by going to the **To Do** tab and clicking **RETAKE**.
After the **RETAKE** button is clicked, the previous submissions will open. Students may open a previous submission by clicking the blue number (representing each submission) or click the **RETAKE** button to proceed. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31267547144219)
#### Crossword and Misspilled
When a teacher has allowed a Crossword or Misspilled retake, the student can access the retake through the **Notification Bell** or the **Table of Contents**. After a student clicks to open it, the previous Submissions will appear and the **RETAKE** button. 
Students may choose to look at previous submissions by clicking on the blue number (representing each submission) or click the **RETAKE** button for another attempt. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31267547148187)
#### Article Questions and Activities
When a teacher has allowed an Article Question or Activity retake, the student can access the retake through the **Notification Bell** or the **Table of Contents**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/31267521336347)
For additional information, view the [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Student Dashboard](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5470868821531-How-to-Navigate-the-Student-Dashboard)
  * [How To View Weekly Progress](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6327022232219-How-To-View-Weekly-Progress)
  * [How Students View Their Scores](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045929314-How-Students-View-Their-Scores)
  * [How Students Access Retakes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15977927543579-How-Students-Access-Retakes)
  * [Navigating Student Notes](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13891174934683-Navigating-Student-Notes)

title: Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher
meta_description: Teachers can share Customized Content with other teachers and admins using Studies Weekly Online. Once shared, the invitation will be...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content)


#  Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Teachers can share Customized Content with other teachers and admins using Studies Weekly Online. Once shared, the invitation will be active for 60 days. When a receiving user opens the shared Customized Content via a link in the **Notification Bell** (inside Studies Weekly Online) or in their email, it creates a copy of the original Customized Content that now belongs to them. 
After assigning it to any of their Classrooms, the user may make edits and customize their copy. (Admins may need to create a Classroom if they do not have one already. Students don't need to be added to this classroom to use Customized Content.)
#### **Share Customized Content:**
  1. Navigate to the **Student View** of the Customized Content you wish to share. 
  2. Click the **Teachers Actions** button.
  3. Select the option to the **Share with Teacher**.


![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33797463357851)
Enter the email address of each user you want to share your Customized Content with then select **Share**. The email address(es) must have an active account in Studies Weekly Online.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33684508523803)
A confirmation will appear on screen letting you know the content was successfully shared.
Teachers can stop sharing the link with users before the link automatically expires after 60 days. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33684508526491)
#### **Assign the Shared Customized Content**
To access the shared Customized content, the receiving user will click the link in their email or from the **Notification Bell**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29260876240411)
Select the content shared by your colleague to assign it to your classroom(s). ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28533002541083)
Once the Customized Content is selected, the **Classrooms** page opens. Follow the on-screen instructions and select the classroom(s) to assign the content, then click **Add**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29260876246555)
Once the **Add** button is selected, an additional option allows you to place the content in a publication or to have it only appear in the students To Do list. After making your selection a confirmation box appears on-screen and will now be available in your Customized Content list as well as for students. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28533194075547)
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/28533194079771)
Select the**title** to view, edit, or grade the Customized Content. To learn more about editing Customized content visit the[ Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647285109915-Customized-Content) section of the [Help Center](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us).
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Customized Content Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5469286703515-How-to-Navigate-the-Customized-Content-Page)
  * [How to Create Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4861136293787-How-to-Create-Customized-Content)
  * [How to Add Previously Created Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/8423353400475-How-to-Add-Previously-Created-Customized-Content)
  * [Sharing Customized Content Teacher to Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/27827065424283-Sharing-Customized-Content-Teacher-to-Teacher)
  * [How Teachers Assign District Customized Content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/19015898021403-How-Teachers-Assign-District-Customized-Content)
  * [Digital Printable Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/24705559700379-Digital-Printable-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Spot Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/15527064098075-Hot-Spot-Question-Type)
  * [Hot Text Question Type](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/34831335242395-Hot-Text-Question-Type)

title: How to Use the Join Code
meta_description: Each classroom has an auto-generated Join Code. Teachers can distribute Join Codes as a simple way to add students to a classroom. To...
markdown:
[Skip to main content](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code#main-content)
[ ![Logo](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/theming_assets/01HZPQNPCF6TH06BKZP5T2WDSG) ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us "Home")
Help Center 
[Submit a request](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) [ Sign in ](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.studiesweekly.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code "Opens a dialog")
What can we help you with? 
  1. [Studies Weekly](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us)
  2. [Teacher](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/categories/7002728294043-Teacher)
  3. [Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/5647143859355-Classrooms)


#  How to Use the Join Code 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
Each classroom has an auto-generated Join Code. Teachers can distribute Join Codes as a simple way to add students to a classroom.
To view the Join Code, navigate to the Classroom and open a publication. In the breadcrumbs, select the dropdown arrow next to the classroom name.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/33866125093275)
**Generate a new join code**
Select the dropdown box next to the name of the classroom. Click the **refresh** button![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29518597053723)to the right of the join code to generate a new code. The **eye** button![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29518597058075)will allow you to view the Join Code.
If you generate a new Join Code, students will not be able to use the old one to join the classroom. Be sure to distribute the new code as needed.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/30860458882075)
**Distributing the join code**
Copy the Join Code from the classroom sub-navigation bar. Display it in your classroom or email it to your students.
**Printing the Join Code**
From the **Classrooms** page, select **People**![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/29518611917467) in the left side navigation bar.
Click the **three dots** in the Students bar and select **Generate Student Join Codes** from the dropdown.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040487474715)
Enter the number of students that will need a join code.
Click **Print Join Codes**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040464754331)
The codes will be generated in a new browser tab.
Use the **Click to Print** button at the top of the page to open the print dialogue box on your device.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040487480603)
Students who have already registered Students who need to register
If the student is already registered, they will use the join code after they have logged in.
  1. On the Student's Classrooms page, click the Add Classroom button.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040464759835)
  2. Enter the join code and click **Add Classroom**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040487485979)
  3. The classroom will show up on the Classrooms page.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040487486875)


  1. Go to [online.studiesweekly.com/login](https://online.studiesweekly.com/login) and then click **Student**. 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040464772891)
  2. On the registration page make sure you are on the **Students** user type.
  3. Enter the Join Code provided by your teacher.
  4. Click **Verify Code**.
     *        * If the code is valid, type in your name, username, and password.
       * If the code is not valid, contact your teacher for a new code.
  5. Click **Register Account**.
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/37040487497371)


For more information, see the [How to Add Students to Your Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5088800547611-How-to-Add-Students-to-Your-Classroom) article.
### Articles in this section
  * [How to Navigate the Classrooms Page](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/5343280936475-How-to-Navigate-the-Classrooms-Page)
  * [How To Create a Classroom](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/4860971833883-How-To-Create-a-Classroom)
  * [How to Edit, Deactivate, and Reactivate Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6085131694747-How-to-Edit-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Classrooms)
  * [Viewing Student Progress in Inactive Classrooms](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/22608582033819-Viewing-Student-Progress-in-Inactive-Classrooms)
  * [Article/Explore More Comprehension Question Delay](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/13498264983707-Article-Explore-More-Comprehension-Question-Delay)
  * [How to Use the Join Code](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6946205476379-How-to-Use-the-Join-Code)
  * [How to Turn Off/On Games](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/6969890508187-How-to-Turn-Off-On-Games)

  3. [2023-2024](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/sections/15075843254427-2023-2024)


#  January 2024 Updates 
FollowNot yet followed by anyone
**Access to Teacher Edition PDF and Teacher Resources**
Teachers now have quick access to the resources available for a selected week on the Table of Contents and within and article. When the **Teacher** button is selected within an article, they have the option to choose the Teacher Resources or the weekly Teacher Edition PDF (if available). For clarity on the Teacher Resources and Teacher Edition PDF visit the Help Desk article titled [How to Access and Navigate Teacher Resources](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/17772923416603-How-to-Access-and-Navigate-Teacher-Resources). 
![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22565522768027)
**Languages Identified in Teacher Resources and New Callout**
To make finding resources easier, Natalia, a character in Studies Weekly Online, was added to the top of the navigational bar alerting teachers to check out the Week, Unit, and Publication sections.
Printables and Publication Resources now show the available language. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22574452582171)
**Creating Customized Content Crosswords**
Creating Crosswords is now easier than ever. The puzzle is now on the left side of the screen for better visibility. Full step-by-step instructions are coming soon in a new article. ![](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/article_attachments/22569899253915)
### Articles in this section
  * [June 2024 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/26305893190811-June-2024-Product-Updates)
  * [May 2024 Product Updates](https://support.studiesweekly.com/hc/en-us/articles/25618642224411-May-2024-Product-Updates)
